description:
Monkey King is based on the character of the Monkey King from the classic Chinese novel Journey to the West. Most Westerners are more familiar with the character of Goku from the hit 80's anime "Dragon Ball," who was very loosely based on the Monkey King character. The game is set during the Peach Grove chapter of the original novel, where the monkey king sneaks off from his duties to steal immortality peaches from the gods.

The game is a side-scrolling platform game and features bright colourful graphics.

sample_screenshots.caption: Monkey King riding on his cloud
Monkey King has lost a life

title: Monkey King

description:
Adapted from the online game Zyrx, also made by Robotube Games, the mobile version has a few minor changes to allow for play on a mobile device.

It's a game of cognitive memory recall, sort of like Simon on Steroids. A pattern of dots appears for a split second in the top of the screen, and your task is to replicate that pattern by pressing the correct key sequence on the keypad. You're allowed a couple of hints along the way. As the levels increase, different colored dots appears, requiring double and even triple button presses to form the right patterns.
title: Zyrx

description:
Wordsnake is played by building words from random letters, starting from letters already on the board, leading to snake-like structures, hence the game’s name.

The game is played against the clock, with special tiles that the player can place letters on to increase/decrease the remaining time for that level or to gain extra lives.
title: Wordsnake

description:
It is year 1955. You are the only surviving allied pilot. You have just been assigned a secret mission to help the Allies find the secret weapon codenamed "The Iron Cannon". You will need to fly deep into enemy lands with your P-42 fighter plane once you have found "The Iron Cannon" destroy it before it is released upon the Allies and onto the rest of the world.

The game has many animations, scrolling backgrounds, six levels to play through. There are multiple bosses, enemies, power ups, extra lives, and two levels of difficulty.
title: 1955: The Secret Mission

description: A Solitaire game utilizing 3D graphics. Familiar Klondike Solitaire rules set in an underwater world gives the impression of playing on a glass bottom boat. Watch as you float through the underwater scenery while the creatures from the sea world swim past. You score points for placing cards and speed of placement. As points are earned more fish become unlocked.
title: Scuba Solitaire 3D

description: OddSun is a Space Invaders variant very similar to OddMoon. The game includes 25 customized skill levels and 75 A.I.-designed hard levels. The game is designed to fit 128x128 phone screens which makes it available to a large majority of cell phones. The game features a high-score table, 100 waves of aliens, multi-hit alien classes, eight different alien types, gradual increase in level complexity, and varying bunker defenses.

sample_screenshots.caption: A hard attack pattern - wide bombing field

title: OddSun

description:
Balloon Race is an arcade racer with a twist. You have to finish your laps in time, but also collect coloured balloons in a given order to receive points. This singleplayer game offers four tracks: Arizona, London, Cairo and Sydney. The first one can be played right away; the others are unlocked if you score a set amount of points. Each track has distinct scenery and obstacles.

You receive points by completing a lap in time, but also by collecting balloons. There are five types, with a different colour, and you have to collect them in the order shown in the top left corner of your screen to receive 1,000 points. If a series is complete, the order is randomized and you start over again. The game has music, sound effects and a high score screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Lots of roadworks, with balloons nearby of course
About to grab a balloon in Arizona
Inside a tunnel with only 38 seconds left
I need to collect a red balloon to make the set complete. This is the second lap.

title: Balloon Race

description:
In this top-down helicopter shooter, you have just captured an AH-64 Apache, and you now need to wipe out an entire fleet. All actions takes place on the sea, and targets include rigs, submarines and regular ships. As there is only a limited amount of fuel and ammo, there are yellow and purple platforms where you can restock on both. Upon boarding a yellow ammo platform, you can choose between rockets, regular bullets, depth charges and torpedoes. It's impossible to sweep a level in a single run, so you need to keep a close eye on the fuel and ammo meters.

The helicopter can only move forward, at different speeds, and turns 45 degrees per key press. All targets are shown on the radar in the mini-map in the bottom right corner, and enemies fire back with regular bullets. Upon finishing a level, a more complex map is generated. The game includes a high score screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: A "Low on fuel" message flashes, time to find a refill.
Starting the game, firing in random directions.
Upon flying over an ammo platform, you can select the type of ammo you'd like to equip.
It's getting crowded with these submarines.

title: AH-6 Navy Battle

description:
One day, Alibaba discovers a thieves' treasure stash hidden in a cave and brings it home. He leads a Gatsby life until the thieves come back to reclaim their loot. Disgruntled, he decides to track the gang and give the treasure to the poor. With the help of his wife, he has to find the forty thieves hidden in ten mazes. Looking for the criminals, four per map, is not much of an issue; the challenge is clearing the path to reach them.

Alibaba and Forty Thieves is a puzzle game where you have to alter environments filled with obstacles. This includes natural barriers such as houses, trees and water, but also bombs and fire-breating dragons. Shown through a top-down perspective, you can move Alibaba in four directions and freely browse the whole map to plan your route. To progress, you have to use items, given at the start of the game or collected while playing. There are mirrors to reflect fire, a wand to rotate dragons or mirrors, a bomb to clear obstacles, torches to detonate bombs or melt ice, and water to pass through fire for an instant. You need to plan ahead, but there is an unlimited amount of tries and two difficulty levels. In between levels, your wife gives hints and you can overhear the thieves planning their next maze.

sample_screenshots.caption: Seventh stage - about to confront a thief.

title: Alibaba and Forty Thieves

description:
Animal Land is a puzzle game based on animals' food habits. Using Tetris-like gameplay, you have to guide blocks falling down the screen. You make them disappear by creating matching pairs. If the stack of blocks reaches the top of the screen, the game is over. Unlike other puzzle games, pairs are not created by creating lines, or matching shapes or colours. Each block consists of food and/or animals. Align an animal horizontally or vertically next to related food to have it eaten and have the animal disappear as well. Common pairs are squirrels and nuts, monkeys and bananas, cats and fish, mice and cheese, dogs and bones... with gameplay reminiscent of Baku Baku Animal.

While falling, blocks can be rotated or moved sideways. By delaying matches, you can create chain reactions. There are also a few special items such as a quadruple, a vertical and a horizontal bomb, and stones that cannot be removed unless they are linked to a match. Three different game types are available. In the stage mode, you level up by making a set amount of matches, in the animal mode you play as animal looking for specific food, and the skill mode offers unlimited and uninterrupted gameplay.

sample_screenshots.caption: A game in progress in the stage mode (German version)
Creating stracks. The column on the right shows the pairs you still need to get to advance (German version).

title: Animal Land

description:
Apocalypse 3000 is a side-scrolling platform game set in the year 3081. Planet X-14 in the Uricane solar has been overrun with monsters and it's up to you to eliminate all aliens. Most of the game, including all the graphics, has been borrowed from Mega Turrican. Gameplay consists of moving through sets of moving and static platforms, as well as destroying both walking and flying enemies, from tiny to bugs to gigantic mutated space marines.

The character can duck and jump, but a laser gun is your only weapon at your disposal. You can upgrade it to fire in three directions or to shoot bigger blasts, and you can take multiple hits, but when you die you have to replay the entire level. The levels take place in different worlds, and you can save after completing a section. There is no way to heal while playing, but extra lives have been hidden in chests. You can also collect diamonds for bonus points. The game has no sound effects or music.

sample_screenshots.caption: Showing off the triple-shot laser, cleverly avoided by this jumping monster.
Another tough enemy, but slower than the space marine.
These small bugs are hard to hit.
At the beginning of the level, you are teleported to the new location.

title: Apocalypse 3000

description: AquaRace is a jet ski simulator with three tracks: Dreamland, City Heat and Iceland. You can either play quick races or participate in a championship with three races. The tracks have white boards that give you a boost jump, and black obstacles that slow you down. You can bump other riders and the distance between all competitors is shown on a bar near the top of the screen. While racing, the upcoming corners' direction is shown using arrows, and you are warned when there is an obstacle ahead.

sample_screenshots.caption: Chasing opponents on the City Heat track.
You are warned when there is an obstacle ahead.

title: AquaRace

description: Based on the 2003 movie of the same name, 2Fast 2Furious puts the player in races against tuned cars. There is only one track with variations based on three difficulty levels. The track has two lanes, and incoming traffic needs to be evaded. The player can activate boosts, but these deplete fuel. When the fuel meter is empty, or when too much damage has been sustained, the race is over.
title: 2Fast 2Furious

description:
The mobile version of Constantine is based on the movie of the same name, inspired by the comic book Hellblazer. John Constantine went to hell and back, and he has been given the burdensome gift of recognizing both angels and demons on earth. He uses this ability to exorcise demons possessing humans, but when his friend Beeman is kidnapped and John is ambushed, he goes after one of the demon leaders: Balthazar.

The story is based on both the book and the film, and includes many familiar locations and characters. However, major elements of the film, such as the relationship with the cop Angela, have been left out, and the introduction mentions a girlfriend called Ellie. She is John's girlfriend in the comic book, and not mentioned in the film. Still, you'll act out many of film's scenes, including exorcising a demon from the Spanish woman Lopez, meeting Papa Midnite at his club that acts as a safe zone for both sides, and fighting the demon Balthazar. John can also cross over to hell, through water.

The game is shown through a top-down view. You spend most of the time fighting demons. The creatures are usually hidden from view, and when your awareness meter flashes, you can activate Illumination magic to reveal them. John can also cast Groundswell to attack multiple enemies at once, and Shadowstride (invisibility) to sneak around. In regular combat, you use your fists and a holy shotgun. Magic can only be used scarcely as it needs to regenerate. The game consists of eight short chapters. To advance, you have to talk to other characters to get on Balthazar's trail. Next to the use of magic, the fighting and the sneaking, there also a sequence where you have to perform exorcism by copying increasingly longer key patterns. After finishing a section, your progress is saved automatically.

sample_screenshots.caption: Get a cab to move around.
Roaming the streets with a holy shotgun.
The abilities screen where you can select weapons and magic.
Inside the BZR building where Balthazar is guarded by his minions.

title: Constantine

description:
The mobile version of 7 Zwerge: Das Brettspiel is a jump-and-run game based on the Snow White fairy tale, and it's a movie tie-in with the German family comedy film 7 Zwerge (2004). One day, seven dwarves, living in an enchanted forest, meet Snow White when she enters their forest. Unfortunately, she is soon abducted by an evil queen. In this game, you have to defeat the queen's minions to get the girl back.

Gnomes Gone Wild is a platform game where you control a single dwarf through twenty levels. Each level consists of multiple regions with knights. Your only weapon is a wooden board, and you have to jump at the knights from a lower level to stun them for a moment, quickly climb up, and hit them with the board. The knights leave behind mushrooms that slow you down or reverse your controls, but they can also give you extra speed. You only have a short time to complete the level. Otherwise, a bloodhound will chase you around, and the enemies move much faster.

When the dwarf is on the same level as the knights, they can be stunned but not defeated completely. You can move between different platforms using entrances, ladders and jump pads. Collecting flowers will give you bonus points. Your health is shown through a number of sausages. Hits take them away, but some levels contain extra lives. Each level also holds a U-sign that stuns all enemies at once, but only for a moment.

sample_screenshots.caption: There is a a jump pad directly above you.
I have just stunned two enemies.
Use the entrances to move to another part of the level.

title: Gnomes Gone Wild

description:
ActRaiser is resurrected on the mobile platform. This version only focuses on the action elements of the original game. You have to cleanse three levels filled with flying skulls, goblins, trolls and mythical creatures with side-scrolling platform gameplay. Armed only with a blade, you will have to take on mid-level bosses and huge end bosses as well. There is only one slash move, but you can jump and crouch to vary your attacks.

You have to finish the game with only two lives, along with an additional health meter that consists of different bars. There is a high score list and you can upload your score to an online rankings list.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting the third level, surrounded by monsters.
This monster is tougher than the other opponents in the level.
The boss of the first level with his personal tesla coil.
Three enemies engage you at the same time.

title: Actraiser

description:
In the mobile version of the PS2 game Drakengard, you control prince Caim, along with the Red Dragon, in a struggle against the imperial forces. Each of the three locations consists of two sequences: side-scrolling fighting with Caim alone, followed by a flight sequence on the back of the dragon. On the ground, Caim's moves include sword combos with a finishing blow, blocking, jumping, a dash attack and a dragon attack. To launch a dragon attack, you have to fill your magic meter with finishing blows. Once complete, you can summon the Red Dragon to attack all enemies on the screen, except for the bosses. Each ground level is followed by a duel against a boss.

During the flight sequences, you control the dragon carrying Caim. You have to take out all incoming enemies and projectiles with fireballs and destructive spells or use the escape move for tricky situations. The game also incorporates some RPG elements: you gain experience by defeating enemies. These points can be used to level up, rendering attacks more powerful and expanding the maximum amount of health. Additional experience points are based on a time bonus and the stage score.

Although the story of the original game is only vaguely mentioned, all missions have an introduction explaining your mission and the setting. There is a high score list and you can upload your score to an online ranking board.

sample_screenshots.caption: Bring down the black guards as quickly as possible or they"ll knock you over.
You can summon your dragon during the fights to wipe out all enemies at once.
Evasive manoeuvres to avoid the creature.

title: Drakengard

description: Playing as starfighter pilot Jake Striker of the Global Alliance, you are the final line of defense on a moon-based outpost against an alien invasion threatening earth. Using non-scrolling vertical gameplay, you have to defeat over 50 enemy waves including bosses. As you progress, the attack patterns become more complex with larger and more powerful ships. There is only a limited amount of lives, but by eliminating series of spaceships, you gain bonuses such as extra lives and improved firepower. Top scores are stored in a high score screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: As you progress, enemies become larger and tougher.

title: Fraxxon

description:
E.T.Confrontation is an action game where you play as Dozer who works for a secret military force where scientist encode a message from outer space. The code petrifies the military force as the aliens have planned to attack earth and have already made a base nearby earth. Now you play as Dozer to infiltrate their base and destroy the parent ship.

Enemies include aliens such as The Rdunz, The Tenozs and The Monglac with different weapons. Levels consist of platforms with lifts and doors. You can collect power-ups such as shield that protect you and access cards need to be retrieved to unlock doors.
title: E.T.Confrontation

description:
When the young sorceress Stella Maris returns to her home, she discovers her black cat Mimi has been kidnapped by the demon clan. You'll need to guide her through 16 stages to retrieve the cat. The entire game is played in a non-scrolling screen where enemies appear above you. You can only move sideways and shoot upwards with your wand. The stages have been grouped in worlds with a castle, a forest, a volcano or ice as a backdrop. Each level has the same enemies, but as you progress, they become quicker and attack in groups. The ice world is the hardest level, as Stella will glide a bit and is harder to control.

Enemies consist of bats, dragons, giant red balls, dragons, skulls and demons. Some shoot projectiles or drop bombs, while others will try to isolate you by starting fires on the ground. For every 5,000 points, an extra life is awarded. By destroying entire waves of specific enemies, you are also granted fruit for bonus points, temporary invincibility, and new weapons with multiple bolts in different directions or a vertical line that kills anything that touches it.

In between every two levels per world, there is a bonus game where you have to shoot spiders to keep them from stealing your treasure chests. Scores are saved in a high score table and they can also be uploaded to an online ranking list.
title: Dragon Skies

description:
The mobile version turns the Call of Duty franchise into a Commandos-like squad-based shooter. With a group of allied soldiers, you have to take on the Nazi Wehrmacht in missions all over Europe, from D-Day to a tank factory, the Pegasus bridge, crossing the Volga river and infiltration missions in a P.O.W. camp and a dam. Before each assignment, you are given a short introduction of the environment and a team selection is suggested based on their abilities. You can only select three team members per mission.

The objective is always to reach a spot marked by a red flag with as many team members alive as possible. The different classes include infantry, a sniper, an engineer, a medic and a commando. You control only one unit at a time, but you can order the other ones to follow you or to take cover. The other members are controlled by the computer's AI and will engage enemy soldiers on sight if you order them to follow you. You can switch between team members to move them around or to use their special abilities. All members can fire regular bullets, in four directions, but a medic can heal your soldiers, the sniper can shoot the entire screen when there is a clean line of fire, the infantry has grenades to blow up objects or doors and the engineer carries heavy explosives. The final unit, the commando, can pass through locked doors and stays undetected for ten seconds in a new room. This time frame can be used to sneak up on enemies and take them out with your knife.

Each unit has an armour class and you can pick up items on the battlefield: a medi-pack to restore health, a crate to restock your secondary weapon and a flak jacket granting invincibility for ten seconds. Although it is sometimes possible to finish missions with a single unit, you will often need the different classes to get past obstacles. There is only one type of enemy soldier and they can shoot in eight directions. The fastest time per mission is stored as a challenge to beat.

sample_screenshots.caption: Mission selection screen. This is only shown once you completed a mission, and new ones are added gradually.
This mission starts in a forest.
Each mission has a written introduction and shows a recommended squad selection.

title: Call of Duty

description: In Desert Rally, you ride a bike in a single desert track race, while fighting the four other riders with kicks and punches, Road Rash-style. While dodging obstacles, you have to reach the checkpoints in time to continue playing. There are also a few ZOOM bars that grant extra speed and a protective shield that destroys obstacles and knocks opponents off their bikes. The remainig time is shown at the top of the screen and the position of the other riders can be tracked on the left. The fastest times are shown on a high score screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: The ZOOM bar provides a powerful boost and gives a shield.

title: Desert Rally

description:
Set in the Marvel universe as a tie-in with the third X-men movie, the story picks up when the X-men team lost William Stryker to Magneto and the mutants. After his death, the team has to return to Stryker's lab at the Alkali Lake to obtain the cerebros components - their only chance to defeat the brotherhood of mutants. The story is revealed through in-game sequences with a few unexpected twists when the Sentinel robots appear.

The game consists of three acts with various members of the X-men team in isometric levels. You cannot control multiple characters at the same time, or switch at will, but you need to work together to progress. Playing as Wolverine, Nightcrawler, Iceman, Cyclops and surprisingly even Magneto, you have to use their unique abilities. Each characters has specific moves, attacks and abilities. Wolverine is all about brute force, while Nightcrawler can teleport, Iceman can slide through air, create ice blocks, put out fire and freeze enemies, and Cyclops can shoot through his eyes. Not all of these moves are available at once, you have to look for various hidden mutant cores to upgrade your skills. Opponents include Pyro, Silver Samurai and Master Mold, and both Rogue and Prof. X. make an appearance.

The game combines beat-em-up sequences with basic RPG elements and puzzle-solving. You need to destroy or move statues and blocks, and use the abilities to get past obstacles. Special moves drain your power gauge, but both power and health regenerate over time. Pick-ups include mutant cores for upgrades, power-ups to expand your health and power meter, and X-points to improve your score. After each act, you are graded based on your performance and a high score list has been included.

sample_screenshots.caption: Wolverine, Nightcrawler and Cyclops start the mission.
Iceman's ice slide. He also created the cube in the back, used for puzzles.
Iceman meets Pyro, who has switched sides.

title: X-Men: The Last Stand

description:
The seventh game in the PlayMan Sports series turns to Europe's favourite: football. Played from a top-down perspective or a full 3D view if you have an advanced phone, you can choose from 34 countries to compete in various events. The names have not been licensed but each country has been assigned a skill level true to their actual capabilities. In the main career mode, you control team Playman and compete in 33 events over the world, divided over three stages, to improve your skills. After completing a challenge, you are awarded skill points that can be assigned to speed, attack or defense. Events include full tournaments, friendlies, sudden death situations and penalty shoot-outs. Other game modes offer warm-up, arcade games and quick matches.

Each team consists of 8 players and you can set the formation before the match. Moves include tackling, passing and shooting, along with a run boost, crosses and super shots with large effect that need to be powered up. All players run automatically, you only need to move them into the right direction. The goalie cannot be controlled. There are different pitches, weather types and you control the length of the game and the fouls. Gameplay time and records are stored in a high score screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: It is getting crowded in front of the goal.
The referee does not look too healthy.

title: Playman World Soccer

description:
In this ski jumping simulation, you can test your skills on tracks in seven countries: Poland, Italy, Austria, Switzerland, Germany, Japan, Finland and Norway. You can either practise, take on the computer, or play against three other human players (hot seat) to get the best score.

You always start on top of a ramp. While going down, you have to tap left or right to compensate for the wind. When you cross the red line, you keep a button pressed to gain speed and release it once you have left the ramp. In the air, you have to keep a steady V-formation and tap another button to land safely. Five judges rate your jump based on the length and style. Each track consists of two jumps and if you get first in a singleplayer track, you qualify for the next and unlock it for other modes. There are nine multiplayer opponents and a high score screen per track.

sample_screenshots.caption: Keep your skies in a V-shaped position. I'm not doing well, the figure in the top right corner is red.
Land before the green bar on the right is depleted.

title: Alltime Ski Jumping

description:
Set in Terry Pratchett's Discworld universe and based entirely on the first book, The Colour of Magic, the Unseen University's worst wizard apprentice in its history, Rincewind, is ordered by Ankh Morpork's ruler, The Patrician, to guide the Agatean tourist Twoflower through the city. The visitor is incredibly wealthy and terribly naive, so you have to protect them from all the dangers and crooks.

The city consists of 16 sections, shown through an isometric perspective. You only control Rincewind who nudges Twoflower in the right direction. The tourist wants to visit five locations: the Unseen University, the Patrician's Palace, the Temple of the Small Gods, the Brass Bridge and the Whorepits in that order. Some of the lurking dangers are thieves, the character Death, carriages, swamp dragons that explode when petted, and Cut-Me-Own-Throat Dibbler's Sensational Sausages.

You can view the different sightseeing spots on a city map. Twoflower only has a limited amount of lives, but Rincewind helps by throwing coins to distract thugs and he uses a picture box to blind civilians. In difficult situations, you can also call The Luggage just once, and it will eat everything on the screen. There is some paint hidden in certain sections to keep the colours in your picture box stocked.

sample_screenshots.caption: A thug approaches on the left and there is some extra paint on the right.
If you leave Twoflower alone, a small icon shows where he is.

title: Discworld: The Colour of Magic

description: When the intergalactic alliance is coming to an end, you are sent in a modern Alpha Wing fighter to locate and infiltrate the alien home base, and destroy the central command facility. Alpha Wing is a simple side-scrolling 2D shooter where you guide a tiny spaceship past enemies and obstacles. There are different environments and you have two types of ammo that can be upgraded by collecting power-ups. You can also temporarily use a shield, but not often, as it needs to be recharged before you can use it again. There are sound effects and music, and high scores can be stored on the phone or submitted to an online ranking list.

sample_screenshots.caption: The second level, in a smaller playfield
The shield has been activated and there is a weapon power-up ahead.

title: Alpha Wing

description: Aero Mission 3D is a flight combat game for mobile phones that is played in a 3D third person perspective. The objective is simple, you need to get 70 points to win. The mission ends when the time runs out or all enemy aircraft has been defeated. So even if you've reached the 70 points needed, you will still need to stay alive for the remaining time. Two weapon types are available, the machine gun and the homing missiles. To help you find the enemies you have a radar scope and a compass to your disposal. Three different difficulty levels are available and each has its own highscore.
title: Aero Mission 3D

description: Super Real Tennis is a 3D tennis game played in a third person perspective. The keypad is used througout the game, both for swinging and moving around the player. Three game modes are available: free match, tournament and training. By winning tournaments players will gain points. These points can be used to increase the players performance in five different categories (power, speed, reaction, angle and skill). Several different opponents are available in the game, and they all have different skills. The game also has a replay feature used throughout the matches.
title: Super Real Tennis

description:
The king of Erathia has been kidnapped by demons. A young fighter named Ewan is sent out to save the king. Along the way he'll meet many characters, both friends and foes, that will or will not help him in his fight against the demons.

The first Might and Magic game to appear on mobile phones is a isometric action game with puzzles. The gameplay involves fighting typical fantasy monsters like skeletons, bats and orcs, while solving the puzzles that will be found along the game's fifteen levels. The player will need to switch between members of the three person crew to cooperatively solve puzzles.

Ewan is skilled with the sword and can collect three types of magic: fire, ice and wind. By charging his sword, he can also unleash a powerful attack with a far reach. In certain levels, he is accompanied by Lorean, an archer. She can hit switches from a distance with her bow and perform a double jump to reach high areas. The third character is Captain. He attacks with his staff and can transform into a bat (fly over ice or lava), fog (have Ewan use his wind magic to push the fog through gates) and a wolf.

In battles the player can use both ranged and melee attacks as well as magic, and often will need to combine these to defeat the enemies. The party will find new items along the way, like healing herbs and the iron boots that will allow Ethan to walk on spikes. He will also often have to use his grappling hook to reach remote platforms and higher places. Other puzzles include wind to make platforms move, moving crates to activate switches and a combination of the different character's abilities.

sample_screenshots.caption: Ewan meets the Demon Lord for the first time.
Lit the torches with your fire magic to progress.
Captain can transform into a bat, fog and a wolf.
Introduction sequence: the war against the demons
Use crates to reach higher levels.

title: Might and Magic

description: Tommi Mäkinen Mobile Rally features five tracks: New Zealand, Kenya, England, Finland and Monte Carlo. The last four are only unlocked gradually if you place top 3 in the previous track. There is only one car available and no visible opponents. You race against the clock and at each checkpoint an overview of your time and ranking is given. Only automatic transmission is available. The tracks have different designs and surfaces, and a few obstacles you have to avoid. The game includes a high score screen with the best times for each course.
title: Tommi Mäkinen Mobile Rally

description: Wax is a snowboarding game shown through a top-down perspective. There is only one slope, filled with trees, rocks, and other obstacles. While a timer counts down, you control the speed and move your rider left or right to pass through gates. If you miss one, five seconds are deducted from your time. You can also jump over certain obstacles. Even though there is only one course, the score keeps adding up game after game, as each game has the environment randomly generated, while the difficulty is increased by making the gates smaller.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can jump over this river.
There is a snow truck on the right.
Pass through these gates to score.

title: Wax

description:
The mobile version of Wacky Races is based on the Hanna-Barbera animated series of the same name. You can play as Penelope Pitstop, Red Max, Peter Perfect, Dick Dastardly & Muttley, the Slag Brothers and many more, but not all of them are unlocked from the start. Three are available right away, while the other eight are opened up gradually each time you complete the championship mode. Each car has characteristics based on top speed and acceleration.

The championship mode consists of six tracks set in Missouri, Alaska and Nevada. If you come first on a track in the championship, it is made available for quick racing. You race against seven opponents on courses with bright colours reminiscent of the TV series' visuals. During the race, you can collect power-ups such as oil slicks to slow down opponents, turbo for a boost, lightning to halt the car in front of you, and a shield to drive through obstacles and cars for a short moment. Each car also has a unique power-up, such as a high jump, flying or speed rams.

sample_screenshots.caption: Rufus Ruffcut just got off the road, he is now invincible for a few seconds.
Standing at the end of a race
Barely avoiding a tree in Alaska.

title: Wacky Races

description:
In War of the Worlds, the film based on the H.G. Wells novel of the same name, the focus is on mankind in a struggle against a strange alien invasion. In this take on it, however, the events are turned around as you command a tripod in its quest to exterminate all humans. In the thirteen levels, set in Osaka, London, New Jersey and apocalyptic wastelands, you guide the alien through side-scrolling levels, destroying anything in sight.

You can move the tripod, as well as the main turret to target waves of enemies. Each level ends with a boss attack where you take on a giant tank, submarine or a flying bomber, or prevent a ferry from escaping with human passengers. Many events follow the movie, and the order of the locations is also kept intact. Although you will spend a lot of time fending off enemies, time is the most important factor. You are much stronger than your enemies, so they will often charge with kamikaze attacks to slow you down. Buildings will also prevent you from moving steadily, and these need to be removed as well.

Health is shown as a power bar in the bottom left corner. You can collect power-ups to recharge it, and these grant more powerful ammo at the same time. Your enemies include tanks, helicopters, jets, bombers and motorboats. The tripod can also hold a maximum of three bombs - these destroy anything on the screen. During the missions, CNN-like reports are shown with information on the humans' return attacks.

As the waves of multiple enemies increase, you no longer have the time to fight them one by one. Instead, certain formations' units are highlighted in red. If you destroy these first, they will cause a chain explosion taking out the entire wave. Another way to trigger this is by shooting mines that humans have deployed. These will jump up and cause damage in the air. As a tripod, you can grab units and mines from the ground and launch them at incoming enemies. You can also capture humans for bonus points using the same technique. Aside from providing massive points, chain explosions provide additional seconds to your time limit, to recover when you have been slowed down.

sample_screenshots.caption: Grab a human to capture him.
Another tank in the New York level
You start in Osaka. The red orb is a power-up.
Straight from the movie: prevent the ferry from leaving.

title: War of the Worlds

description: Alien cat robots have kidnapped Garfield's favourite punch ball: Odie. You have to clear four levels, with different stages, to get him back. The cat robots will try to stop you, but these can be taken out using your paws, or by picking up a pan, a racket or a broom - although taking them on barehanded will get your more points. Garfield can be moved in four directions and there a single key to punch. You have three lives and lasagna provides additional energy. The side-scrolling action only takes up one third of the screen and the entire game can be finished in five minutes.

sample_screenshots.caption: Third level, Garfield has found a broom.
Second level with bigger robot cats. There is a weapon to the left.
First level: Garfield attacks with his paws.
This is what happens if you don't button mash insanely.

title: Garfield: Robocats from Outer Space!

description:
Garfield: The Bubble's gameplay is identical to the Bust-A-Move concept, but features the well-known cat from the Jim Davis' comics. Garfield can be moved at the bottom of the screen while the space on top of him is gradually filled with colored bubbles. Garfield needs to rearrange these into groups of three of the same colour (vertically) to make them disappear. Up to four bubbles of a single colour can be swallowed and then be relaunched.

You can score additional points by causing chain reactions. If you leave certain bubbles unattended, they will change into uneatable coins. These can only be removed by an adjacent chain reaction, but you also need them these coins to move on to a next level. With each level, the speed and the amount of uneatable coins to be removed, is increased. If the bubbles reach the bottom of the screen or touch Garfield, the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting a new game: swallow some bubbles to relaunch them at another spot.
The first uneatable coins start to appear.

title: Garfield: The Bubble

description:
Medieval Combat: Age of Glory is a 2D fighting game. No background story is offered, just seven fantasy-styled characters going head-to-head. Despite the limitations of the platform, fighting is made easy. There is a key for a weak attack and one for a strong attack. By mixing these and repeatedly tapping them, you create combos, unique for each character. They can also jump, block, counterattack, and dash forward to grab the enemy. As you land punches, kicks and slashes, a magic meter at the bottom is filled. A quick tap when it's half full will launch a projectile. If you manage to fill it completely, you can charge a special move. The gameplay is then halted and you quickly have to press the key sequence displayed to unleash it. From a distance, you can taunt the opponent to drain his magic.

The game modes include a tutorial, training, instant play, survival and arcade. In the arcade mode, you have to defeat all characters and take out Faust and Diablo. Based on the difficulty setting, they will be unlocked as playable upon completion. There are also a few bonus stages in between. The survival mode has you fight enemies one after another with a single health bar, and instant play provides quick matches. In the training mode, the moves can be practiced and you can command your AI opponent to perform specific actions such as attacking, blocking, crouching or jumping to recreate fighting scenes.

The static backgrounds include castles, cities, churches and graveyards. The characters are rather large and the costumes are interactive. By delivering heavy blows, you can peel away armor, chest plates and helmets, leaving opponents vulnerable. After each fight, you are graded based on the amount of health left, the time needed, a perfect fight and bonus points for combos. After winning consecutive fights, you also receive a ranking with improved statistics during battles. The game has full sound and music, alternate costumes for each character, and includes a high scores screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Elwyn delivers a heavy blow in the training mode.
Skurd pours Devil Rain upon Faust.
Arthur has been hit a few times and pieces of his armor have been removed.

title: Medieval Combat: Age of Glory

description:
This entry in the Midnight series focuses on pool. You can either play 8-Ball US, 8-Ball UK or 9-Ball. There are tournaments for cash, with a bet before and a trick challenge after each match, versus matches for up to two players, challenges, and quick games against an AI-controlled opponent.

For each shot, you have to rotate the cue into the right direction. Short lines show the general direction the balls will be moving. You then determine the power by timely pressing a key. Advanced controls let you perform jump shots, massé shots or add effect by repositioning the tip of the cue in relation to the ball. The colour of the cue can be selected at random, and upon progressing in the tournament, you unlock new characters.

The game's theme music is an electronic version of Lynyrd Skynyrd's Sweet Home Alabama.

sample_screenshots.caption: The advanced controls screen where you can add effect.
A trick challenge: get rid of both balls with a single shot.

title: Midnight Pool

description:
Poker comes to mobile phones in Gameloft's classy Midnight series, using the popular Texas Hold'em rules. Shown through a 3rd-person perspective (multiple players) or 1st-person (head-to-head), you can either play instant games to practice, go heads-up, or enter a career mode. Typical of the Midnight series, there is interaction with the opponents, and they all have a drawn portrait and a certain attitude.

After winning a few games, you can move on to the career mode with buy-in tables, and if you keep winning you can access tables with bigger blinds and bets. The action keeps going clockwise and you keep track of other players' funds. When it's your turn, a menu in the top left corner pops up where you can decide to call, raise, fold, check, bet or go all-in. Following the rules, dealer responsibilities are also passed around, and there is even a little cheat built in. As a dealer, you can try to take a peek at the cards.

The game optionally includes the odds shown in the bottom left corner, and a host who introduces the table and comments on the game. The theme music is Average White Band's Pick Up the Pieces.

sample_screenshots.caption: As a dealer, you can peek at the cards, but I haven't got much luck here.
Selecting a table in the career mode.

title: Midnight Hold'em Poker

description:
The mobile platform is the only one to have a game based on the third Mission: Impossible film. It is loosely inspired by it and consists of two types of gameplay comprising ten levels in total. You have infiltration missions where you play as operative Ethan Hunt or Luther. In these platform levels, you have to rescue a hostage, find a lost PDA, gain entrance to a secret lab and take out a boss. You can engage enemies either with typical firearms such as a submachine gun, shotgun, rifle, grenade launcher or stun gun, or use a stealth approach to knock them out. New combat moves are unlocked as you progress. While playing, an adrenaline bar fills up and once fully loaded you can unleash a blitz attack. Pick-ups include ammo and health. You also need to avoid robots and get past laser defenses.

Some time-limited mini-games are introduced during these levels. You have to guess a password, construct the features of guards for face recognition devices and wire electric circuits. Some parts of the background are interactive and you shoot canister and barrels to clear an area with a single bullet. After completing a mission, new difficulty levels or combat moves are unlocked. The game is autosaved at checkpoints to continue when you die.

The second type of gameplay is a vertical-scrolling helicopter shoot-em-up. These missions require you to destroy enemies in the air and on the ground. There are pick-ups that provide new weapons or repair your helicopter, and you can collect a limited amount of megabombs that wipe out everything on the screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Sneak up on enemies to save ammo.
The first boss: target the different sections of the aircraft.

title: Mission: Impossible 3

description:
Lumines Mobile is an adaptation of the PSP launch title Lumines: Puzzle Fusion. In this puzzle game, you arrange coloured blocks, falling down, on a board to form squares of a single colour. A timeline crosses the screen from left to right and when it hits the side, all combinations created are removed and exchanged for points. As you progress, new features and bonuses are added, such as additional colours, bombs, avatars and new shapes. You can also unlock new game modes and new skins. The music adapts to your actions and playing style, and the background is animated based on it. Each level (referred to as a skin) has different music and a unique background.

There are different game modes to choose from: Instant play*: play the last level unlocked in the arcade mode as a single game.

  • Arcade mode: play levels with different backdrops to unlock new features and skins. While playing, combos slowly fill up a progress bar that, once completed, allows you to move on to a next level. In between regular board games, you face bosses in vertical split-screen battles. You have to create more combos per turn to remove playing space from the opponent.

  • Challenge mode: the original free Lumines mode where you play until you are stuck.

  • VS CPU mode: a single game similar to the boss games in the arcade mode.

  • Single skin mode: play a single level.

  • Time attack mode: destroy as many blocks as possible before time runs out.

  • Puzzle mode: create a combo in the shape shown on the screen.

  • Shuffle mode: once unlocked, this selects a random skin to play.

sample_screenshots.caption: Another combo about to be formed.
Starting a game in the Shinin' stage.

title: Lumines Mobile

description:
The sequel to Billy the Kid: Wanted puts the player in the shoes of the most dangerous gunslinger in the west. Having vowed to stay away from criminal activity, Billy is forced to pack those six-shooters once again when a close friend of him gets killed and he sets off in a quest for vengeance.

Great Legends: Billy the Kid II is a 2D top-down arcade shooter and gameplay involves clearing stages of bandits and other assorted enemies following the plotline as the player chase the killers that murdered Billy's friend. Improvements over the original include assisted aiming, force feedback (using the vibration function) new weapons and items as well as improved graphics and sound effects.
title: Great Legends: Billy the Kid II

description: This is the first part of the Sonic the Hedgehog port for mobile phones. It includes the first three zones of the game: Green Hill Zone, Marble Zone and Spring Yard Zone. This game is in fact SEGA Mobile's Genesis port, but adapted for the European territory and not offered as a single game, unlike the US release.

sample_screenshots.caption: Meet Sonic, doing his thing, running fast.

title: Sonic the Hedgehog Part 1

description:
Using an isometric perspective, Tropical Madness mimics the gameplay of Super Monkey Ball, except that you do not have to tilt platforms, and Sonic 3D Blast. You control Furrito, who lives with his fellow Furridos, reminiscent of squirrels, on an island. When they play with mysterious stars, an ancient snake god is awoken. All Furridos are locked up, except for you. By collecting stars and defeating enemies, you can free your friends.

Furrido can roll into four directions to find stars. Blue stars add to your time, which, upon running out, ends the game, yellow ones provide more time, and the rare purple ones open up bonus levels. The courses are tricky, with obstacles, loops, hills, ramps, rails, small paths, flaming pits, platforms and moving barrels. You can use the dash button to attack enemies, such as bats, snakes and crabs. When you fall over the edge, you can continue right away. In the bonus levels, you can fly, float or surf. The game comes with a short tutorial that introduces different key layouts to control Furrito.

There are nine levels, divided over the themes Rain Forest, Pearl Beach and Lost Temple, two bonus levels and a final boss.

sample_screenshots.caption: Keep your balance while sliding by pressing 4 or 6.

title: Tropical Madness

description: BMW WilliamsF1 Team Racing Challenge is a top-down Formula 1 racer, developed in conjunction with engineers from the BMW team. You race against five AI players to win the cup races on three different continents. In four races on each continent, you have to decide which tires fits best and when to make a stop to change tires and refill fuel. Weather changes are not uncommon and every driving fault will be used by your enemies. Other game modes include the Play Mode and Time Attack against a ghost car.
title: BMW WilliamsF1 Team Racing Challenge

description:
3D Alpha Zone is a first-person shooter heavily inspired by DOOM. It is powered by the in-house developed Gem Xenotime 3D engine that provides freedom of movement, with stairs, elevators and moving floors. You cannot look up or down, jump, or crouch, however, and all enemies and items are 2D sprites.

You play as a member of the security squad on the colonized planet Ferrinox 9. One day, the planet is sneakily attacked by aliens and the first raids, supported by superior weapons, wipe out most of the defense structures. Reinforcements are on the way, but will likely be too late. As one of the survivors, you have to locate three human databases. These contain valuable information on all of mankind, as well as the coordinates of other inhabited systems. You have to travel through eight levels to destroy them all.

The game offers four weapons and six enemy types. You can collect items such as ammo, medikits, and keycards to open locked doors. The player can move in all directions, and quick turning as well as strafing is supported. There are three difficulty levels, full music and sound, and after beating a level, you can select it right away from the main menu.

sample_screenshots.caption: You start the game with a simple pistol.
The map appears as an overlay

title: Alpha Zone 3D

description:
Rabbitator is a fast-paced puzzle game played on a 7x7 grid of tiles using an isometric perspective. It seems the developer was undecided about the storyline, because there are two. In the first version, you play as professor Nick Ibble who wants to control the carrot black market. Disguised as Rabbitator, you need to mark fields to claim them as your own, while avoiding the sentinels sent out by the big carrot syndicates. In the second storyline, you are a cadet of the military academy and you have to disguise yourself as a rabbit in a secret mission to halt the terrorists and plant a carrot plantation.

At any rate, in each level you have to jump on all tiles to claim them. The colour will change and when all tiles are yours, you move on to the next level. There are some holes in the grid, you can fall off the edge, objects are dropped from the sky and there are moving enemies on the board. At certain intervals, you can pick up a carrot to immobilize the enemies and take them out Pac Man-style.

There are twenty levels with increasing difficulty and a different type of gameplay. In the first four levels, you simply have to hop on each cell to claim it and end the level. In the next four levels, you first paint tiles in a transitional colour and then in a definite colour. Level 9 to 12 restricts your movement, as stepping on the same cell twice returns the initial colour. The final four levels combine transitional colours along with the restriction of the third set of levels. Different kinds of monsters try to sabotage you, such as toilet pans, snowmen, teeth, bombs, boots, sharks, aliens, and the grim reaper.

sample_screenshots.caption: Do not be distracted by the legs.
The first level: all tiles need to be turned orange.

title: Rabbitator

description:
MX Unleashed is an installment in the Unleashed racing games franchise, now for the mobile platform. With different riders and bikes, you can either practice, or enter a world circuit season, with freestyle events and regular races against two computer-controlled players. There are 20 tracks in total, but all based on the same scenery. You have to finish first or perform stunts to unlock tracks in the practice mode and upgrade your bike. The engine, tires and nitro can be upgraded three times.

The game is shown through an isometric perspective, with very direct controls. If you catch air over a bump, stunts can be performed by pressing various keys. It is impossible to crash, and combining stunts gives extra points.
title: MX Unleashed

description:
In BMW 1 Series Challenge, carrying the official BMW license, you drive BMW sports cars on 9 circuits using a first-person perspective. The car selection includes 116i, 120i and 120d, but the first is the only one available right away. You have to complete the training sessions (time attack, with a ghost car of your best time) to unlock them. You can also pick a colour for your car, but you will only notice this as a coloured dot on a vertical line showing the cars' positions during races, as no external view is available.

In the main competition mode you have to beat AI-controlled cars to unlock new circuits. Not a single course requires you to brake - go full speed with a little steering. The main challenge is to avoid your opponents who try to block you off. The game incorporates BMW's Dynamic Stability Control (DSC). When travelling too fast or when turning at a high speed, DSC steps in to restore tracking and traction. This is shown through a yellow symbol in the bottom right corner. High scores can be saved on the phone or uploaded to a ranking list at the BMW site.

sample_screenshots.caption: In pursuit on the Venice Island Drive track

title: BMW 1 Series Challenge

description: Play the classic game of Backgammon on your mobile phone. It incorporates all the official rules, including the double cube. You can first learn the game in the tutorial and then play quick games, a tournament, or in the 2-player hotseat mode. There are three difficulty levels and upon progressing in the tournament, you can unlock new dice, checkers and colored tumblers.
title: Gameloft Backgammon

description:
A thousand years ago, Akhuna, goddess of the rainforest, transformed all of the gulos into stone, because they ate all the fruit and weakened her powers. They were also her servants and guardians, and now the forest has been intruded by strange creatures. The rainforest is dying, and Akhuna revives a single gulo to collect fruits and rid the forest of the intruders.

Gulo's Tale is an anime-styled side-scrolling platform game. Playing as Gulo, you have to complete levels by gathering the indicated amount of fruits. Levels are accessed through a world map, and statues of your fellow gulos provide the missions. After a completed mission, the statue turns from blue to red and you can continue. Gulo can only jump and create bubbles. These can be picked up and thrown at enemies - an alternate way of killing them next to a jump from above - or serve as temporary platforms. They only last a little while, so you have to be quickly. There are different settings and you can pick up power-ups that grant invincibility. Beat your best times in the time attack mode and unlock hidden levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Access the levels through these statues.
Use the bubbles to create temporary platforms.

title: Gulo's Tale

description:
The 2006 edition in the Derek Jeter Pro Baseball series polishes the game and introduces some new features such as manual fielding, power play, and more control over the pitcher and hitter. You can now charge your swing and decide on the direction you want to hit. Although New York Yankees's captain Derek Jeter is licensed, there is no full MLB license and all the players' names have been made up and assigned to cities.

Fielding and baserunning is controlled through keys (manual), but you can also let the computer control it (auto), or interfere when you want to take over the AI-controlled actions (semi). The same keys are used to pick off stealers and you can map positions to numbers, according to the bases, to quickly advance players. In defense, you can control the players in eight directions and jump or dive for the ball.

The main modes include quick play, exhibition matches, a full season of 29 or 58 games, and playoffs. Tweaks include different difficulty levels and the number of innings. During a season, you can simulate matches to advance more quickly. A small amount of team management is offered, you can select the line-up and decide on the pitchers' rotation. Another novelty is the Homerun Derby, where you can participate in a homerun contest with different rounds. The game's theme song is Gary Glitter's Rock & Roll Part 2.

sample_screenshots.caption: I guess he won't catch that one.
Preparing for a swing in the Homerun Derby.

title: Derek Jeter Pro Baseball 2006

description:
Crazy Football 2006 is a humorous cartoony football (soccer) game. There are five teams available: pro players, vampires, Shaolin monks, punk and granddads, each with different characteristics. Rules are rather loosely incorporated - the ball cannot go out during the games, and there are no faults, cards or other restrictions. Players can move in eight directions and there are only two buttons. When attacking, you can pass and shoot (charge for a more powerful shot) and in defense you can switch players and tackle.

Next to single matches and a penalty mode, you can participate in a tournament where, after preliminary matches, the two best teams go head to head in a final. There are three trophies to be won, based on the difficulty level, and you can choose to make matches last 2, 4 or 6 minutes.

sample_screenshots.caption: Player selection screen for a single match

title: Crazy Football 2006

description:
Hugo in the Snow is a simple mobile game featuring Hugo the TV troll, a popular cartoon character on Danish television. Scylla the witch wants to capture Hugolina, the most beautiful troll in the woods, and she flies around on her broomstick waiting for the right opportunity. Hugo must defend Hugolina by throwing snowballs.

There is only one backdrop and one enemy. You have to move the cross-hair to predict the witch's position and then throw the snowball. Points are awarded based on speed. There is no time pressure, but you only have a limited amount of snowballs, although new ones appear after taking Scylla down a few times. As you progress, the witch starts flying faster with irregular paths and quick turns.
title: Hugo in the Snow

description: Dino Adventure is a simple arcade game. Because of global warming, the arctic is slowly losing its chill. Scientists and professors flock to collect remains of dinosaurs. As officer William, you have to collect as many dino eggs as possible. Each level consists of a maze with eggs scattered around. Once you start, William keeps running and you only have to steer him in the direction of the eggs while avoiding the dinos chasing you. Both the eggs and the dinos approaching are shown with arrows on the screen, allowing you to correct your movement in time. There are 26 levels and 3 difficulty levels. In the later levels, more dinos are present and the mazes become more difficult. If you time it right, you can also make the dinos bump into each other, and this will cause them to fight – a temporary distraction.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can consult the map at any time.
William is about to collect the final egg for this level.

title: Dino Adventure

description: This is the sequel to Hugo: Black Diamond Fever. The gameplay is completely identical, except for new enemies and locations. You need to collect red and black diamonds by defeating enemies on a small levels with lots of platforms. There are a few new power-ups, and one of them extends your whip, used to stun enemies, to make it more effective.

sample_screenshots.caption: Hugo stuns an enemy with his whip.
Hugo has been killed by the skeletons - they can use the ladders as well.

title: Hugo: Black Diamond Fever 2

description: Hugo the TV Troll wants to throw a party for his friends Jean Paul and Fernando. Everything is set, but they do not have enough fish to eat. You play as Hugo, standing on a stone in the middle of a river. You need to catch fish with your net. The net can be held at three different heights, on either side, and you can guess the correct action by watching the fishes' movement and colour. The net can only hold a maximum of five fish, so you need to empty it regularily. If you miss a fish, it will knock you off the stone and you lose a life. At times, other animals such as birds and insects appear - you need to avoid these. Hugo only has three lives and there is only one backdrop. As you progress, fish appears more quickly.

sample_screenshots.caption: Whoops, I've been knocked off the stone.

title: Hugo Goes Fishing

description: Follow the Monkey is another short game based on the Hugo the TV Troll franchise. To become troll of the day, Hugo needs to complete a maze in the jungle - a 4x4 grid. The game trains the memory, as you need to copy the path the monkey Jean Paul shows you. The length of his path increases with each round, and if you make a wrong move, you get trapped in quicksand. There is only one backdrop and you cannot make any mistakes, or game over ensues.

sample_screenshots.caption: Copy the path to move on to the next round.

title: Hugo: Follow the Monkey

description: Hugo in the Xmas Snow is a re-release of Hugo in the Snow, adapted for the Christmas holidays. The goal of the game is to take down the witch Scylla with a limited amount of snowballs, while her movement pattern becomes increasingly irregular. This version of the game has a backdrop with Christmas trees, there is more snow falling down, and Hugo wears a new costume.
title: Hugo in the Xmas Snow

description:
Atari Legends Vol. 3 is a compilation of three classic Atari games, adapted for the mobile platform:

  • Asteroids Deluxe
  • Pong
  • Super Breakout

Pong and Super Breakout are identical to the original versions (including the four game modes for the latter). Asteroids Deluxe adds a new backdrop to the original game, but no further improvements.
title: Atari Legends Vol. 3

description:
I-Play released two games based on The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift movie license at the same time. Next to the 3d version, they also made this classic top-down racer in 2d. The story mode has hardly got a story at all: you need to travel to 7 Tokyo districts. After beating the area master at one location, you move on to the next. Each location consists of three sessions: The Call where you race for the first place against three AI-controlled cars, Show Off where you need to impress with drifts to gain enough respect to attract the attention of the area master, and Twin Battle where you need to beat the area master and gain more respect than him.

Show Off and Twin Battle require you to drift through corners. By skidding, a yellow meter in the top right corner is filled up. Once the meter is full, one of the seven boxes is filled and the meter is reset. If you manage to activate all yellow boxes, you move on to a set of green ones, a minimum requirement to get access to Twin Battles. Chain drifting also provides cash, and you gain more respect when you drift for a long time and at a high speed, while collisions deduct from your score.

After winning races, you can upgrade your car, with enhancements for acceleration, speed, brakes, tires and nitro. In the body shop, you can up your respect with a paint job, rear spoilers, decals and air scoops. The other game modes are Quick Race and Solo Runs. Solo Runs offers three additional race types: Survival Run where you constantly need to keep drifting to make your respect last, Last Man Standing (the last one after each round is out) and Time Trial.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can give gentle nudges, but you have to watch out not to get involved too much.
Apply paint jobs in the garage.
The upgrade screen for "acceleration" with different curves showing the specifics.

title: The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo

description:
Asterix and the Vikings is a mobile game released as a tie-in with the 2006 animation film of the same name, adapted from the work and characters of René Goscinny and Albert Uderzo. The Gaul village of the heroes, the last stand against the Roman empire, is attack by Vikings. They kidnap Justforkix, the nephew of chief Vitalstatistix. Through 3 worlds with 12, you have to guide Asterix to rescue him.

It is a rather straightforward platformer. Asterix can move, jump, crouch and hit enemies with his trademark uppercut. During the journey you collect skulls, stones and helmets, defeat Vikings, do some jumping, and push items to create temporary platforms. You have three lives, but health can be restored with hearts and additional lives can be collected. When you discover a potion, Asterix moves twice as fast and is invincible for 3 seconds. Certain objects can be broken to reveal hidden items.

sample_screenshots.caption: Idefix is waiting for you at the end of each level.
Uppercuts send Vikings in the air.

title: Astérix and the Vikings

description: Blue Beck uses the Baywatch license to create a beach volleyball game. The only references to the TV show, however, are a few pictures of actresses, and the red outfit of the women you control. There are three difficulty levels (3, 5 or 7 sets) and the controls are extremely straightforward. All actions are controlled with a single button. Based on the direction and the timing, you serve, dive, lob, pass or smash.

sample_screenshots.caption: A smash from the opposing team.

title: Baywatch Beach Volleyball

description: Beach Volley Pro Challenge in an anime-flavoured one-on-one beach volleyball game. Players are shown from the sides, like in a platform game and you can only move sidewards. All actions, such as serving, smashing and reception are based on a power bar. To get the most powerful moves, you have to wait until the bar is empty to make the ball go faster. If you time it to perfection, the ball turns orange and you are almost certain to get a point. Next to training matches, there is also a eurocup with nine locations, but there is in fact only one venue and only one opponent. After two winning sets, the game is finished, and a set consists of 11 points.

sample_screenshots.caption: The orange ball is very difficult to counter.
The opponent prepares for a smash.

title: Beach Volley Pro Challenge

description:
Neopets Mobile is not a standalone game, but an extension of the online community neopets.com, where you can create or adopt a pet, and then look after it. This game allows you to continue playing through your cellphone when you are not behind your computer, making it the first full W2W (Wireless-to-Web) application.

The pets need to be fed and you can buy, trade or sell items. By downloading your pet data on your mobile, you can continue playing. The game is shown on a small part of Neopia, the world where Neopets live - a location you cannot access from the web. This location is Lutari Island where inhabitants all wear beautiful colors. On Lutari you still have access to shops, bank, training school, Bog of Charity and a lot of other locations that allow you to buy all the items your neopet will need to live correctly.

Along with the application, 2 mini-games are included, providing neopoints needed to buy items. The first, Lutari Race, is a jump-and-run game where you need to avoid objects and collect bonuses. The second, Blockstravaganza, is a Bejeweled clone. Depending on your performances you will earn more or less neopoints.

All users carry an empty Lutari talisman. By visiting certain pages on the site, you can collect beads for it. Neopets Mobile extends this feature by providing beads if you refer other users to this mobile version.
title: Neopets Mobile

description:
The J2ME version of FIFA 2006 adapts the game to an isometric version, similar to the pre-FIFA 97 releases. Although the game is fully-licensed, it does not have the extensive amount of teams and players the console versions offer. Only national teams are available and there are no leagues with specific clubs.

The game improves over the 2005 edition with new gameplay modes, a few cutscenes, and more teams to choose from. The main game modes are Tutorial, Quick Match, Friendly, Cup, Scenario and Shoot Out. The new Scenario mode offers specific tasks at the end of a season, such as finishing first in a league, finishing above a red line to keep the fans loyal, or saving a team from relegation.

Before each match, you can define the line-up, formation and strategy. During the game, you can introduce substitutions or view statistics. While playing, the players can be controlled in eight directions, and there are keys to pass, change the active player, tackle, and shoot. The amount of time you keep a key pressed defines the power, length, of the type of shot. This allows for specific moves such as lobs, cross passes, headers, through passes and clearance kicks.

sample_screenshots.caption: Fernando Torres puts Spain in the lead against Korea.
The red line you need to avoid in the Scenario mode.

title: FIFA 06

description: When Odie wakes Garfield, the cat becomes furious and in the spur of the moment Odie is kicked out. Playing as Garfield, you have to get Odie back by following his trail of bones. This platformer has different level themes and enemies. You collect items (lasagna, coffee) and kill or stun enemies such as spiders, mice, ghosts, bats, zombies and dogs by throwing newspapers or by jumping on top of them. To finish a level, you need to collect a set amount of bones. A part of the game is based on activating coloured platforms by throwing switches. You can also scout the entire level with a key before proceeding. There are save points during a level and after completing it, you can select the location from the main menu.

sample_screenshots.caption: Inside a warehouse where mice rule.

title: Garfield's Day Out

description: The J2ME adaptation of EA's yearly football game offers four game modes: Friendly, Tournament, Practice and Shoot out. No local clubs are offered, only national teams. The action is shown through an isometric perspective. Some management options are available as well: line-up, strategy and formation. All players have different statistics, based on the team position, natural position, passing, shooting, saving, speed, tackling and aggression.
title: FIFA Soccer 2005: Mobile International Edition

description:
Lava Lava is a simple arcade game, where the player has to save cities all over the world from falling lava bombs. The locations are based on four real world volcanoes: Mount Fuji in Japan, Mount Merapi in Indonesia, Mount Kilamanjaro in Tanzania and Mount McKinley in the USA.

The game is played using the number keys. Each lava bomb has a number between 0 and 9, and to destroy them, the corresponding number on the key pad will have to be pressed. Saving the buildings within the time limit will allow the player to move on to the next level. The game has a online global scoreboard where players can submit their highscores.

sample_screenshots.caption: The train arrives as the lava bombs start falling. (Nokia S60)
Maybe not the best time to harvest. (Nokia S60)
The village is almost completely destroyed. (Nokia S60)

title: Lava Lava

description:
Metal Slug: Mobile is an adaptation of the Metal Slug franchise, for mobile phones. Unlike its sequel, Metal Slug: Mobile Impact, the art, weapons and gameplay are only loosely based on the original game. You control the hero Marco Rossi through eight side-scrolling levels where you need to take out enemies and free prisoners of war. There are new weapons and upgrades, and unlike the original game, you do not die after a single hit as there is a health meter. There is no multi-directional firing either, you can only shoot in two directions, with an additional key to shoot upwards.

Items you can collect include bonus items for points, health kits and weapon upgrades. A few missions also give the opportunity to drive a tank and to fly a jet. You do not need to rotate the tank's gun yourself, it automatically aims for targets. Most of the missions take place against a city or a jungle backdrop.
title: Metal Slug: Mobile

description: 1945 AirWar is a vertically-scrolling 1942 clone. There is no story, players control a small plane fighting many waves of flying opponents in five levels with different themes. Different power-ups provide weapon upgrades, health or a beam that clears the entire screen. At the end of each level, a giant boss needs to be defeated. The game comes with an autofire option and a high scores screen.
title: 1945 AirWar

description:
1941: Frozen Front is a turn-based strategy game shown through a top-down perspective. The gameplay is identical to 1805: French Empire but this game is set during World War II with relevant units and terrain. The singleplayer mode consists of a campaign with eight consecutive missions. Enemies need to be taken out, specific units need to be escorted, villages are captured and messengers are ambushed. The player and the computer opponent take turns with actions on the battlefield.

The army consists of tanks, transporters and infantry. The opponent has tanks, jeeps and antitank units. Each phase, units can be moved and they attack when an opponent is in range. The outcome is determined by the unit type and the terrain. Rushing tactics do not work, the moves need to be planned and the terrain can be put to an advantage, for instance by attacking from a height. Slower units such as infantry can board a transporter to move around more quickly. Many missions start with scattered units on different sides of the map. There is no building or resource management involved, all missions need to be completed with the units available at the start.

The units' health is shown through coloured bars, along with the amount of hexagons they can move. Navigate can also be done through a mini-map in the top right corner. The missions are introduced through a short briefing and after each round a statistics screen is shown. Two players can battle on a single device in the multiplayer hothand mode. There are four scenarios on larger maps available and all types of units are available right away in this mode.

sample_screenshots.caption: Each hexagon represents a single movement point.
The tank can still move and attack.
You can ambush incoming units on this road.
This unit has no more movement points left and he's too far to attack the transporter.

title: 1941: Frozen Front

description:
After studying abroad for many years, Jack Spade returns to Prague with his bride Angela. They shared their Czech childhood together, but Jack's memories are only faint, though they plague his dreams with shreds of horrible events. When he wakes up one morning, Angela has disappeared, and demons are roaming the streets. While defeating the creatures and freeing Angela, you will learn more about your past and the source of your nightmares.

The mobile adaptation of the Nightmare Creatures franchise is set in the same universe and borrows some storyline elements from Nightmare Creatures II. It is not a 3d action game, however, as it relies on the classic 2D side-scrolling beat-em-up concept. Jack travels through six levels, based on three environments with a baroque atmosphere: the streets of Prague, a dungeon and a graveyard

Jack has a vast amount of moves, from regular combos, blocks with counter, to jumping attacks (single, double or contrary against a wall), holds and special moves such as Lost Judgment, Ahab Revenge and Bloody Ballerina. Not all of those are available right away, they need to be unlocked by collecting items. You can also be infected and temporarily transform into the creatures you meet. Opponents have specific weaknesses and you will also need to avoid obstacles and explosive crates.

sample_screenshots.caption: Jack has transformed into a flying creature.
With certain power-ups, fire appears when you strike.
You can easily jump outside of the screen to evade powerful attacks.

title: Nightmare Creatures

description: Aberrance is a futuristic side-scrolling shooter. You control a hero with a jet pack through three organic levels, each with a boss. You only have one weapon, but by picking up the M, H and P icons enemies leave behind, you receive additional firepower through small rockets. These either travel over the ground or ceiling, or seek a moving target. You need to move quickly, as there is only a limited amount of oxygen at your disposal, and only few enemies leave behind refills. The jet pack allows you to travel faster, but you need to come down regularly to recharge it. In difficult situations, you can charge your gun for a long, powerful blast.

sample_screenshots.caption: Pick up the H icon to upgrade your weapon.
Multiple enemies in the third level

title: Aberrance

description: Help Koda and Kenai, the two bears from the animated Disney film Brother Bear, collect fish to feed the other bears. The game consists of six short platform levels. To complete the task, you need to use the two bears' abilities. Koda is smaller and can move through narrow passages and ride on Kenai's back. The strong Kenai can move blocks or destroy them. Both bears work together in all levels and you can switch between them at any time. Trees can be used to move between platforms, and if you are stuck the level can be restarted.

sample_screenshots.caption: You often need to switch between the bears to collect all fish.
Kenai clears the way for Koda.

title: Brother Bear

description:
The Da Vinci Code: Light Puzzle is the first of four mobile games based on the movie based on Dan Brown's novel. The game takes place in the Rosslyn Chapel in Scotland, where Robert Langdon and Sophie Neveau are searching for hidden messages in the walls.

To find these messages, you have to direct the light coming from the windows of the chapel into coloured crystals. This is done by placing mirrors around the room to reflect the light.
