For each puzzle that is completed you will be given a letter, used to uncover the hidden messages. The further you get in the game the more object you will have to handle. In addition to normal mirrors you have double-sided mirrors that can direct two light beams at the same spot, and devices that can split the light into multiple beams. You can also bend and recolour the beam using prisms, lenses and other devices that will be available as the game progresses. Each puzzle must completed within a set number of moves before the sun sets.

sample_screenshots.caption: This device will split the light in two beams.
In this puzzle you have to direct the light through three crystals.
Between levels there's dialogue with Langdon and Neveau.

title: The Da Vinci Code: Light Puzzle

description:
This Worms variant is quite similar to the original game: the player controls a team of worms and has to get rid of the opponent teams with unorthodox weapons on unusual terrains.

Players can manage up to four teams with up to four worms (human or AI), and customize their team and worm names, the weapon options, and game options including weapon ammo, health, turn time, terrain theme, etc.

There are many weapons to choose from, from basic ones like bazooka, grenade, firepunch, to more powerful ones like the holy hand grenade, banana bomb or even utilities such as the jetpack. Players can also choose between two terrain themes and open or closed maps.

sample_screenshots.caption: The holy grenade is my favorite.

title: Worms

description:
In the mobile version of Call of Duty 2, you take the roles of various soldiers fighting through World War II. There's four years (1942-1945), each one with two soldiers to choose from, each with their own set of missions. Everything but the first missions are locked, and you have to complete them to unlock the later ones, eventually unlocking the next year as soon as you finish every mission in the earlier one.

The missions can vary wildly, from location to objective and weapons. In some missions you have a team of soldiers to help you out, in others you have to work solo. You'll be instructed along the mission on what to do, as well as receiving hints and tips on how to do it. You may have to take down enemy troops, call in airstrikes, hide from bomber attacks, destroy enemy vehicles or even be left all alone sniping enemy units. The time you take to beat the mission is stored so you can try to beat the default "best time" or your own best time.

The game works in a pseudo top-down view, since the game works like a 2D top-down but the scenario is rather 3D. Most of the maps are similar, having you start on the bottom and having to make your way up to the top to progress through the mission. You can crawl under sandbags or hide behind buildings for cover, and sometimes there's medics spread around to assist you. The weapons are varied, from pistols, machine guns, sniper, bazooka or even a walkie-talkie to call in airstrikes. Most of the weapons simply fire forward, but to help you aim, some can "auto-point" at nearby targets, and others have a reticule that you move around with the D-Pad.
title: Call of Duty 2

description:
Atari Legends Vol. 1 is a compilation containing three classic Atari 2600 games, ported to the mobile platform:

  • Asteroids
  • Centipede
  • Combat
title: Atari Legends Vol. 1

description:
Three years after the third major Rayman game, the limbless hero returns for a new adventure. Unlike the console versions of the game with the 1st-person hunting gameplay, the mobile Rayman Raving Rabbids is a traditional side-scrolling platformer. In the past, Rayman's world was filled with cute, cuddly rabbids. They were constantly victimised by the other species, however, and suddenly vanished from the planet. Decades later, they resurface as psychotic creatures with a vengeance. Only Rayman can save the world from these mad bunnies.

You control Rayman through eight levels based on three environments, based on the themes forest, beach and the rabbid's HQ. The enemies are designed to fit the atmosphere. Initially, Rayman is only armed with his fist, but he can pick up weapons such as the plunger gun and air pump gun. He can also do Sonic-like rolls, swing on poles, do wallruns, bungee-jumps and kung-fu moves. The gameplay is fast and you can ride creatures such as pigs for transportation. Level bosses make a regular appearance.

sample_screenshots.caption: Hold on to these while they fly in the air.
One of the first bosses you meet.
Reminiscent of <moby gamegroup="Sonic the Hedgehog">Sonic the Hedgehog</moby>.

title: Rayman: Raving Rabbids

description:
The mobile version of Dead or Alive: Xtreme Beach Volleyball shows the players through a side-view. Your character can only move to the left, the right, and jump. With anime-styled graphics, you can practise in the training mode or take on a single opponent through nines levels with increasing difficulty in the arcade mode. All matches are played one-on-one. Only two buttons are used for moves. One makes your character dive to save a ball, while the other one is used for reception, smashes and serves.

Some additional strategy is added through a power meter. By standing still and anticipating the position of the incoming ball, you can build up a power meter to set up a smash. This can also be applied for powerful serves. Matches consist of two winning sets with eleven points each, and not all stages in the arcade mode are available right away, albeit looking identical. The menus' backgrounds are taken from the Xbox version of the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level selection screen in the arcade mode

title: Dead or Alive: Xtreme Beach Volleyball

description:
Sexy Poker 2006, the sequel to Sexy Poker 2004, is a strip poker game for mobile phones. It offers three game modes and six girls (with a different difficulty level) to play against. Initially, only one mode and one girl is available, the others need to be unlocked. You can practise in quick game or go for full games. The game types are regular poker, blackjack and video poker where all regular rules apply. In the Video poker variant, 5 cards are dealt and you only swap your cards once. Based on the value of that hand, you are awarded cash, without raising, folding or calling.

Advancing is based on cash. You only need to complete one game type against a girl to win the level. If you do well and drive a girl into debt, she starts betting pieces of clothing in exchange for cash. If you manage to win consecutive games, the girls win back their clothes until you run out of cash. Relieving a girl of clothes happens in four stages, and a certain area is blurred out if you managed to completely reveal an opponent. If you move on to the next level, the girl is added to a gallery where you can undress or clothe her in different phases. The theme music is a digitized version of Donna Summer's Hot Stuff.

sample_screenshots.caption: A regular game of poker against Emma, the final opponent.
A game of blackjack with Tianna

title: Sexy Poker 2006

description:
Sexy Poker 2004 is the first strip poker game in Gameloft's Sexy Poker series. You can play three games - regular poker, blackjack and video poker - against six girls. Unlike the sequel, Sexy Poker 2006, all game modes and girls are available right away. Progress is measured by the amount of cash acquired. By betting and raising the stakes or pot, you can make the girls exchange a piece of clothing for additional cash. Although the game is shown through a first-person view, you can also bet your own clothes when you are almost bankrupt, but if you fail again it is a long way home naked.

A different difficulty level has been assigned to each girl, and they also have a specific playing style, visible through their ways of bluffing, folding and raising bets. Girls are revealed completely, except for one specific, blurred-out area. After winning the game, you can choose to keep playing for a high score. Defeated girls are shown in the gallery where you go through the dressing and undressing process with a few button taps.

sample_screenshots.caption: Choose an opponent by browsing magazine covers.
The pot in this game is quite impressive, but not unusual.

title: Sexy Poker 2004

description:
This is the sequel to Siberian Strike: Episode I, based on the Palm game of the same name originally released in 2001, but split up and converted for mobile phones as two separate games. In this 1942-like top-down vertically-scrolling shooter, you are Eliot Freeman and you start playing right away in level 4a in a fight against the Russians. No further background story is offered. This game consists of three additional levels, split up into two parts each with an end boss. The action takes place on the Russian seaboard, an underground passage and finally at the enemy's base.

The gameplay itself has not been changed. You need to destroy everything on the screen, and your base weapon (two bullets) can be upgraded to up to four. Additional pick-ups include medals for extra points, planes providing extra lives, bombs destroying everything on the screen, and a green icon to summon two companions providing additional fire for a short time. You can also charge a mega ray at will, by keeping a key pressed for three seconds, causing more damage than with regular bullets.

Enemies include tanks, planes, stationary turrets, trains and giant missiles. Certain parts of the environment can also be destroyed to reveal bonuses. The game supports autofire and sports a high score screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Inside the enemy base, attacked by a heavily protected train.
A small enemy base with turrets
A giant plane as a level boss (level 4)

title: Siberian Strike: Episode II

description:
The gameplay of Sexy Poker: Top Models is identical to the other games in the Sexy Poker series, but it now comes with 5 fictitious top models as opponents. Challenge them in a game of regular poker, blackjack or video poker to drive them into debt and make them cash their clothes. Not all opponents and modes are available right away, they need to be unlocked gradually. After beating a girl, she is added to the gallery where you can view the undressing process.

One of the small gameplay changes includes higher initial bets (up to $100). The girls are also less revealing: frontal nudity is covered by small stars and the full monty cannot be achieved.

sample_screenshots.caption: Meet Dixie. I'm about to fold here.
A game of blackjack against Donna
This is as far as the nudity goes.

title: Sexy Poker: Top Models

description: Small Faces is a clone of PopCap's Bejeweled, only that the jewelry in different colors now has been replaced with faces with different grimaces. You have a grid of faces in different colors. Now you have to create groups of at least three similar faces by switching adjacent faces. Once you do so the faces will be removed and the faces above will fall down to take the empty places. You have limited time for each swap you want to make. The time you have depends on which of the nine difficulty levels you choose. Once time's run out, it's game over. A practice mode with unlimited time is also available.

sample_screenshots.caption: Move the blue face to the right, to create a row with three green faces.

title: Small Faces

description:
Asphalt 3: Street Rules is an over-the-top mobile arcade racer sharing gameplay elements with the Need for Speed and Burnout games. The game offers races in seven major cities with 12 licensed cars and bikes, including the Pagani Zonda F, Lamborghini Gallardo Spyder, Kawasaki ZX10 R and others.

Each city offers 4 challenges out of 5 modes: regular races, beat 'em all (destroy as many opponents as possible), cop chase (chase a bunch of racers as a cop and take out the leader), duel (place a bet and beat a single opponent) and cash attack (make as much cash as you can). The tracks are filled with obstacles and traffic. By performing illegal acts such as power sliding, crashing through roadblocks, speeding or wiping out opponents' cars, or collecting bonuses, you earn boosts. If you have a sufficient amount, you can even use up to two boosts at the same time, often a requirement to break through obstacles or take out other cars. Illegal acts raise your wanted level and you will be chased by patrol cars and helicopters. If your driving becomes really outrageous, you even appear on live news feeds.

By winning races, you earn new cars, girls who cheer for you, and tuning parts. Unlike common practice, you do not need to pay for cars or parts, they are available right away once unlocked. The different tuning parts include the car colour, tyres, cubic capacity, cylinders, piston, vinyls, rims, engine, air filters, weight modifiers, exhaust, brakes, transmission, shock absorbers, ECU and crankshift. New races and cities are unlocked if you earn a sufficient amount of cash.

The game's theme song is a digitized version of Nick Roubanis' Misirlou.

sample_screenshots.caption: This yellow car has just been wiped out.
Car select screen, this is the last but one car to gather.

title: Asphalt 3: Street Rules

description: A 3D upgrade to the original mobile Pub Pool game from IOMO, this version contains a variety of game modes (with various rule-sets for 6-ball, 8-ball, 9-ball, 15-ball and killer pool), as well as a story mode where the player must win matches against progressively more difficult AI opponents, unlocking AI opponents for the Practice mode, as well as trophies and new cues to use.

sample_screenshots.caption: Pub landlord Terry gives the introduction to each frame.
You can set the baize colour.

title: Pub Pool 3

description: In this Boulder Dash clone, caveman Fred needs to collect coins in an underground maze. There are then levels and after collecting all coins, an exit icon appears. As new tunnels are dug, Fred need to avoid or push around boulders. These can also be used to crush enemies such as spiders and ghosts. Fred only has three lives, but when a level is completed, it becomes available right away in new games.
title: Cave Man

description:
Beverly Hills teenage superspies Sam, Clover, and Alex are whisked away from their classroom by their boss Joey, leader of the secret World Organization of Human Protection (WOOHP). The Scarab of Salitis has been stolen from an Egyptian pyramid and the girls have to retrieve it. That first mission will then take them to Himalayan Mountains and finally a space station - 8 levels in total.

Based on the French animation series of the same name, the player controls one of the 3 girls through side-scrolling platforms environments. Based on the phones' screen sizes, there are 3 versions and they differ in moves, the amount of levels and certain features. Gameplay consists of avoiding obstacles, timing jumps to platforms and fighting enemies. Enemies can be taken out from behind, using objects in the environment, or by a series of fighting combos. Using gadgets provided by their boss Joey, they can swing over holes, pull levers from a distance, or use a jet pack. Two levels have the player only fly a jet pack, while being chased and avoiding obstacles.

During the levels, the story is further explained through small in-game cutscenes. The beginning of the game also serves as the tutorial, where the various possibilities are gradually explained.

sample_screenshots.caption: While running on top of a snowball, keep pressing left or right to remain in the centre. (large screen)
Clover is chased in the air. (medium screen)

title: Totally Spies!: The Mobile Game

description:
New York Nights: Success in the City is Gameloft's take on The Sims with lifestyle elements from The Urbz thrown in. You control a twentysomething dropped in New York with a 40-day lease. During this short period, you have to make a career, meet new people and engage in social activities. After creating a character, you can distribute 20 points over beauty, health, humor and culture; the four main statistics that define a character throughout the game.

There is only a limited amount of time in a day, so actions have to be chosen wisely. By visiting locations such as a sports club, a theater, a style salon, or a club, you can choose which aspects of your personality you want to improve. You also need to eat, sleep and wash up regularly. New people are saved in your cell phone. You can work on your friendship levels with regular talks, gossip, jokes, presents and flirting. Each character has specific interests and the outcome of your choices influences the levels. Friends can introduce you to jobs, where you have to complete mini-games to earn money.

The main storyline follows a quest-based approach. After meeting a few people, you can decide to pursue love. To attract someone's attention, you have to date, buy presents and raise certain levels of your character to impress your future lover, e.g. culture by going to a concert, humor by playing video games (?).

The game is shown through an isometric perspective and you can move around freely. While talking, different topics appear as a circle around your character. New locations are visited through a map. Your cash balance, the time of the day, and the cell phone where friends, quests and messages are stored, are all shown in the corners of the screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Your cell phone where all important information is stored.
Each contact has a friendship meter. Matt is still a complete stranger here.
Gaining new levels sometimes goes at the cost of others.

title: New York Nights: Success in the City

description:
Based on the American television comedy-drama of the same name, The O.C. is a re-skin of New York Nights: Success in the City, but more story-driven and with the addition of mini-games. In this Sims/dating game using an isometric perspective, you guide one of the series' protagonists - Ryan, Seth, Marissa or Summer - through their lives in Orange County, California. Each character has a unique look and characteristics based on style, maturity, intelligence and attitude. The aim of the game is to keep your friends happy as well as taking care of daily tasks.

All important information is stored in your cell phone. Friends call you to schedule meetings, you can view your current objectives, statistics and schedules, go through your inventory, or call to get to know a friend's current location. Basic quests include raising your four main characteristics, performing tasks for your friends, earning money, and buying specific items. There are also a few relationships to pursue, as there are many characters in town. Through an overview map, you can visit the student's lounge, rooms of friends, shops, etc. To raise your statistics, you can train with a punch bag, tutor another student, work in a diner to earn money, play video games, watch television, or go shopping.

You can talk to other characters, apologize or offend them, joke, or offer gifts. When a romantic relationship is introduced, it also becomes possible to perform more intimate actions. Conversations, as well as all other main activities, are presented as mini-games, somewhat reminiscent of those in Leisure Suit Larry: Magna Cum Laude. There are memory games, top-down driving sequences, games of catch, and even the classic Asteroids.

sample_screenshots.caption: Multiple option appear when approaching a character, but not all of them are available right away.
Grab all the smileys in this mini-game to keep a good conversation going.
There is a storyline as well.
Complete objectives to advance the story.

title: The OC

description:
Dungeons of Despair is an isometric RPG game where the player can explore a multitude of levels with many different types of monsters to face and slay, numerous quests to undertake, and an item generation system that allows for thousands of items with different magical attributes.

The two versions (Gold for Nokia s60/equivalent and Lite for s40/equivalent) differ slightly in the number of levels and the design of the levels. The Gold version offers extra quests and a few extra types of items, but the core engine remains the same for both, along with all the attributes and player stats.

The gold version has over 60 levels and numerous secret areas - some of which can be found by chancing upon scrolls showing their entrances. The Lite version has just over 20 main levels and 1 secret area.

As well as basic attributes such as health, strength, defence, and dexterity, there are numerous other attributes such as luck, life-leech, regeneration, damage returned (to an attacker), stun... as well as damage modifiers. The player also has weapon proficiencies which improve the more the player uses a particular weapon. Daggers deal low damage but provide very quick attacks - useful if you have a good chance of stunning an opponent every successful attack. On the other end of the scale, two-handed weapons provide large damage but with a much slower attack rate. These can be particularly useful if you have a good life-leeching rate. Single handed weapons allow you to carry a shield which dramatically increases your chance to parry an attack.

The multitude of weapons, modifiers and items in the game allow the player to complete the game in a manner that suits them and provides several different playing strategies.
title: Dungeons of Despair

alternate_titles.title: DSA: Nedime - Die Tochter des Kalifen
Das Schwarze Auge: Nedime - Die Tochter des Kalifen
USNB Nedime - La figlia del califfo

description:
Nedime - The Caliph's Daughter is the first part of The Dark Eye (TDE) mobile fantasy RPG series. Your first action will be to create a new hero choosing from a variation of 14 original classes based on the Pen&Paper (P&P) RPG. You can then customize your heroes' stats and abilities in classic role-playing fashion by assigning points to create new strengths or compensate weaknesses. Once done you have the option to save your hero and even transfer it to any of the sequels, taking over any earned experience and improving your odds of success.

Throughout the story you are presented with multiple choice decisions. Some of them will require good intuition, others dice-rolling based on your heroes' stats. Fights are handled very similar. All of this is based on the TDE 20 sided dice system (not to be confused with D&D D20).

The game story is based on Aventuria, a Continent in the world of Dere, where swords and magic have created many different cultures and races. Unlike most common medieval RPGs, Aventuria has made quite a number of cultural and social advancements which place it more into the region of a magic enlightened Renaissance. The original German P&P RPG, consisting of hundreds of books and novels, has been brought over by the original authors of some TDE publications.

This adventure takes you right into the mysterious palace of sultan Hasrabal, who has abducted and imprisoned the beautiful daughter of the Caliph. It is up to you to help Nedime in her time of dire need.

sample_screenshots.caption: From time to time your attributes will be tested - if you fail, there will be a different following scene.
A typical game scene: the story is told as text with some embedded pictures.
There are a lot of different attributes to increase!

title: The Dark Eye: Nedime - The Caliph's Daughter

description:
Enter the glittering Capone casino. You are given a loan, interest payable of course, by the notorious Big Al to play in his premises. While you are flush he is your friend but fail to payback Al in time and he will make a messy example of you, enforced by his trusty sidekick Peanuts.

Casino Games includes 2 table games (Roulette and Blackjack) and 2 machine games (Video Poker and Slot Machine). Standard Vegas rules are followed for all games. The characters, casino environment and casino objects are built in full 3D. When doing well, membership cards can be earned. Become a Platinum Member, where the stakes are higher, and you will earn Al's respect.
title: Capone Casino 3D

description:
Lucky Luke: Outlaws is a first-person side-scrolling shooter based on the famous comics series about the poor lonesome cowboy who can draw a gun faster than his shadow: Lucky Luke. The Dalton brothers have escaped from their prison, along with numerous bandits, and Lucky Luke suspects they are involved with the missing gold of an Austin-bound train. After discovering the convoy, they also kidnap the bank's daughter.

The game is started with a number of life points according to one of three difficulty levels, and a colt with a limited number of bullets. The cowboy has to disarm his opponents by moving a cross-hair shaped cursor over the screen and firing at the right time. Four flashing arrows indicate where to find the opponents. If it takes too long, a timer starts and when the countdown is complete, Lucky Luke loses a life.

When beating an opponent, Lucky Luke sometimes recovers money or additional bullets, along with points added to the score. If an opponent isn't found in time, Lucky Luke can dodge the incoming shot by pressing a key. On a succesful dodging attempt, the cowboy must then find the shooter to disarm him and attack the next opponent. Some enemies also have hostages who cannot be fired at. The five levels hold bonuses hidden in the scenery. Next to cash and bullets, these include stars (life points) and horseshoes (+2 seconds for Luke to protect himself). The final stage ends with a battle against the Dalton brothers.

sample_screenshots.caption: Big Eagle leads you to the location of the Daltons.
Make sure not to target the hostage.
First level: a countdown of five seconds has just been started.

title: Lucky Luke: Outlaws

description: In this isometric kart game, set in the Moorhuhn universe, races are set on narrow tracks, shown through a top-down perspective. There are three background settings available: desert, canyon and outdoor, providing three different tracks in total. Player can either try to beat the tracks in the Grand Prix mode, against three computer-controlled players, or beat the best times on their own in the Time Trial mode. While racing, there are power-ups to collect, such as turbo to increase the speed, chewing gum to make the other karts get stuck, and an egg to throw to slow another car down. Players can choose from 5 characters: Moorhuhn, Lesshuhn, Moorfrosh, Pumpkin and Schneemann.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Grand Prix race on the desert track

title: Moorhuhn: Kart Racer

description: The mobile version of the console Colin McRae Rally 2005 game, the J2ME version contains tracks in 4 countries with 3 stages for each track. Damage taken can be repaired between stages, but you've got a limited amount of time you can spend in the service area each time so you may not be able to repair everything if you take too much damage. The game includes various modes of play (including an option to race against a ghost of a previous lap), and weather effects on some of the tracks.
title: Colin McRae Rally 2005

description: The first in iomo's series of Pub games, Pub Pool introduces the familiar setting of the player whiling away some time, playing a game down their local drinking establishment. In this instance, the game on offer is obviously pool. UK 8-ball pool is played (the balls coloured red and yellow, not spots and stripes as would be expected in US 8-ball) and the player can play hot-seat against another human opponent on the one handset, or against 1 of 3 difficulty-levels of AI opponent. Barman Terry referees the match whilst other locals pop up occasionally to comment on particularly good or bad shots.

sample_screenshots.caption: The player also has the option to change the baize colour
One of the locals chips in after a bad shot
Terry tells the player how to play
The main menu, depicted as drawn on a chalkboard in a pub

title: Pub Pool

description:
Atari Legends Vol. 2 is a compilation containing three classic Atari games, ported to the mobile platform:

  • Breakout
  • Lunar Lander
  • Missile Command
title: Atari Legends Vol. 2

description: In this BMW-licensed racing game, only one track is available from the beginning. By beating a time limit, the player can progress and take part in the Rookie Cup, and finally move on to the Formula BMW Championship. This game contains all 7 Formula BMW German tracks. The driving is shown from the first-person perspective and there are options to tune car aerodynamics, gears and suspension.
title: Formula BMW Racing Game 2003

description: In this fast-paced racing game, the player takes on the role of Skaterboy on a flying skateboard. The game consists of checkpoint-based races on tracks in an old canyon, the metropolis and a snowy valley, where the finish needs to be reached in time while avoiding obstacles by steering around them, jumping or ducking. Bonus items can be picked up to increase the number of lives, health or engage the auto-pilot mode. There are three difficulty levels.
title: Sk8terBoy

description: Kamasutris is a Tetris variant where all the blocks have been replaced by naked men and women in different positions. They enter the screen from the top, one by one, and can be turned around. The player needs to guide them to the bottom of the screen in a comfortable position to have intercourse with another "block". When that happens, a short animation is shown and the couple disappears from the screen, freeing up room. The game is over when the stack of people reaches the top of the screen. The game has 10 difficulty levels with increasing speed.
title: Kamasutris

description:
The empire has found proof of a rebel base on the distant planet of Mygeeto. Lord Vader has given orders to send a fleet of Imperial Star Destroyers. The player takes the role of a elite pilot of the Imperial Navy, and has to control his TIE Fighter through several different missions.

Star Wars: Imperial Ace is a third-person space shooter, where you get to play both space and ground missions. Like with all Fishlabs games the graphics are completely rendered in 3D. In the first mission of the game you are to scout the planets orbit for enemy activity. The game continues after that with four more missions leading up to the attack of the rebel base. After each mission you will get a score depending on how many enemy fighters you have shot down. Before a mission you will get a list of targets that needs yo be taken down to complete a mission. The different difficulty levels are available, from easy to hard.

sample_screenshots.caption: Another level in a asteroid field

title: Star Wars: Imperial Ace

description: The mobile game Block Buster is a Breakout variant. The player controls a paddle at the bottom of the screen used to to hit a ball, which in turn hits the blocks. Sometimes when the ball hits a block, an item drops from it, providing multiple balls, a change of speed or altering the paddle size. To move on to a next stage, all blocks need to be removed from the screen. The game has 8 stages.
title: BlockBuster

description: 2004 Long Jump is a short arcade game released in the year of the 2004 Olympics in Athens, Greece. Players have to try to better the 8.95 metres world record. Games consist of single sessions, with multiple tries. The athlete runs forward by tapping a key. When the line is close, Fire needs to be pressed to select the jump angle, again to accept it and once more to fall forward after the jump.
title: 2004 Long Jump

description:
2004 Real Football/Soccer is the first game in the Real Soccer series. It is a 2D game with basic controls: three buttons to perform a short pass, a long pass and a shot (attack face), and tackles (defense phase), while the other keys control the movement. Active players not in possession of the ball are automatically selected when they are nearby.

The game is centered around nations and all players are fully licensed. Three game modes are available: Exhibition, International Cup and European Cup. Prior to a game, the duration, difficulty and group can be selected. Each player has a specific position and statistics based on four values: Attack, Defense, Speed and Reaction.

sample_screenshots.caption: The Netherlands is ready for a free kick.
Brazil puts a lot of pressure on the defense of Turkey.
Team selection in the European Cup

title: 2004 Real Soccer

description:
2005 Real Football/Soccer is the second game in the series and the perspective was changed into an isometric view. The game is once again fully licensed and offers different game modes: Quick Play, Exhibition, Cup, League and Training. Contrary to the previous games, a few famous clubs such as Liverpool and AC Milan are now also available, next to the national teams.

The core gameplay remains: three buttons for actions such as tackles, passes and shots, but now with the addition of a power meter for the players, which can be maxed out after successful actions. Other novelties include crosses, actions in the air, a double tap on a movement key to sprint, and player-controlled movement for the keeper during penalties. Prior to a game, the player can set the formation and change the positions. The players still have individual skills based on four settings.

After winning cups, the players can collect trophies stored in a gallery. There is also a small mini-game when a streaker enters the pitch. He needs to outrun the stewards and get as close to the players as possible.
title: 2005 Real Soccer

description:
3D Pool is the first game in the mobile pool series by Distinctive Developments. Players can play regular pool games in 4 main modes: Single Player, Two Player (hot seat mode), Trick Shot and Practice. In the singleplayer mode players need to beat progressively difficult opponents. Initially, Manic Mike is the only opponent, but seven more can be unlocked later on: Slow Joe, Lucky Lucy, Flash Phil, Boring Bob, In-off Anna, Hurrican Harry and Clean-up Carl.

The game uses a full 3D engine and the action can be viewed through a top-down view and a freely rotatable camera. Prior to a shot the player needs to choose a fitting direction, define the spin and then the power of the shot. The table colour can be defined in the options.

sample_screenshots.caption: A more distant camera to get a better overview

title: 3D Pool

description:
Othello, also called Reversi, is a strategic board game played by two parties on a 8x8 grid. The game uses pieces with a white and a dark face, representing the two players' colours. Players lay pieces on the board alternately, one stone at a time. Every piece has to be put at a place where it touches the opponent's stone row of any length, while there is a player's stone at the of the row. All captured stones in between can then be reversed and become the player's colour. The only limitation is that the entire row needs to be of a single colour and without free spaces. When all pieces are used, the players with more pieces of his colour on the board is the winner.

3D Othello Deluxe uses a 3D engine to show the game. As more pieces appear on the board, the camera gradually zooms out to give a better overview. There are 3 levels of difficulty and two human players can compete against each other (hot seat).

sample_screenshots.caption: This is how he game starts.

title: 3D Othello Deluxe

description: 4x4 Extreme Rally 2006 is a top-down rally with 27 tracks all over the world. There are 4 cars to choose from and they can be upgraded in different ways after winning races. The available game modes are Time Trial, Race, Cup and 2-player multiplayer in the multiYou! Bluetooth mode. The different tracks need to be unlocked by winning races. Each Cup or Race game is played with 3 computer-controlled opponents. The tracks contain obstacles and different surfaces that slow down the vehicles, but there are also shortcuts to drift through and different weather schemes. Prior to each race, there are 5 music tracks to choose from.
title: 4x4 Extreme Rally 2006

description: Set in the year 2020, this top-down arcade shooter takes place in different mazes. The aim of the game is to free captured girls and kill hostiles walking around, while finding the key and the exit to move on to the next level before time runs out. The player can be guided into eight directions (horizontal/vertical/diagonal) and a single button is used to fire a shot. Points are awarded for killing baddies, freeing the girls and completing a level. In the beginning the player has three lives. Additional ones can be earned by completing a level.

sample_screenshots.caption: The red stripe is a bullet, it looks feeble.
First level: fallen enemies are shown this way.

title: 2020 Special Ops

description:
After the Ukrainian Chernobyl disaster in 1986, scientists put forward a new hypothesis about the cause based on mascots of the Inca civilization found in the area after the events. An expedition discovers an underground pyramid, built by the Incas as they had predicted the explosion. It is designed to absorb radiation but needs 6 stones to be activated. The KGB sends special security agent Vlad Gromov on a mission to collect the stones, activate the pyramid and destroy the creatures that attacked the initial expedition.

Inca vs Chernobyl is an arcade platform shooter with six levels. The main character, Vlad Gromov, can duck, jump, climb ladders, run and shoot. Certain objects can be destroyed and there are also keys to look ahead of the screen. There are 8 different weapons to collect, including grenades, a Kalashnikov, a shotgun, a flamethrower, an Inca artifact... Additional ammo, armor and health is scattered around the levels. The 7 enemy types include mutants, insects, flying wasps and pterodactyls, and two bosses. While playing, dialogue screens appear to develop the plot.
title: Inca vs Chernobyl

description:
Absolute Puzzle is a compilation of three simple puzzle games. The included games are:* Clear Out: select groups of two or more blocks of the same color from a board. Think ahead to avoid getting stuck in the end.

  • Blockers: move blocks of different size on a board so the yellow block can access the exit (gameplay similar to Jammed).

  • Light Up: set and rotate mirrors to make the beam touch specific targets.

The individual games have also been re-packaged as stand-alone versions with more features than the versions included in this compilation.
title: Absolute Puzzle

description: Clear Out is an improved stand-alone version of the puzzle game of the same name included in the Absolute Puzzle compilation. The aim of the game is to select groups of two or more blocks of the same color (horizontal of vertical) from a board to clear it. Next to the Normal mode where an entire screen needs to be cleared, this version adds a Chaos mode. In this time-sensitive mode, only half of the screen is filled with blocks, but new lines are added at regular intervals. When the lines reach the top of the screen, the game is over. There is also a bomb item in this mode - clicking it removes 6 adjacent blocks. Next to the new game mode, the graphics have also been improved.

sample_screenshots.caption: Ouch, there are way too many blocks left.
The Chaos mode, with the new bomb items shown.

title: Clear Out

description: Action Basketball offers one-on-one basketball games on half a court. Gameplay consists of different matches with mini-games in between. Each match is made up of different quarters (1.30 minutes in real time) until one of the players has a set amount of points. Only 5 keys are used: four to move and one to shoot, jump and block. Both players on the field alternately attack or defend after an attempt. Per phase, the player only has 15 seconds to perform an action. By running into the other character, it is also possible to receive or commit a foul. The mini-games consists of a three-pointer and a dunk contest.
title: Action Basketball

description: In Virtual Pilot the player needs to navigate a plane, shown from a third-person perspective, through rectangles. The craft can be steered left or right and the nose can be tilted up and down to increase or decrease the height. There is only one backdrop and three planes to choose from. For each rectangle passed successfully, points are awarded. If the player hits the side of the rectangle, a little damage is sustained. After covering a certain distance, the level is restarted (though the score is maintained) and the rectangles are approached with a faster speed.
title: Virtual Pilot

description: Xcite Bike is very straightforward racing game with bikes. The player has 180 seconds to cover as much distance as possible while taking turns and avoiding other riders. There is only one track and no further challenges or customization. The art mixes photographic images of the riders with hand-drawn backgrounds.
title: Xcite Bike

description:
TRON 2.0 3D is a mobile adaption of the TRON Light Cycles game. You take the role of an Encom employee, who is searching for proof that the company has used his video game programs wrongly. An executive of the company finds out about this and manages to trap him in a digital dimension. Now you have compete against other programs on the light cycle grid.

The goal of the light cycle game is to have your opponent crash into your wall that grows out of the back of the light cycle. For each match you and your opponent have three lives, so when you have won three matches you can move on to the next match in the tournament. A couple of power-ups also exist. Using them, you can increase your speed, go through walls or launch a missile towards your opponent. The game is entirely in 3D, and uses the same graphical design as the movie and its PC game sequel.

sample_screenshots.caption: Seeing the opponent in the distance
Crashing into the red tail means losing the game
After a while it gets a bit cluttered

title: Tron 2.0 3D

description:
Double Dragon EX is the second licensed mobile Double Dragon game and this version is a remix of previous releases on various platforms. Most of the content and sequences are taken from Double Dragon and Double Dragon II: The Revenge, but there are also elements from the GBA version and Super Double Dragon.

Playing as Billy or Jimmy Lee from the Double Dragon team, the player has to rid New York City from the Black Shadow Warriors and free Marian, Billy's fiancee, who has been taken captive. The controls consist of keys to move around, a punch, kick, jump, elbow, head butt, guard and squat, two grasping attacks (throw and knee), two seated attacks and various jumping attacks. Certain actions can be linked in two combos. There are also weapons to be picked up, such as knives and bats, and barrels can be grabbed and thrown at incoming enemies.

There are three time-limited levels, with sprites and backdrops taken from other games in the series, with a boss at the end, and also a few minor jumping sequences. The game's music features familiar Double Dragon tunes, there are 3 difficulty levels and also an option to alter the game's speed.

sample_screenshots.caption: Weapons such as a bat can be picked up.
Getting beat down in the first level

title: Double Dragon EX

description: Elf Tales is a straightforward platform game where the players controls an elf. In five levels against a time limit, the player constantly needs to move to the right, while attacking enemies or sometimes by jumping over them. There is a single key to jump and then four more to attack left or right (up and down). There are chests that hold items, which can restore health. Enemies include rats, skeletons and other creatures.
title: Elf Tales

description: Dribble is a simple football game where the player has to dribble past four defenders to reach the goal. The perspective then switches to first-person and two axes appear on the screen, to define the direction of your shot. The last step requires the player to choose the power of the kick. Based on the selection, a goal is scored, the keeper saves the ball or the shot goes over. The game then continuously loops the same process and keeps track of the amount of goals scored. A single session consists of 180 seconds.
title: Dribble

description:
Domino Quake has the player control the little dragon Gus O'Line in the Domino Quake championship tournament. With 60 puzzles set in 4 environments: Rapa Nui Island, India, Aztecs ruins and Egypt, the player needs to find a solution to make all the bricks in a scene topple. Borrowing elements from games such as The Incredible Machine, using springs, dynamite, springboards and cannons, the player only has a limited amount of moves during each puzzle.

To solve a puzzle, all bricks need to topple and the green one last. There are special bricks that introduce a lot of strategy, such as solid bricks, rolling bricks, bricks that are divided and go separate ways and delayed bricks. Each puzzle is time-limited but there are keys to add more time. Gus O'Line can pick up certain bricks and move them to another location, indicated by a blinking white square. To try the puzzle, the dragon breathes fire and makes the first brick topple. Puzzles become increasingly difficult, but there is an unlimited amount of tries. There is a key to toggle a dynamic camera to follow the action, a key to undo the last move, and a Help GUI to show the function of the different bricks.

sample_screenshots.caption: As you move on, puzzles become more complex.
An overview of the different items and their functions.

title: Domino Quake

description:
The mobile game The King of Fighters is based on the SNK beat-em-up series of the same name that debuted on the Neo Geo in the nineties.

There are four characters to play with, all taken from existing games: Kyo, Athena, Mai, and Terry. Only two characters are available in the beginning, the remaining needed to be unlocked by winning matches. After completing the game with all four characters, the Double mode is unlocked, where teams of two fighters play tag matches. Each character has its own backdrop and a character needs to win two fights to complete a match.

There are only a few keys for movement (including crouching and jumping), blocking and punching, along with a few combos and special moves that require a quick key combination. By hitting the opponent, a bar at the bottom of the screen can be filled up to three times. A full bar grants a super, a devastating move that damages opponents badly.

sample_screenshots.caption: A strike with the flaming fist
Terry performs a familiar special move.
Mai is about to get blown away by Athena's green fireball.
Kyo unleashes his super on the unsuspecting Athena.

title: The King of Fighters

description:
Featuring the appearance of Barcelona striker Samuel Eto'o, this game takes football to the streets. As with other street sports games, Underground Street Soccer goes for a more arcade-oriented recreation of the sport. Doing tricks is therefore an important part of the game. When doing tricks your freestyle bar will be filled. When the freestyle bar has been filled, you can do a freestyle move. To perform a freestyle move you have to press certain buttons at certain time intervals.

Three game modes are available. We have free match, where you play a single match with teams of your choice on one of the locations in the game, ranging from Brazil to France to Japan. Then we have the My Street mode, where you get to create your own team with your own players, and then play in a tournament against other teams from all over the world. After good performances you will be able to upgrade your team.

The third mode is the Challenge mode, where you have to duel against another player. This is done by doing tricks in the same way as you perform freestyle moves in the game. When succeeding you will gain momentum over your opponent, and when you have full momentum you win the duel.

sample_screenshots.caption: More dribbling. Let's see if we can score here.
Not the most effective trick, but at least it looks good.

title: Underground Street Soccer

alternate_titles.title: Das Schwarze Auge: Geheimnis der Zyklopen

description:
The second game in the TDE mobile series puts you in the area around the Cyclops Islands. Your goal is to find a necklace, consisting of amulets of the twelve gods, which was stolen from the Praios temple in Neetha. As the story already indicates, in contrast to the predecessor Nedime - The Caliph's Daughter you will travel a lot, often by ship, and explore several towns and islands.

Instead of creating a new character in the beginning it is also possible to play the game with a character that has already finished another part in the series (and was uploaded to Chromatic's servers).

Technically the game is almost identical to its predecessor. One of the enhancements (aside from the bigger world) is the introduction of a trading system, so it is now possible to buy and sell goods at shops in some places in the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is the necklace you are looking for
You can choose between three options here, indicated by a small arrow
The game is saved automatically at checkpoints (or when quitting the game). When you die, you may resume at one of these checkpoints.

title: The Dark Eye: Secret of the Cyclopes

description:
Color Jumble is a mobile phone puzzle game about color mixing. The playing area is a board filled with colored spheres. By using a magic wand the player can change the color of the spheres according to the currently active action symbol. There are two different categories of these action symbols, one for adding in a color, and another one for removing a color component.

Two simple examples: Adding red color to a yellow sphere will change its color to orange. Removing blue color from a green sphere will result in a yellow one.

Combinations of at least three spheres of the same color in a row are removed from the playing area, the spheres above fill in the free space by moving down, new spheres are added on top of them. Combinations of more than three spheres will display a count-down that extends the playtime when collected.

Due to the time limit the game also has a fast paced gameplay. The game features a title music and sound effects on capable devices.
title: Color Jumble

description:
Terminator Revenge is an action platform game that takes place in 1984 A.D. where the Earth's military forces seized the remaining parts of the Terminator sent back by Skynet from the future to kill Sarah Connor, the mother of the future Earth resistance leader. Intelligence shows that these part were stolen by a band of environmental scientists in 1992, motivated by their result of the scenario analysis. The scientists believe that would this technology remain in wrong hands, it would ultimately lead to the annihilation of man kind. These scientists later joined John Connor and the resistance.

In 2029 A.D. a war between man and machine has laid the world in ruin. Skynet has grown strong by now but is loosing the battle due to the research obtained by the resistance in the past. To prevent this, Skynet sends another Terminator back in the past to set the future back on track.

The player controls this Terminator through platform stages where the goal is to find objects, weapon to progress and finish each level. There are doors to open, objects to collect and characters to kill to finish the game. The protagonist can also crouch and jump.

sample_screenshots.caption: Luckily, this guy hasn't seen me yet.
Now I got my trusty machine gun!

title: Terminator Revenge

description:
Based on the re-imagined Battlestar Galactica television series, this game puts the player into the shoes of a rookie Viper pilot aboard the Galactica. Taking orders from Lt. Kara "Starbuck" Thrace, the player must fulfill a number of missions with varied objectives, ranging from dogfights with Cylon raiders to escort missions, search and rescue operations and more. Many missions are inspired by events from the series: defending the Galactica from incoming Cylon nukes, escorting Raptor scouts searching for water supplies, or shooting down civilian ships that have been taken over by Cylon agents.

Many missions have optional secondary objectives like destroying a certain number of Cylons, completing the primary objective within a certain time limit or letting no harm come to an escorted ship.

The Viper is equipped with a laser cannon, and can optionally carry seeking missiles. Various power-ups can be collected. Weapons upgrades improve speed or firing rate or increase the number of laser shots. Also available are speed boosts, energy refills and extra lives.

While the action is always viewed from the top, the control scheme changes with the type of the mission. Many combat missions behave like traditional vertically-scrolling shoot'em'ups, while search and rescue missions allow the player to change speed and fly in every direction. Others allow a directional change between flying forward or backward in addition to left and right.
title: Battlestar Galactica

description:
The third I-Play-developed mobile game in the Metal Slug series continues the fast-paced 2D side-scrolling shooting action with a new main character: sergeant Allen O'Neil. He needs to protect his troops and civilization against an alien invasion through 13 missions set in 5 different environments. There are 3 difficulty settings, 3 level bosses, a range of different weaponry and backgrounds with destructible scenery and flying debris.

As in the previous game in the series, players can move left and right, or jump to reach higher areas. Using the keys, players can shoot in 8 different directions. Power-ups are provided by freeing humans or by shooting certain enemies or structures. Most weapon upgrades, such as the shotgun, flamethrower or laser gun, only come with a limited supply of ammo, while the base weapon carries an endless amount. A secondary button is used to throw grenades and in close combat a knife is used automatically. Certain weapon-powered vehicles such as a tank can be driven during the levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Fighting a helicopter with a rocket launcher.
You can see what weapon you are carrying.

title: Metal Slug Mobile 3

description: Earth lies in ruins after an invasion by an alien race known as the Oblivion. The player, Codename: Havoc, is mankind's last line of defense, with just a single space ship. Codename: Havoc is a top-down vertically-scrolling shooter with classic gameplay elements. With only 3 lives, the player commands a small space ship against hordes of enemies, in the air but also on the ground. The ship can be hit multiple times before it's destroyed and by shooting complete waves of enemies, weapon power-ups such as lasers and fireballs become available.
title: Codename: Havoc

description:
Asterix & Cleopatra is a party game based on Asterix & Cleopatra story where Asterix and Obelix are sent from Gaulle to Egypt to help a friend to build a palace for Jules Caesar. Jules Caesar gave a challenge to Cleopatra. He pretends her people have lost their capabilities of building huge and strong monuments they used to build in the past. Cleopatra is upset and promises Caesar to build a palace for him in the next 90 days. Cleopatra select the architect Edifis to build this monument. Without help, he will never be able to make it. Edifis knows Getafix, the druid friend of Asterix and Obelix. He decides to go to Gaulle to ask for help and Getafix goes back to Egypt with his 2 friends to help bringing the magical potion with him.

Asterix & Cleopatra is a party game where the player will have to accept around 20 missions. To accomplish each mission, the player will have to move on the board using a dice. The user has 30 dices to be able to accomplish his missions. If the number of dices reach 0, the game is over. By moving on the board the player will be able to stop on red, blue, pink and orange cells. Orange cells are neutral cells Red cells are maluses (new -1, -2, -3 cells move or additional free dices) Blue cells are bonuses (new +1, +2, +3 cells move or additional free dices) Pink cells are unknown cells, they can hide both good and bad things Green cells are objectives At the end of a mission, when you reach the green point, the player will sometimes be proposed a short mini game that, if he fails will lead him back to the beginning of the mission or to the next mission if he succeeds. Mini games are "game & watch" like mini games: - like rock blocks falling from a boat that you need to knock so that they reach the other part of the screen - jump and run game - match 2 patterns and much more.
title: Asterix & Cleopatra

description: Oddnose is a side-scrolling platformer starring the titular character, a pink balloon-animal. The goal of the game is to pick up balls and shoot them at the enemies. For variation, there are several power-ups, including beans (which makes you fly) and chili (which makes you run faster).
title: Oddnose

description:
Starship Troopers: Roughnecks is an action game for mobile phones based on the classic book by Robert A. Heinlein that also spawned a movie and TV series.

The Roughnecks are a special elite squad of the Mobile Infantry, Earth's front line of defense against the vicious Bugs who intend to wipe out the human race. You take the role of John Rico, squad leader of Roughnecks, as you embark on planetary missions against the vicious aliens. Mission objectives very, ranging from seek-and-destroy missions to escort and rescue operations. Most of the time though, your goal is simply to blast the alien arachnids before they have a chance to get at you.

Gameplay is top-down in the tradition of classic 2D shooters such as Commando or The Chaos Engine. Use the keypad on your mobile to point and shoot, thus fighting your way across the hostile terrain of the desolate Planet Halcyon. You can pick up ammo packs and medical supplies as you blast your way through the creepy-crawlies. There are many different weapons and items you can collect and use for your combat tactics -- including pheromone pods to lure the aliens into ambush, land mines, a cloaking device, and many more.

sample_screenshots.caption: Found a fellow soldier and the level exit

title: Starship Troopers: Roughnecks

description:
The Paper Menace is a mobile adventure comedy starring the clerk Miller, an employee at the Ministry of Administrative Administration. A certain Dr. Patchsmith has designed a nano-raygun that allows him to reproduce paper at a massive scale and he threatens to use it to cripple the American economy unless his financial demands are met.

The game screens are shown in the upper part, with a row of buttons below (examine, pick up, use, talk, ...) and a screen below where the text and conversations appear. He meets pyromaniac Mitch Box, origami artist Fol-Ding, a pit-bull owner and discovers the words of wisdom found in fortune cookies. Puzzles are often item-based.

sample_screenshots.caption: Looking at the Pneumatic transfer system

title: The Paper Menace

alternate_titles.title: Das Schwarze Auge: Sumpf des Verderbens

description:
The Dark Eye: Nedime - Swamp of Doom is the third game in the TDE-Mobile series.

During this adventure, you will travel through the swamps of the northern plains. Strange creatures plague those swamps. A dark magician is even supposed to have led the population of an entire village into everlasting damnation...

The story is based on the "Die Sümpfe des Lebens" (Swamps of Life) scenario of the P&P game, but several changes have been made to the storyline.

The gameplay hasn't changed much from the last two adventures. It is possible to load an old hero or to create a new one from a list of 14 original classes. The game progresses as you take different decisions at certain key points during the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Asking questions to find out more about the "Swamp of Doom".

title: The Dark Eye: Swamp of Doom

description:
The Dark Eye: Among Pirates! is the fourth game in the TDE-Mobile series.

Your goal in this adventure is to find a beautiful princess that was abducted by pirates. The princess is the daughter of Kasimir, King of Nostria. The journey takes you through the rough Thorwalian pirate village of Daspota. However you have only 5 days to find her...

The adventure is based on an old TDE scenario called Liebliche Prinzessin Yasmina (Lovely Princess Yasmina).

The playstyle of this game differs from the last one. It is more an investigation in a pirate society than your typical dungeon crawl. Additionally, five different mini-games were added. Again, it is possible to play the game with an already experienced hero imported from the older adventures.
title: The Dark Eye: Among Pirates!

description:
After the first episode, where Spyro and Sparx freed Cynder from the Dark Masters sphere of influence, Cynder the she-dragon can no longer bare to pass a moment further with Sypro as she cannot forgive herself for what she has done to him. Therefore she flees the temple leaving Spyro behind.

Spyro, in his efforts to find Cynder whilst trying to retrieve his powers, is ambushed by the Dreaded Apes, sworn arch enemies of the Dragons. As servants of the Dark Master and led by Gaul the evil Baboon King, they wreak havoc upon Spyro's efforts.

Thankfully Sypro has The Chronicler, an ancient dragon to guide and support him in his quest to find Cynder and foil the Dark Master's plan. Failure would result in The Eternal Night. As Spyro, the player controls the dragon through platform-based levels based on flight, arcade combat and puzzle solving.

There are some differences compared to the previous game. Firstly Spyro has new abilities as he has matured. He is now able to break walls and he has different fireballs acquired as he progresses through the game. These also affect enemies differently, particularly the bosses of which there are several new challenges in terms of how the players need to work how to defeat them. There are also new enemies, new triggers, traps and puzzles.
title: The Legend of Spyro: The Eternal Night

description: Destroy those pesky moles, drive them out of the garden once and for all. As the Frenzy Island Best Vegetable Garden competition is fast approaching, Vlad Furry is hatching a sordid plan to get his hands on the trophy. He enlists an army of moles to wreck havoc in his neighbour's garden destroying all of the vegetables that have been so carefully nurtured. Sven Tomato, winner of the competition multiple times, aims to thwart the evil plan and protect his precious vegetables with the use of his giant hammer As Sven one can move in four directions, having to be head on with a mole to smash it, with the use of the action button. One can pick up bonuses along to way to increase the hammer's capability as well as life bonuses too, it also has bonus levels for those players with outstanding smashing ability. The moles become more daring as the game progresses, providing a greater challenge to the player.
title: Smash the Mole

description: Crazy has been bitten by a French Mosquito, turning him into Crazy Dog. Now chained up in the back garden, his owners are too scared to go close to him through fear of being attacked, therefore they leave his dog bowl at a safe distance from him. Tied from a pole Crazy Dog has to fend off the starving stray dogs, as they attempt to gobble his food away. Set on a still screen the gameplay is very straightforward, Crazy can move in 8 directions, he barks automatically to scare away his foes. Frenzy time gives the player an opportunity to win more points. As the levels progress the stray dogs increase in number.
title: Crazy Dog

description:
Grim Oak is the second game in the Darkest Fear trilogy. It takes place five years after the events of the first game. The game now takes place in the town Grim Oak and features Thomas Warden again in the most important role.

The gameplay is still shown from an overhead view and consists mainly of small puzzles, usually based on light. This time there are more light sources, three hidden mini-games (a darts game, a worm game and a Pong game) and the whole town of Grim Oak to explore instead of just the hospital.. The player can revisit places, battle monsters and solve item puzzles.
title: Darkest Fear: Grim Oak

description:
Nightmare is the third and final game in the Darkest Fear trilogy and features two playable characters instead of just one in the previous games, Thomas Warden and his daughter Helen with cooperative gameplay. The game mechanics remain the same: survival horror mainly based on light sources and lots of puzzle solving, all shown from an overhead view. The game has a hidden Pong-like mini-game, 15 different endings, and Helen can obtain three unique monster abilities.

Helen has been affected the dark bacteria that forces her to stay in the dark. Thomas can stay alive by walking in places that are illuminated by various, dynamic light sources like a flashlight or a lantern. In each level the player must guide both players to the exit with as few steps as possible. They also have to find a cure for Helen's affliction. Completing the levels with good scores unlocks cheat codes.
title: Darkest Fear: Nightmare

description:
War Diary: Burma is a real-time strategy game set in Burma during World War II in 1943. The player guides a team of British soldiers through various missions behind enemy lines, fighting against the Japanese occupiers and rescuing downed pilots. The more missions the player has completed, the bigger will his team become.

It is Rovio Mobile Ltd's first game and runs on a Series 30 phone (around 200KBs heap, 64KB JAR limit). The game is played on one large map. Each mission has its own starting and ending points. The player moves the team on the map in real-time, and when going close to an enemy icon the game jumps into a turn-based battle screen where both sides are shown as they attack alternately.
title: War Diary: Burma

description:
In the second real-time strategy game in the War Diary series, the player fights against Saladin's troops near 1091 AD Jerusalem and conquers back the enemy occupied cities.

There is not much of a plot in this game, just a bunch of mostly independent rescue/conquer missions that were glued to the game during the last two weeks of production. Most of the time the player moves the icon representing his troops on the main map in real-time. When encountering an enemy squad or a city occupied by the enemy, the game goes into a turn-based battle screen where the units attack alternately.

The game also runs on a low end Series 40 phone (210KBs of heap, 64KB JAR limit, 128x128 screen) with no features dropped, but with simpler graphics.
title: War Diary: Crusader

description: In this top-down real-time action game the player guides a team of SWAT soldiers through a set of missions involving terrorists. The player controls one of the three soldiers, and the other two follow mimicking the player's behaviour. The game consists of various separate missions where the player rescues hostages, kills terrorists, disarms bombs and hacks electronic devices. Most of the time is spent on the level maps, but some action takes place in its own mini game screen, like resuscitation.

sample_screenshots.caption: We found a bomb to disarm
Part of the briefing for the first mission

title: SWAT: Elite Troops

description:
The Dark Eye: Crypt Raiders is the fifth game in the The Dark Eye: Mobile Adventure series.

The Story features the hero awakening in a dark room without any recollection of what has happened. He soon discovers he has been brought to an old and abandoned mine. The search for answers soon turns into a battle against time...

Crypt Raiders is the first adventure developed exclusively for the TDE Mobile Adventure series. The menu structure was completely revised and offers more information than in the previous installments. Additionally the enemies are automatically adjusted to the players current level, so also a newly created hero can be used to win this adventure.

As with all prior installments of the The Dark Eye: Mobile Adventure it is possible to use the same hero you have used before. After finishing this adventure the hero will be uploaded again.
title: The Dark Eye: Crypt Raiders

description:
The Dark Eye: Dragon Raid is the sixth adventure in the The Dark Eye: Mobile Adventure series.

The adventure takes the hero on a chilly ride.The story begins with the hero about a small river freighter traveling the Great River bound for Angbar during a cold winter. While the hero is approaching the town of he witness an attack on the settlement b an Imperial dragon. Soon, the hero is deeply enmeshed in an adventure confronting him with an ancient curse.

Dragon Fire is the second adventure published exclusively in the TDE Mobile Adventure series. One feature in this adventure is the inclusion of a fully working version of Blackjack within the game.

As with all prior installments of the The Dark Eye: Mobile Adventure it is possible to use the same hero you have used before. This was the last The Dark Eye: Mobile Adventure released in English.

sample_screenshots.caption: Here you need to test your Swimming Capabilities. No luck with the dice.
You meet a priest. You can choose different ways to respond at the end of each dialogue segment.

title: The Dark Eye: Dragon Raid

description: In this time management game, the player takes the role of a junior doctor tasked with saving lives in the emergency room of various hospitals. He need to diagnose, treat, and discharge patients as quickly as possible in order to keep beds free for new patients coming in the door. Failure to treat patients in time can lead to amusing complications, including various forms of contagion. As the levels progress, the ordinary illnesses are joined by more whacky maladies, including vampirism and lycanthropy.
title: ER Rush

description:
This is the first Pro Evolution Soccer release from Konami Digital Entertainment on the J2ME platform.

The game features all classical modes the player would expect from a soccer game, instant play, match mode, league mode, cup mode, a training, but the classical master league was substituted with a 2 season super challenge mode. The game allows the player to choose between two control systems: having each movement bound to a different action keys, or a single button mode where a press on 5 will trigger the appropriate action depending on the context.

Management options include changing players according to their strength and statistics, formation, and match settings include weather, difficulty, and kit colors. The game ranges from really easy using the weakest AI settings to quite challenging. Unlockable items like new teams, formation or stadium appear after a given number of matches, winning cups or completing challenges with the hardest AI.

sample_screenshots.caption: Pass back in front of the goal keeper.
Substitute players sitting on the bench.
Good heading, straight to the goal.

title: PES 2008: Pro Evolution Soccer

description:
Men in Black: Alien Assault is a top down action game for mobile phones based on the movie by Columbia Pictures Industries.

Aliens are living on Earth, right among the human population. Nobody knows but a super-secret organization called MIB. As some of the aliens are going crazy, the player slips into the role of Agent Jay, whose mission is to protect humans and to stop the alien rage. in order to do so, Agent Jay uses different weapons and the famous neuralizer.
title: Men in Black: Alien Assault

description:
Stewie's Arsenal, based on animated Family Guy TV series, is a collection of four mini-games. The objective of each mini-game is to humiliate a member of the Griffin family. The game can be played in two modes: story and arcade. In the story mode the player plays through each of the mini games in turn an try to humiliate the whole family in one go. In the arcade mode the player can play any of the mini games indefinitely for a high score. The player must however complete the whole story mode before going on to the arcade mode. Each mini games has five levels that has to be completed before moving on to the next game. The four mini games are: Brain Cell Buster*
The first mini game is similar to Space Invaders. In it the player takes control of Stewie's miniature space ship and has to destroy the brain cells inside Peter's head, and reduce his IQ to zero.

  • Grocery Aisle Bash
    In this mini game the player controls Stewie in a runaway shopping cart. The goal is to use a baseball bat to destroy as many objects on the shelves at either side of the aisle. This will humiliate Lois as here shopping budget is reduced to zero.

  • Mind Control Device
    The goal of this mini game is to take control of Chris' mind by using a mind control device. To do so the player has to use a jetpack to navigate through the family's house and place the device on sleeping Chris' head. This mini game also involve an evil monkey that tries to awaken Chris. The gameplay is similar to Thrust.

  • Snowball Launcher
    In this-mini game Stewie has to humiliate Meg by throwing snow balls at her. This is played from a first person perspective where the player simply controls the cross-hair.

sample_screenshots.caption: The staff does their best to stop you.
Using the bat to destroy the objects on the shelves.

title: Family Guy: Stewie's Arsenal

description:
Ojom's puzzler King of Zing lets the player take control of a bouncing rubber ball which must be guided to the level’s exit without leaving the game field. Each of the 250 levels consists of different obstacles, like triangles, switches, warp fields etc.

The game has three game modes. The Puzzle Mode challenges the player to solve 250 puzzles in four difficulty levels. The objective in Arcade Mode is to maximise the bonus points by collecting all level items and using as few moves as possible in the shortest amount of time. Survival Mode is about solving as many puzzles as possible with limited time, moves and only one rubber ball.
title: King of Zing

description:
This is a 2D snooker game that can be played against an AI-opponent or a second human player. It is branded for the German TV station D:SF.

The goal is to score more games than your opponent. To score, the player has to use the cue-ball to pocket the 15 red balls and the 6 colour balls. Red and colour balls have to be potted in an alternating fashion. Colour balls are being replaced on the table until all red balls are gone. Once that has been accomplished, the player has to pot the colour balls in ascending order of their value. The player who has the most points after all balls have been potted wins the frame.
title: D:SF Snooker

alternate_titles.description: Title branded for German TV station
alternate_titles.title: D:SF Basketball

description:
This is a One-on-One basketball game. The player competes against the AI on scoring as many points as possible on a single basket.

Basketball Dunk Zone contains two game halves of 3 minutes duration. The player who has the most points at the end of the time limit wins. There are only two points to be scored, no matter how far away from the hoop the player is.

Whilst the player is not in possession of the ball, he or she has the ability to block the AI player's shots. When one of the players throws the ball outside of the playing field, the other player gets the ball and has the ability to score again.
title: Basketball Dunk Zone

alternate_titles.description: Title for German sports TV station branded release
alternate_titles.title: D:SF Handball

description:
Handball Heat has two game modes. The first mode lets the player throw penalties at the goal, trying to avoid hitting the goalkeeper. The other mode switches positions, now the player has to catch incoming balls.

When players are throwing goals, they have the option to change the power, direction and effect of their shots. When playing as goalkeeper, the only interactivity is moving the hands-cursor around the screen to catch the incoming ball. At the top of the screen, the score is being counted as well as the hits and misses in the current level. The difficulty is being adjusted, so that the game gets progressively harder in the later stages.
title: Handball Heat

alternate_titles.description: Title for German sports TV station branded release
alternate_titles.title: D:SF Pool

description:
This is a pool game, viewed top-down. The player can adjust the strength and angle of the shot. The player must pocket either the striped or solid colored balls, depending on which ball they hit first. The last ball that has to be pocketed is the black 8-ball. When the player succeeds in this, the game is won and another round can be started.

The angle is adjusted by pressing 4 or 6 on the keypad. This shows a dotted line in the direction the ball will go. The next step is the strength of the shot, an indicator slides along the power bar, and the player has to press 5 at the desired strength. The final element is the effect, which is controlled by adjusting a dot on the cue ball to the desired position.
title: Pool Champion

description:
Power Hockey is a simplified version of the ice hockey sport. The player's objective is to score more goals than the opponent in a match.

The game contains only one player per team. There are two special moves available to the player: tackle and speed boost. Players also have the choice between two game modes, single match or tournament. In tournament mode, several different characters are available for selection. Each match is made up of two halves, the length of which can be customized.
title: Power Hockey

alternate_titles.description: Title branded for German TV station
alternate_titles.title: D:SF Radsport

description:
Cycling Champion takes the player riding a bike on several different tracks. The terrain influences the difficulty of the cycling controls, the interval at which the player alternately presses the buttons has to be increased when riding uphill. The player also has to avoid obstacles on the track, like puddles or other bikers.

At the start of the game, the player can choose between a single race and tournament mode. Tournament mode has all three tracks in a row, and the winner is decided by overall points after each race. The top of the screen shows the player's position in the race and the remaining time on the track. The bottom has a profile view of the track, showing if it's going up- or downhill and a water meter. The player can press 5 to drink water and replenish the water meter by driving close to a helper positioned on the track's border.
title: Cycling Champion

alternate_titles.description: Title for German sports TV station branded release
alternate_titles.title: D:SF Poker

description:
Texas Poker is a poker game with the Texas Hold'em rules. The player faces two computer opponents. The player wins the game when the AI players have run out of money.

At the beginning of the game, each player gets dealt two cards and five cards are put face down on the table. After each player has placed their bet, one card on the table is revealed and the betting starts again. The options the players can make is bet/raise, call or fold. This is continued round after round until all cards are revealed. The players try going for the best hand they can make with the cards in their hands and the ones lying on the table.
