The highest hand wins the pot.

sample_screenshots.caption: Title screen for the non-branded version of the game
The main game screen. The D-icon indicates the current dealer

title: Texas Poker

description:
Luki sleeps peacefully while taking a break from playing with his friends. Suddenly, evil phantoms appear in Luki's world and kidnap all his friends, converting them to possessed creatures. The phantoms hate nothing more than the friendly and peaceful world Luki lives in. When Luki awakes, his world is left empty, and the only thing he can do now is to travel to the shadow realm and get his friends back from the phantoms.

In Bubble Boost, you help Luki on his quest in the shadow realm. The game is a platformer, so Luki has to jump over gaps and avoid getting touched by the possessed creatures. As a defensive weapon, Luki can shoot Magic Bubbles, which come in four different varieties. The objective in each level is to get the key that opens the level exit, while at the same time getting a high score by collecting gems and freeing Luki's friends.
title: Bubble Boost

description:
Armageddon Agents is a squad-based tactical game. The story revolves around an alien race called the Squibs, which are trying to invade Earth. You control a team of several human agents, most of which have special abilities: a hacker can break into computers, the explosives expert disarms and places bombs, the medic heals other agents, the tank-buster is good against heavily armored enemies and the sniper kills enemies at a great distance. Your objective is to keep the Squibs from finishing their troop transporter.

The agents can move through the isometric levels in different formations, and it is vital to make use of stealth whenever possible. Agents which are being used a lot can increase their experience points after a mission.
title: Armageddon Agents

description:
The mobile version of Alien Homind is completely different from The Behemoth's original game. Whereas that was a side-scrolling action game, this version is a collection of three smaller arcade games.

In the first game, the player takes control of a spaceship and has to drop bombs on the city that lies beneath him. If the city is not destroyed, the player will eventually crash into one of the buildings and lose a life. In the second game FBI agents will toss bombs on the player. By moving left and right the player has to catch the bombs before they detonate. If hit by an explosion, the player will lose a life. The third game is a clone of the Clowns arcade game. Using a seesaw the player has to pick up all the sweets in the sky. Hitting the ground will result in a lost life.

sample_screenshots.caption: The second game. Catch the bombs the FBI agents are throwing over the fence.
Starting out with the first game.

title: Alien Hominid

description:
Trapped in the ruins of the dangerous Luxicore mine, you must work your way to the surface, collecting as much 'bling' as you can. Use your special heating and cooling gloves to help you cross dangerous obstacles or shrink heavy objects enough to push them around.

Since you can't swim with all the equipment and bling you carry, use your cooling glove to freeze bodies of water in your path. Or use your heating glove to expand steel bars in order to cross over chasms! Try to collect all the bling on each level in the least amount of time as you work through the deadly mine maze.
title: Super Shove It!

description:
Minesweeper Redux: The Trafalgar Scare is a variant of the classic Minesweeper, set in London on Trafalgar Square. Pranksters have planted stink bombs and it is up to the player to discover them without setting them off. The player is a police officer who is sent to do the task.

The gameplay is identical to the original game. Choosing from three difficulty levels, players press a key to uncover squares. The chosen levels influences the size of the playfield and the amount of bombs. The numbers that appear when activating a square show how many bombs there are in the eight squares that surround it. Using this strategy, certain squares can be marked as a bomb, while other can be uncovered safely.

Changes to the original game are the introduction of an isometric perspective and a depiction of London in the area surrounding the playfield.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can see parts of the surroundings.

title: Minesweeper Redux: The Trafalgar Scare

alternate_titles.title: The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Mobile

description: The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion is the mobile adaptation of the fourth title in Bethesda's Elder Scrolls series. Shown from an isometric perspective, players can explore twelve different dungeons with additional sidequests set Tamriel's capital province, Cyrodiil. Players can choose from character classes such as Monk, Nightblade, Barbarian, Archer, Knight, Spellsword, Sorcerer, and Battlemage. There are different weapons and spells to discover and about ten monsters. As in the original game, there is a focus on exploration and solving riddles.
title: The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion

description: James Bond: Top Agent is a strategic fighting game where players gets to create their own secret agents. The game contains 20 levels based on the The Spy Who Loved Me campaign. In each level the player has to fight an enemy player one on one. Each fights starts with the player selecting his inventory. After that, the two fighters chooses a sequence of five different moves that they wants to perform. Whether the player succeeds with a move depends on which move his opponent chooses. For example if the players decide to shoot, while the enemy takes cover, it's likely that he will miss. The game offers some character development. For each fight the player gets skill points that can be spent on improving the player's ability in four different skills (brawling, shooting, gadgetry, dexterity). The player can also get new weapons and equipment from defeated enemies, that can be equipped in later battles.
title: James Bond: Top Agent

description:
D:SF Boxen is a boxing game for mobile phones. Players must knock down their opponents or survive all of the rounds with more hit points than the computer player.

The game is viewed in a first-person-perspective, although only the gloves of the player's boxer character are visible. Each round lasts 99 seconds and there are ten rounds in total. The player is knocked out once their health bar reaches zero. After each round, the players are awarded a certain amount of extra health, depending on how well they did in the previous round.

There are three different attacks the player can execute: jab, hook, and stomach punch. There is also one defensive position that players can use to deflect the opponent's hits.

sample_screenshots.caption: A fight in progress. Screenshot from the Sony Ericsson K700 version

title: D:SF Boxen

description:
Great Elude is a 3D game where the player commands a hijacked supersonic aircraft that has to escape from an enemy nation. The game starts from a city on enemy territory. The player has to dodge from various bombs and bullets released by the enemies. The enemies attack the player’s flight through tankers and aircraft.

The player has to cross all the five levels successfully by escaping from the enemy attacks to reach his own country. Bonus points like stars can be collected along the way to get a bonus score and fuel is replenished through fuel boxes. The player can also gather missile boxes, which are added as assets to his weaponry. The game consists of five levels, with five terrain types and twenty types of enemy vehicles and aircrafts. The game contains help instructions and easy-to-use controls.
title: Great Elude

description:
Derby 3D is a singleplayer and multi-player horse racing game. In the racing mode, the player selects a jockey and participates in a race, controlling the jockey who rides the horse. By winning races, prize money is added to the player's profile to be used in the betting mode.

In the betting mode, the player selects a horse with a default rider, puts the bet with the minimum default amount and simply watches the race. When run out of the money, the player can replay the racing mode and earn money there so as to re-enter the betting mode. The game contains different tracks and can be played in English, French, Dutch, Italian, Spanish and German.
title: Derby3D

description: Assault Team 3D is a first-person shooter for mobile devices. Players can choose the Iraqi or American army at the start and then need to take out all enemy soldiers in Baghdad. The city is divided into nine different quarters, with three missions for each of them. The player needs to roam the streets and take out all enemies. A radar in the bottom left corner shows enemy activity. Next to regular soldiers, there are also helicopters to shoot down.

sample_screenshots.caption: Battle against a soldier and a helicopter

title: Assault Team 3D

description:
This is a compilation of the classic board games BattleShip and Connect Four with classic and enhanced rules. Both games are playable against the AI or another player.

The enhanced rules for Battleship include four different characters with special attacks, a power bar which is filled during the battle and allows to use special attacks, three levels of special attacks depending on the special bar, a "Fire and Reload" mode where the player has a certain amount of time during which he can fire at will. When the time is out, it's the opponent turn.

The enhanced rules for Connect 4 are the same as the Connect 4 version available in the Hasbro Family Game Night on the Xbox 360. There are also special tokens and a time limit mode.
title: Connect 4 / BattleShip

description:
Legend of Spyro: Dawn of the Dragon on mobile phones follows the plot of the previous mobile episodes. Spyro and Cynder are allies now. They will travel together through catacombs, forests, a dragon city and wastelands to defeat Malfor the great black dragon who seeks to destroy the world. Spyro and Cynder will meet friends such has Ignitus the red dragon and Hunter the panther who will help them during their quest.

This new episode of Spyro is mainly a platformer with a bit of exploration. There are also flying sequences which are played like Space Harrier. The game is story driven with a lot of scripted sequences inside the levels. Each dragon has 4 types of breath linked to specific elements (fire, poison, ice, etc...). They also can glide a bit in order to reach far platforms. This episode is the last one of the trilogy. Even if the name is similar to the last console game created by Etranges Libellules, the development was completely independent.
title: The Legend of Spyro: Dawn of the Dragon

description:
Fantasy Worlds: Rhynn is a mobile MMO (massively multiplayer online) game.

This role-playing game allows to create one of four different playable characters and to level the character up by solving quests, fighting against enemies, and doing other typical RPG tasks. During gameplay it is possible to chat with other players from all over the world. This game is a free to play game and only the mobile Internet connection has to be paid by the user.
title: Fantasy Worlds: Rhynn

description:
Hip Hop Immortals is a mobile game in which wannabe Hip Hop stars begin their careers in beat-up apartments in the 1970s and, by earning points in the three included mini-games (MCing, Breakdancing, and Graffiti), rise to fame and fortune through the 80s, 90s and into the 00s.

The MCing mini-game is the most unique of the three, consisting of a third-person view of the game's main character rapping in a setting corresponding to the character's success level and the current era of the game. The lyrics of the song scroll along the screen above the character's head, occasionally featuring blank spaces, which are filled by selecting an appropriate word using the d-pad's four direction buttons. The selection is then graded based upon speed of entry, rhyming, metre and (of course) whether the resulting lyric makes sense and points are assigned.

The other two mini-games, Graffiti and Breakdancing, are a small four-screen platformer (graffiti artist at work, must evade security guards) and a head-to-head rhythm-action game against an AI dancer.

The Graffiti mini-game features custom bitmap graffiti art created by famed artist Cope2 and Breakdancing is notable for its meticulous adherence strictly to moves and move combinations that can be performed in real life.

sample_screenshots.caption: The "apartment" that serve's as the game's main menu

title: Hip Hop Immortals

description: This is a top-down shooter in which you play as Cartoon Network hero, Ben Tennyson ("Ben 10"). Just like in the cartoon series, you can switch to any of Ben's ten alter-egos at any time -- some of them are melee attackers, some shoot, some can fly, etc. The game takes place during an invasion of the Earth by series villain Vilgax, and sees the player fighting off an alien army single-handed. Gameplay is reminiscent of a modern version of an Ikari Warriors-type game from the 8-bit era.
title: Ben 10: All Out Attack!

description:
Pokermillion 2009 is a mobile poker game that features a large amount of different poker game types (including rarely-seen stuff like Pineapple Hold 'Em and Omaha Hi/Lo) as well as a film-noir-style storyline presented in a Frank Miller style graphic novel format.

Omaha Hi/Lo is probably the most unique of the game types, and yields particularly eclectic results -- quite in line with its real-life performance. In this variant, the player is looking to hold both the highest and lowest possible hands, in combination with the board.

The more standard four-card hold 'em variant Omaha is also included, as are big-pot bonanza Royal Hold 'Em, three-hole-card games Pineapple Hold 'Em, Crazy Pineapple and the strategically fascinating Tahoe Hold 'Em. In addition to playing any of these games in a one-off "quick games", it's also possible to set up multi-table tournaments that can last hours at a stretch, using any or all of the seven variants (and allowing a huge amount of other statistical variability, down to the prize structure and bet schedules of individual tables).

Pokermillion 2009 also features a story mode. The narrative's twists and turns see the player (of user-selectable gender) searching for a missing poker pro brother who may have bitten off more than he can chew. A number of settings are available, from Monte Carlo to Afghanistan.
title: Pokermillion 2009: The Bluff

description: LMA Manager 2006 is the first mobile edition in the LMA Manager series. The game is much like its console counterpart and features the same official license. The player takes the role of a soccer team manager. The player can choose from teams from 6 major European Leagues. A team competes in its national league and once each year gets a shot in a European competition.
title: LMA Manager 2006

alternate_titles.title: F.C. Manager 2007: La Passion du Foot

description:
LMA Manager 2007 is the second mobile game in the LMA Manager series. Like its predecessor and console counterpart, the player takes the role of a soccer team manager. The game's menu system has received a complete overhaul since the previous incarnation.

In the game players can control tactics, training, transfers, stadium improvements, staff hiring and ticket prices among other things. Matches itself can be skipped, shown as live text summaries, or can be viewed in a 2D isometric view.
title: LMA Manager 2007

description:
LMA Manager 2008 is another mobile game in the LMA Manager series. Like its predecessors and console counterparts, the player takes the role of a soccer team manager.

In the game players can control tactics, training, transfers, stadium improvements, staff hiring and ticket prices among other things. Matches itself can be skipped, shown as live text summaries, or can be viewed full 3D. Players can choose from over a 100 European clubs to play with or trade with.
title: LMA Manager 2008

description:
Championship Manager 5 Solo is a mobile version of the Championship Manager series for mobile phones.

Like in the other games in the series the player takes on the role of a football team manager and performs tasks like taking charge of tactics, training, signing new players, negotiating contracts etc.

The game features little graphics, mostly the player will be reading texts and looking at charts and rosters. The matches are shown in a topdown view where players are represented by dots in the colour of their team.
title: Championship Manager 5 Solo

description:
The mobile version of Championship Manager 2006 features similar game play as its PC and Console counterparts. Players select a club from the British leagues and play the manager's role, taking charge of tactics, training, signing new players, negotiating contracts etc. The game is very statistics heavy and assumes a fairly deep knowledge of the football game, setting it apart from its more accessible competitors.

Like the previous mobile iteration, the game features a simplistic angled view of the field where players are represented by tiny little dots. Player statistics are updated to represent the new season.
title: Championship Manager 2006

description:
The mobile version of Championship Manager 2007 features similar game play as its PC and Console counterparts. Players take on a football team manager's role and have to perform tasks such as taking charge of tactics, training, signing new players, negotiating contracts etc. The game is very statistics heavy and assumes a fairly deep knowledge of the football game, setting it apart from its more accessible competitors.

Like the previous mobile iterations, the game features a simplistic angled view of the field where players are represented by tiny little dots. Player statistics are updated to represent the new season, also included are more lower-league English teams and European teams. New features include the inclusion of more different stats for each player (such as passing, shooting and handling) and improved and more in-depth tactics to be used in the game. Players now also have more control over the training programs for their specific players.

The interface has been completely revamped and now also displays press conferences and half-time discussions.
title: Championship Manager 2007

description:
Championship Manager 2008 is another mobile Championship Manager game developed by Dynamo Games. This game follows in the footsteps of its predecessors. Again the player can become a football club manager and perform all the tasks that come with the job, such as hiring new players, selecting trainings, and choosing playing strategies.

The player statistics have been updated to the new season. This iteration features teams and players from around the world. The match overview has been changed to a top-down view.
title: Championship Manager 2008

description:
Cannonball is the most popular intergalactic sport in the galaxy and takes place every four years. You have been chosen to represent mother Earth this championship... Good luck!

The game plays like a fusion between Pong and Breakout, where the player is on the bottom of the screen and the opponent is at the top. In the space between the two paddle-like ships there's a number of blocks of various kinds which, while in the way, also randomly generate power-ups for either contestant.

The player gets to select a ship before starting, and while they graphically are different, there is no actual difference between them in terms of gameplay. The championship itself takes place on all the continents of Earth, and the matches can be played in any order. The difficulty is different for all of them however, so picking the hardest first is only for the skilled player.
title: Cannonball: Confederation Championships

description:
The Black Hole is a mobile science fiction adventure. In the year 2288, Civilisation on Earth has founded colonies on several planets and moons. The Earth’s energy needs are secured by mining the raw material Hydro-V. Phil McPherson, son of a tyrannical mining company boss, lives the life of a small-time, black-market criminal in the mega-metropolis of New Canaveral. An appalling energy crisis ensues as Ganymed, one of the moons orbiting Jupiter and the major source of Hydro-V, is suddenly sucked into a black hole. And Phil unexpectedly becomes involved in a highly dangerous mission.

The game screens are shown in the upper part, with a row of buttons below (examine, pick up, use, talk, ...) and a screen below where the text and conversations appear. The player meets several peoples and travels to the moons Jupiter, Ganymede and Europa.

sample_screenshots.caption: In front of the cloud band

title: Black Hole

description:
The slightly eccentric American archaeologist Dr. Davis specialises in palaeoanthropology. His research concentrates on finding the missing link; the quantum jump in the development of mankind to Homo Sapiens. Davis investigates the phenomenon of crop circles from the perspective of his generally ridiculed scientific theory. An adventurous trip through Guatemala begins. After a perilous trek through the rainforest and foothills, Davis discovers a surprising link between the corn circles, the temples of the Maya culture and the mystery of the missing link.

The game screens are shown in the upper part, with a row of buttons below (examine, pick up, use, talk, ...) and a screen below where the text and conversations appear. The player starts his journey in England and moves on to the rainforest of Guatemala, where he discovers a hidden Maya temple.

sample_screenshots.caption: Beginning of the game - apparently, the students aren't impressed
A look at the protagonist's inventory in his apartment
Interaction is done with the help of icons

title: Secret of the Lost Link

description:
The X-Files: The Deserter is a puzzle-solving detective mystery adventure game based on the X-Files television show. The FBI agent Fox Mulder is sent to Las Vegas to investigate a murder. The player controls Mulder in various locations in Nevada, and also plays through shorter chapters controlling his partner, Dana Scully, at the FBI headquarters, helping Mulder by using the scientific resources there.

The gameplay is traditional icon-based adventure; the player selects icons that represent verb commands ("Examine", "Pick Up", etc.) to interact with the environment, viewing it from a first-person perspective. Most of the puzzles follow the inventory-based object-using scheme.

sample_screenshots.caption: About to walk to the front of the FBI HQ
The FBI colleague has a bit of an attitude problem.

title: The X-Files: The Deserter

description: Jump: Free Running is a mobile game where the player has to perform the art of free running. The runner is viewed from a top down isometric perspective and runs forward automatically. The gameplay involves pressing buttons with the right timing to perform different jumps and moves. The game takes place in three cities, each with its own scenario and story. These are San Francisco, London and Cairo. In the San Francisco scenario the city has been ravaged by an earthquake. In the London scenario strikes by utility workers has caused power outages and the rooftops are therefore full of burglars. In Cairo the dry season has caused problems with flash fires.
title: Jump: Free Running

description: This is a mobile remake of the classic Commodore game of the same name. The game plays like the Atari arcade game Lunar Lander. The player takes control of a spaceship that he has to land safely without crashing. This is done by using the shuttle's thrusters to the left or the right to go to in the opposite direction. At the same time there's only a limited amount of fuel available so the player has to be careful not to use the thrusters to much. This remake offers ten levels each which is completed by landing the space shuttle at one of three platforms. Some platforms are harder to land on and therefore give more fuel and points. It's also possible to unlock the original Commodore version of the game by landing on an X-10 platform.

sample_screenshots.caption: This platform is a bit trickier and therefore gives a higher multiplier.
Using the thrust to avoid crashing

title: Jupiter Lander

description:
Similar to the PC game it is based on, Company of Heroes for mobile is a strategy game set during World War II. Just like in the PC game, the player gets to command the Able Company through some of the most important battles of the Normandy Campaign, from the D-Day landings to the last battles of the war. It does however differ in a number of ways, with a turn-based mechanic instead of real-time as one of the most important changes.

Each mission starts with the player getting to customize his troop. Available unit types depend on the mission, but can include riflemen, snipers, machine gunners, bazookas as well as different kinds of tanks. The actual battle starts with a deploy mode where the player chooses the starting positions of his units. Once this is done it is time for the action where for each turn the player can issue a command to each unit. In addition to the common commands move and attack (which can also be executed at the same time) there are also commands for ambushing, suppressing fire, airstrikes and calling medics.

In addition to the campaign there are two other game modes: random battle and skirmish battle. In skirmish the player can choose difficulty level, mission and army to play as. There is also a tutorial.

sample_screenshots.caption: I will choose to attack this enemy unit
Selecting a unit shows possible movement options

title: Company of Heroes

description: Alpha Snake is a mash up of two different kinds of games: snake and word construction. The player controls a snake from a top down perspective. The snake grows larger by eating, however in Alpha Snake the snake does not eat apples or other tasty fruits. Instead it eats letters. Here's where the word construction part comes in. Each level has letters from a nine-letter word and the snake has to eat them in order to create any correct word that can be formed out of the letters. For each word created the snake grows longer and the game gets harder. If the snake happens to eat the wrong letter (so that a word can't be created) it will get sick. To treat this sickness it has to find a red pill which vaporizes the last letter. There's also a green pill that makes the snake shrink.

sample_screenshots.caption: I've collected enough letters to create a word
Eating the wrong letter makes the snake sick and he has to find a pill to eat

title: Alpha Snake

description:
AMA Go Green is an educational application that aims to guide the user towards a greener life. It tries to make the user more aware of issues regarding ecology and how he can help the environment. This is done through a number of quizzes and mini-games. The user has to complete the following four quizzes in order. For each completed quiz the next is unlocked. R U Green*: the user gets to answer 16 questions that determine how much his actions support the environment. After the first eight questions the user gets to play a mini-game which is a falling blocks puzzle game similar to Tetris. The blocks represent people and the playing field is a bus. The idea is to get as many people as possible on each bus. After the quiz is completed the user gets a score and unlocks further quizzes.

  • Green IQ: the user gets to answer 16 questions that test his eco knowledge. The user also gets to play a recycling mini-game which involves sending the right object to the right bin. The objects fall from the top and the user has to press the right number in time. After completing the quiz the user gets to see his green status.

  • Green Actions: The user is presented with different statements and has to check the ones that are true for him.

  • Green Class: the user is taught how he can live a greener life. There are four categories and each relates to interests of the player that can be made greener. There is also the Daily Lead which is a fact and a challenge that is presented to the user every day. These can also be sent by SMS to friends directly from the application.

sample_screenshots.caption: Question from the R U Green quiz
The green class shows suggestions on how to become greener

title: AMA Go Green!

description: F-22 Raptor is a vertically scrolling shoot 'em up. Shooting is done automatically so that the player can focus on movement of the plane. In addition to normal movement options the player can also do barrel rolls that help avoid the enemy aircraft. The game features a cobra mode that can be entered at any time and makes the player invincible for a few seconds. The player can, in addition to normal bullets, use rockets in two different modes: simple and advanced. In simple mode the rockets explode at the first enemy encountered while the advanced mode lets the player choose a specific target. The player also has access to a couple of bombs. The enemy has rockets too and to avoid being hit, the player can use flares to attract the rockets away from his plane. At some occasions the player will come across quick time events where a number is displayed on the screen. To succeed with the event the player has to enter the number quickly.

sample_screenshots.caption: Another boss fight over the desert
Buying new equipment in the armory

title: F-22 Raptor

description: Crazy Balls is a puzzle game where the player has to navigate a number of balls through labyrinth-like levels. The game is viewed from a top-down perspective of the labyrinth and each level starts with the player having control of an orange ball that can be moved anywhere where there is space. There is also purple balls that are scattered throughout the levels and these will stick to the player's ball when touched. Due to thin passages of the labyrinth the more balls stuck together the harder it will be to navigate. In addition to moving his balls around, the player can rotate the balls clockwise to avoid getting stuck. The levels are designed so that the player often doesn't have enough space to rotate and therefore doing this at the right position is crucial for progressing through the levels. It's also important to consider how the balls are stuck together. A big block of balls won't fit through some of the narrow passages while having them all in a line might make it impossible to rotate them. A level is completed when all purple balls have been connected to the orange ball.

sample_screenshots.caption: Say hello to the puzzle genie.
A narrow passage forces me to rotate my balls.
A level is completed when all balls are collected

title: Crazy Balls

description:
Spider-Man 3 Puzzle is a match-three puzzle game based on the 2007 film featuring the comic hero. As in other match three games (like Bejeweled) the player is presented with a grid of tiles (here called tokens) that can be removed by making matches of three or more tiles of the same colour. What make this variant of the concept different is that the objective isn't just to remove the tokens but to move Spider-Man across the grid to a special destination. Each level has a path that Spider-Man follows. The path is hidden and is only revealed by swapping and removing tokens that are over the path. Spider-Man moves automatically when the path is revealed. Each level is time based and Spider-Man has to reach his destination before the timer runs out.

The game features some special power up tokens that will help the player. For example there is the scramble tokens which shuffles all tokens on the grid, the spider-sense tokens that reveals the path temporarily and the rage tokens that can be used to plow through tokens blocking the path. In some levels Spider-Man will be chased by black goo and has to finish the levels before being catched.

sample_screenshots.caption: The spider-sense power up reveals the path for a short time.
Here we are suddenly at the subway station.

title: Spider-Man 3 Puzzle

description:
Pixudoku is a mobile variant of the nonogram puzzle game (also known as Picross). A nonogram is a logic puzzle where the player is presented a grid consisting of a number of cells and has to fill in certain cells to create a picture. Outside the grid there are numbers for each row and column which tell the player how many cells should be filled for that line. For example, if it says 2 5 then the player should fill in first two cells next to each other and then after a gap five other cells next to each other.

In Pixudoku the player gets feedback from the game by the colour of the marker. If the marker is green then the right number of cells have been filled in although it doesn't tell if it is at the right position. A red marker means that too many cells have been filled. The player can also choose to get clues that help him fill in the right cells. The clue function can be used three times per puzzle.

Pixudoku features three difficulty levels each with 20 puzzles. A new level is unlocked by completing 50% of the former. The game features an analogue look due to its pencil drawn graphics.
title: Pixudoku

description:
Playman Winter Games is one of many games in Mr. Goodliving's Playman series of sports games. The game was originally 2D, but this version is remade in full 3D. As in the 2D version it features four common winter sports events:* Biathlon

  • Slalom
  • Ski Jump
  • Bobsleigh

Three game modes exist: the training mode where the player can improve his skills in each event, the single event mode where the player gets to compete in any of the events against 10 opponents or against his own personal best, and the tournament mode where the player competes in all four events.

In Biathlon the player skis by pressing the correct key when the tip of his skis touches the blue or orange signs that appear on the track. If this is done correctly the player gains speed, if not he loses speed. Shooting is done by pressing the correct number in the right order as fast as possible. Missing will lead to a five second penalty.

In Slalom the player uses the right and left keys to steer his skier through each gate in the slope. Sharper turns leads to decreased speed and missing a gate leads to a time penalty of five seconds.

In Ski Jump the player has to hit the action button when near the ramp to gain start gaining power and then once again when the power meter is full to take off. For a good jump the player needs to time the jump as near the edge as possible. Once in air the player has to balance by using the left and right keys. To land the player presses the action button again when both skies are straight. The player gets a score that's based on both style and jump length.

In Bobsleigh the player steers his sleigh by pressing left or right. A circle helps him to see if he's on the optimal spot and by succeeding with this the speed increases.
title: Playman Winter Games

description:
Several years after the heydays of the Actua Soccer franchise comes this mobile variant. With its isometric view it looks and plays like a typical 16 bit football game. The player has full movement control over his players in eight different directions. Double tapping a direction key results in a short speed burst for the player. Once in possession of the ball the player can pass it to another player or, when close enough to goal, attempt to score. It's also possible to do crosses, clearances or long passes all depending on where on the pitch the player with the ball is. When the opposition manage to steal the ball the player can to a sliding tackle to take it back.

A number of game modes exist. The player might choose to just play a random quick match with predefined settings, a friendly with his favourite team or to take part in the Actua Cup. The Actua Cup is a 32-team tournament of national teams which starts with groups of four teams in each and then moves on to the knockout stages. It's also possible to do a penalty shootout, in case the rest of the game isn't interesting enough. Before starting a match or a cup the player can customize the play experience by changing difficulty and duration, whether injuries and fouls should be enabled and choose to play with extra time or golden goal. Before a game it is also possible to edit the squad, choose formation and tactics as well as choosing a strip for the team.

The game features 32 teams in total, all national teams from all over the world. The game does not use any licenses and therefore all the players are made up. The names can however be changed to whatever the player wants them to be.
title: Actua Soccer 2006: International Edition

description:
This is a mobile version of 2K's first person shooter. Many things remain the same as the original game but this one is played from a top down perspective.

The year is 1960 and the player character, Jack, is on board a plane crossing the Atlantic ocean. Things go wrong though and the plane crashes. Jack is lucky though and finds himself outside a lighthouse. This is no ordinary lighthouse however. It leads to Rapture, an Utopian underwater city built by the tycoon Andrew Ryan. It's not long until Jack is contacted by a man called Atlas who offers Jack his support.

Many features of the original game still exists in this mobile adaptation. Not only does it tell the same story, it also comes with many of its gameplay mechanics. Like in any other shooter the player can use numerous weapons, both melee and ranged. In BioShock the player also has access to plasmids which are special powers like electric bolts and fireballs. Rapture is full of splicers, insane people damaged by severe use of plasmids. These are the most common enemies in the game and comes in different shapes such as thuggish splicers that use melee weapons and leadhead splicers that are armed.

The player will also come across Big Daddies and Little Sisters. The sisters role in Rapture is to collect ADAM from corpses. ADAM is needed by the player to buy new plasmids. To get ADAM the player needs to gather it from a sister. This is not so easy since each sister is protected by a big daddy which has to be defeated in battle. Once the big daddy is defeated the player can choose to either kill the sister and get a large amount of ADAM or save her to get a smaller amount. For every three saved sisters the player will get a gift as compensation.

sample_screenshots.caption: First time meeting a little sister and her protector.
Crashing in the ocean, just outside a lighthouse.

title: BioShock

description:
Genetica is a puzzle game about genetic engineering where the player has to create new life forms by connecting atoms with each other to form molecules. Each atom has both inner connections (holes) and outer connections (sticks). The goal of each level in the game is to connect all atoms on the game field into a molecule without leaving any free connections. Atoms connect when the outer connection of one atoms joins the inner connection of another atom. Atoms come in different colours and each atom can only be connected to other atoms with different colours.

The game features three different modes: research mode, engineering mode and free mode. The modes are made available after the player completes the previous one. The research mode is meant as an educational mode where the player learns to play the game and improve his skills. The player will learn the essence of genetics by researching different organisms.

In the engineering mode, the player gets develop his own creatures by combining and extracting different genes. The free mode lets the player play and unlimited amount of different levels. These are automatically generated depending on which difficulty the player selects.
title: Genetica

description: Shadow Zone is a round-based strategy game based on science fiction screenplay. The player has to save the world from a nuclear catastrophe. His mission is to break through security perimeters of the Zone and to prevent development of thermonuclear chain reaction in the 'Shelter' object. During the missions the characters will be attacked by Death Cultists as well as by mutated creatures of the Zone.
title: Shadow Zone

description:
This game is based on the movie by Robert Rodriguez. The player slips into the role of El Mariachi, who is searching for a down-and-dirty drug dealer in order to seek revenge for the death of the woman he loved.

Desperado: Duel of Vengeance is 2D-side scrolling action game where the player fights his way through hordes of hostile gunmen until he faces the final boss enemy. It has a tactical component since the player has to find the correct flow of shooting, ducking and jumping in order to get through the levels.
title: Desperado: Duel of Vengeance

description:
Star Wars: Battle for the Republic is a turn-based strategy game set in the Star Wars universe. The player can join either the Separatists or the Republic in their struggle for world domination. The game takes place on a grid of squares where the player gets to command his troops. The troops are moved individually across the grid and enemy troops are attacked simply by moving a troop onto another. When battles commence the squared is zoomed in and a short animation is shown. The losing side will then have his troops removed. Troops can normally only move one square at a time. Therefore the player needs to use transportation ships to travel at light speed. This allows the player to move directly to any unoccupied square.

There is also other special units in the game. Battleships increases the movement range of troops and additional strength in combat. Shields add extra defensive strength to troops that are behind although they are not movable. There are also heroes that adds combat modifiers to the troop depending on who they are.

Two campaigns are available, one for the Separatist force and one for the Republic. The Separatist campaign consists of eight missions and by completing it the Republic campaign is unlocked.
title: Star Wars: Battle for the Republic

description: Ibiza Beach Party is a collection of Ibiza-themed mini-games. There are 44 in total, some of them including DJ'ing, cocktail mixing, jet-ski racing, crowd surfing, tug of war, cliff-diving and even a wet T-shirt contest. The games take place in six locations: hotel, beach, yacht, bar, nightclub, and campfire. There is a handicap, as there are no instructions, so you will only have five seconds before each game starts to figure out how to play it. The game includes two modes. In Survival you will have to play through all the mini-games to beat your high score, while time-attack mode is more about playing a single mini-game and trying to keep up as its difficulty increases.
title: Ibiza Beach Party

description:
Blockbusters was a popular TV game show throughout the '80s and '90s. This mobile game is a football-themed version of that game concept. The game takes place on a board of hexagonal tiles. The idea is to build a chain of tiles from one side of the board to the other. Each tile represents a question that the player has to answer. The answer always begins with the letter that is shown on the chosen tile. Each question has four alternatives that the player chooses from. The time is not unlimited though so he has to be quick in his decision. The player wins when he has made a chain left to right while the AI wins by making a chain from top to bottom.

In addition to playing against the AI, it is also possible to play two players at the same phone. The player that completes his chain first gets to play the gold run. There is also a challenge mode where the player gets to play a series of increasingly more difficult AI opponents. The twist here is that the player gets additional time in the gold run for each tile while at the same time the opponent can block tiles and thus making the gold run harder. There are four challenges in total and once they all have been completed a marathon mode is unlocked.
title: Blockbusters: Football Edition

description:
Star Trek: The Birds of Prey is a traditional vertically scrolling shoot 'em up where the player takes control of the U.S.S. Enterprise. The game starts with Captain Kirk and his crew aboard the Enterprise receiving a distress signal from planet PSI20. The settlement has been attacked by the Klingons and it is up to the player to defend it and help the survivors.

The gameplay is quite typical for a shoot 'em up. The player has a top down view of the play field and has to simply shoot down the enemies without getting killed in the process. The Enterprise is equipped with two weapons: phasers and photon torpedoes. The phasers, which recharge automatically, shoot thin beams that do more damage the longer they are focused on a target. Torpedoes are limited in number, but their explosive damage is enough to take out most enemy ships in one shot. The Enterprise also has a shield that blocks shots until it is depleted. It is however recharged over time if the player avoids being hit. The game includes six levels and in addition to shooting down Klingon ships involves environmental traps such as wormholes and asteroid fields. In one level a cloaking device is used to sneak past the enemy defence.

sample_screenshots.caption: These don't look like much but there are plenty of them.

title: Star Trek: The Birds of Prey

description: Toro is a game set during the festivities of San Fermín in Pamplona (Spain). In this game you will take the role of a "mozo" who has to recollect 10 roses which are laying around in the bullring arena, but that will not be an easy task... You will have to do it while two bulls go after you, so any movement in false will make you restart the level. You will have to repeat the same routine for 14 days, with increasing difficulty (there will be more and faster bulls), until the celebrations end.
title: Toro

description: This game isn't the usual soccer sim where one team plays against another team, here you will control the Argentinian legend Diego Armando Maradona and will have to beat an entire soccer team all alone. It features a series of 18 different button combinations which will need to be either followed on screen in the guided mode, or memorized for later playing in the free mode, sending Diego swerving deftly between defenders until scoring a goal. Maradona is displayed from behind, giving the impression of a camera following him across the pitch as he pulls off various complex dribbling tricks to fend off the rivals, breaking into a Matrix-esque slow-mo mode to show some of the fancier manoeuvres set over 20 levels of difficulty.
title: Maradona

description:
The player will drive a Volkswagen Touareg as if he was Carlos Sainz in the race to the capital of Senegal (Dakar), and will have to face breaks, breakdowns and all sorts of obstacles, giant rocks, dunes and wild animals, to rain, sandstorms and fog.

In this kind of competitions, keeping the car in good conditions is as important as mastering the wheel control. Guidance is also primordial to finish each stage in the top of the standings. Both Carlos Sainz and the copilot advise and warn the player.
title: Carlos Sainz Rally 4x4

description:
Disney Board Games Master is a collection of three board games:* Checkers

  • Reversi
  • 4-in-a-Row

Each game exists in seven different variants:* Classic - the original rules of the game

  • Deluxe - an updated version of the game that adds power-ups
  • Puzzle - a pre-arranged game setup where the player has to overcome different challenges
  • Duel - a multiplayer version of classic mode for two players on the same device
  • Duel deluxe - a multiplayer version of deluxe mode for two players on the same device
  • Classic tutorial - teaches the player how to play the classic mode
  • Deluxe tutorial - teaches the player how to play the deluxe mode

The games can be played on their own or as part of a campaign where the player can earn bronze, silver and gold trophies by performing different challenges.
title: Disney Board Games Master

description: The game follows the movie's plot, following Harry Potter as he tries to enlist Hogwarts students to his new secret society, Dumbledore's Army, in order to teach students Defence Against the Dark Arts. Being a mobile game, the story is mostly via dialogues and the occasional cutscene; each of the game's levels is preceded by a text-only introduction that sums up previous events. The players control Harry as he tries to sneak through the Hogwarts corridors, unseen by fellow students; from time to time, the stealth sequences are interrupted by duels (twitch action mini-games) and simple puzzles.
title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

description:
Harry Potter: Mastering Magic is a collection of mini games revolving around Potter's main activity at Hogwarts (yes, that would be studying). The game has an interesting wrap-up where you need to play for a whole school year and pass your final exams. The game consists of the following mini games:

  • Astronomy - memory game (connect stars to replicate a star configuration)
  • History of Magic - quiz (Potter trivia)
  • Divination - visual recognition puzzle (an object is twisted in a crystal ball, the player must choose the right object out of several similar ones)
  • Transfiguration - a Tangram variant
  • Potions - memory game (count ingredients)
  • Care of Magical Creatures - common sense puzzle (feed the Thestral the right food)
  • Charms - word game (explore a grid of letters and form a spell)
  • Herbology - logic puzzle (grow plants by casting the right spells)
title: Harry Potter: Mastering Magic

description: E.T.: The Extra Terrestrial is a mini-game collection with 47 different games of logic, reflex, strategy, maze and action style. The levels feature different rooms of a multi-storied house, the surrounding garden, suburbs and the dark forest. E.T. for instance has to collect falling teddy bears or the player has to put down a line of candy for E.T. to follow through a maze. The game’s story mode re-enacts all the key scenes from the 1982 classic movie, and tells the whole story of the movie in cut-scenes.
title: E.T.: The Extra Terrestrial

description: Cubes is a Tetris-like matching game with physics. Falling objects, consisting of little cubes, bounce back once they touch other objects. These objects do not fall into place and stay there, they can be controlled by the player until three cubes of the same color touch each other and explode. The game is set in a pirate scenario. In order to hide his treasures, O'l Smitty dumps them into the sea, where the player has to steal them from him. Occasionally other objects are thrown into the sea, such as gunpowder or spinning blades with additional effects.
title: Cubes

description:
Ojom's Mobile IQ Trainer is a brain training game. It features ten different mini games in five categories: Algebra, Visual, Memory, Analysis and Logic. The mini games vary from remembering a series of shapes to finding out the next number in a mathematical sequence.

The player's progress is logged. When absolving mini games the player collects points. The main game mode, IQ Training, is where your total progress is logged. Each time you play a mini-game, you're given a certain number of points. These points earn the player an academical degree, ranging from "School Student" to "Genius".

In addition to the brain training games, Mobile IQ Trainer features a full Sudoku game with three different levels of difficulty.
title: Mobile IQ Trainer

description:
MotorDuels: Outcast is a mobile game combining both racing and combat. The setting of the game is somewhat influenced by the Mad Max movies, where individuals roam the wilderness in armed cars and fight each other. The player takes the role of Ian, who was driven by his home city by a gang lead by Necro and his two deputies. The first levels are set in the wilderness as the player gains levels and upgrades his weapons, before reaching the higher levels which take place in the outskirts of the city. At the higher levels the player mostly fights Necro's deputies, or try to battle Necro himself. Killing Necro wins the game.

The game is based on duels between the player and various opponents, most of them random (except the three main villains). The two opponents race on a road towards the center, where a prize awaits. Once reaching the center, each do a U turn and heads back. During this time each side can shoot its weapon to hit his opponent. Shot that missed the opponent leaves a hole in the road, which slows down the opponent car if not avoided. Duel can be won both by destroying your opponent's car or by arriving first back to the starting line. Between duels the player can fix his car, buy new weapons or practice (without gaining experience points and levels).

The game has a relatively advanced AI system which allows the computer opponents to perform and change different techniques, which was noted as one of the strongest features of the game by different game reviews.
title: Motor Duels: Outcast

description:
Rubik's Numbolution is a math-based puzzle game. Similar to Tetris or Columns, blocks are falling from the top of the screen and the player has to remove them before they fill the screen or time runs out. The twist in Numbolution is that each block has a number on it and the player removes blocks by selecting those whose numbers add up to a certain value that is shown on the screen. The more blocks that are removed at a time, the higher points will be awarded. A level is completed when all blocks have been removed.

There are two game modes: challenge and endless. The challenge mode consists of five levels each with three rounds of gameplay plus a bonus round. Between the challenges new special blocks are introduced. These include chain blocks that makes all block vulnerable to popping even if they are not part of the sum, minus blocks that have negative values and that have to be used twice. The bonus round consist of a challenge question that the player has to answer. The endless mode goes on until the time runs out.

sample_screenshots.caption: Ice blocks has to be used twice
When using a black block the player can remove all connected blocks of a color...

title: Rubik's Numbolution

description:
Frogger has been cursed with a spell that forces him to move to a mysterious beat. Now he needs help to find Toadstein's castle so that the spell can be broken.

Frogger: Beats n' Bounces takes the original Frogger concept and makes a rhythm action game out of it. The game scrolls vertically and Frogger automatically jumps forward. Since Frogger is cursed he can only move in time with the beat. The player's role in all of this is to direct Frogger left and right so that he doesn't crash into the various obstacles that lie ahead of him. To succeed with this the player has to follow the beat and make the moves at the right time. Frogger can also use his very long tongue to eat insects (flies, butterflies and dragonflies) that he comes across. This also can only be done in time with the beat. Since it often can be hard to hear the beat in the music, the player can also follow it with the interface that flashes for every beat.

The player scores points for every lane change as well as for every insect swallowed. When making five correct moves in a row the player enters crazy mode and scores double points. Frogger has an energy bar that decreases when colliding with an obstacle. By eating butterflies and dragonflies, energy can be recovered.

sample_screenshots.caption: It's no real Frogger if you can't be hit by a car

title: Frogger: Beats n' Bounces

description:
Rubik's Bloxx Twister is a match-three puzzle game that despite its license has very little to do with the famous cube. With gameplay similar to Tetris Attack, the goal of the game is to match three blocks or more of the same colour by swapping the position of two horizontally adjacent blocks. Unlike Bejeweled blocks can only be swapped horizontally. When a match of three or more blocks is made, they disappear and the ones above them will fall down and take their place. New blocks are added from the bottom, row by row, and the player has to prevent the blocks from reaching the top.

There are two kinds of special power-up blocks: bombs and rubik's cubes. Bombs explode when matched and remove surrounding blocks. Rubik's cubes can be matched with normal blocks and clear every block on the screen of that color.

sample_screenshots.caption: There are two power-ups: bombs and rubik's cubes
Matching bombs to blow up surrounding blocks

title: Rubik's Bloxx Twister

description:
This mobile adaption of Rainbow Six 3: Raven Shield is a top-down stealth action game where the player takes control of a lone soldier. The game consists of three missions and the objectives for all of them is to rescue hostages and disarm bombs. If any of the hostages die or the bombs explode, the player has to restart the mission. The first mission takes place at an oil refinery in Venezuela while the second and third one take place at an airport in the Carribean.

The gameplay is quite simple and involves moving around unseen and shooting the enemies before they can react. Hostages are automatically rescued when the player gets close to them and bombs are defused by simply holding down a button for a few seconds. When an enemy spots the player, he might attack the hostage or arm a bomb. The player then only has a few seconds to disarm it. The player can also enter a scout mode to move around the camera and view distant parts of the map.

For each mission the player is awarded a medal and when he has all three, a veteran mode is unlocked. The veteran mode is harder and has more enemies. The player also gets a body armor for extra protection.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is where we start out
Each mission consists of a few sections

title: Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Raven Shield

description:
Geralt the Witcher has just completed his training and is set out to make his way in the world. The game starts with Geralt investigating the presence of a werewolf that is terrorizing the local people. It's not long before he finds out about more insidious evil. Now Geralt sets out on a journey that will be his final test.

The Witcher: Crimson Trail is a mobile game based on the books by fantasy author Andrzej Sapkowski and the PC game The Witcher by CD Project Red. While the original PC game is an RPG, this mobile adaptation is instead a side-scrolling hack-and-slash game acting as a prequel. It involves fighting various monsters, platform jumping and some minor role playing elements. The player can do a simple one-strike attack or more advanced combo attack moves. Further into the game more combos are made available. It's possible to switch between two different swords, one made of silver and one of steel. Some enemies are more vulnerable to one than the other.

Magical signs are also available. There are four different ones, one that throws back the enemy, one that immobilizes it, one that launches fire, and one that makes the player invulnerable for a short time. After each level the player is able to upgrade one of these. The use of signs is limited by fatigue. The player will find different herbs throughout the levels. These can be used to create potions at the end of the level. Throughout the game the player will come across different NPCs and similarly to the PC game these encounters involve moral choices. For example early on the player gets to choose between healing a character, killing him or just leaving him be.
title: The Witcher: Crimson Trail

description: BigFoot Challenge is a top-down racing game with monster trucks. Players race against five other, computer-controlled cars on tracks set in the Sahara desert, the dense rain forest of Amazonia and the snow-covered hills of Greenland. There are six tracks in total. There are no weapons, but it is possible to lose the race by taking too much damage. The player needs to avoid bumping into other cars and steer away from stones on the road that cause the car to jump. When moving off the track or taking shortcuts, the car slows down considerably and re-spawns after a while on the road. The two available game modes are quick race and championship. There is but a single car to drive.

sample_screenshots.caption: In the lead on the ice track
See you guys, I'm going for a swim.

title: BigFoot Challenge

description:
Silent Hill: Orphan takes place in the orphanage of Silent Hill. It starts out with telling the story of Ben who returns after 30 years. Now he is back at the orphanage to find out what really happened that night when nearly everyone at the orphanage was killed. The player starts out taking control of Ben but will later also get to play as two other survivors: Moon and Karen.

The game plays like a first person adventure game. It consists of a number of static environments that the player can move between and interact with a point and click interface. With the use of a cursor the player can click on any object on the screen. Doing so opens up a menu with four icons: an eye, a hand, a mouth and a rucksack. The eye is used to examine objects, the hand is used to interact, the mouth to talk or taste, and the rucksack opens the inventory. Action segments exist too. At times the player will come across monsters which need to be defeated. With the press of a button the cursor will then be transformed into a crosshair allowing the player to aim and shoot.

sample_screenshots.caption: Suddenly someone starts to talk with me
The bathroom. Examine the symbol on the wall to go to the bloody version of the world.

title: Silent Hill: Orphan

description:
Silent Hill Mobile 3 once again lets the player take the role of Vincent who also appeared in the second game in the series. The game is the final part in a trilogy that began in Silent Hill: Orphan and takes place in a mansion where the dark secrets of the town finally will be revealed. In addition to Vincent the player will also get to play a girl called Emily who in the middle of the game needs to help Vincent.

The gameplay is similar to the previous two games. It's a first person adventure game that consists of a number of static environments that the player can move between and interact with a point and click interface. The player can interact with different objects by clicking on them with a cursor. Doing so opens up a menu with three icons: an eye, a hand and a bag. The eye is used to examine objects, the hand is used to interact and the bag opens the inventory. There are some shooting parts too. At some occasions the player will have to fight against different monsters. When that happens the cursor will be transformed into a crosshair allowing the player to aim and shoot. The shooting system is slightly different from previous games. Each enemy has a weak point and when hit at the right time leads to extra damage.

sample_screenshots.caption: Health packs are useful when the shooting starts
This symbol is used for moving between the real world and the otherworld
Need to connect these drawings into a picture
Looks like someone hanged himself in this room

title: Silent Hill Mobile 3

description: In Rover Reunion the members of a family of rovers have gone astray and the player has to help them reunite. The game plays like a sliding puzzle game where each tile represents a piece of a road. The rovers wander around on these and the goal is to make it possible for them to move to the same tile. To do this the player has to shuffle around the tiles until the roads align and a continuous path is created. The game is time limited and once all rovers has been united the player gets to move on to the next level. Points are awarded for each united rover and the amount of time left. There is a total of ten levels in the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Third level - Out in the desert
The bigger the family the harder it gets

title: Rover Reunion

description:
In a post-apocalyptic world, mutant warriors attack a colony of survivors and abduct two young women. AXA, the sword-swinging heroine of the game who has witnessed the violent raid, follows the mutants' tracks in order to rescue the kidnapped girls.

She has to find her way through the wilderness where former villages lay waste, cross dark underground caves as well as an old sewer system where creepy creatures linger until she reaches the (not so) deserted mega city where she has to confront the warriors. Her encounter with the final boss takes place on the top of the mutants' headquarter's building.

On her way AXA not only battles attacking creatures like enormous rats, stray dogs, giant spiders, mutated wasps and aggressive alligators, but has to master challenges in solving puzzles to be able to continue her path. Along the way, she discovers useful items which she can collect, use directly or combine in her inventory to get an even more useful object.

AXA is an action-adventure featuring three big levels, six different graphical settings, 50 rooms to explore and more than 20 items to interact with. While the player uses the direction pad to have AXA walk, jump, climb and fight her way freely through the scenes in 2D arcade style, an icon-based menu can be popped up to perform the puzzle-related tasks such as examine, use or combine things.

The mobile game features original illustrations from Spanish artist Romero on whose comic strips and books the game is based. They introduce the player to the different chapters of the story and also reward him at the end of the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: This crate in a cave was easy to open...
Luckily, she has some medkits in her inventory.
AXA defending herself against a feisty hound.
Mutant worriers attack a small village and abduct the tribe leader's daughters.

title: Axa

description:
Set in the year 1891, Sherlock Holmes: The Official Movie Game features the famous detective Sherlock Holmes and his loyal friend Dr. Watson. They become involved in a strange murder case related to a secret cult of Lord Blackwood. Players control Holmes or Dr. Watson (or sometimes both of them) in each level, fight enemies, collect items and solve puzzles to get to the goal. Holmes fights with his powerful punches and kicks, while Watson uses his gun with further distance and less damage.

Sherlock Holmes: The Official Movie Game is an action game based on the 2009 film Sherlock Holmes, though there are some changes in the plot. Players move the character to the final goal while trying to sweep out enemies on the way. Depending on the context, not all people are enemies; players can talk to some of them to get information. Sometimes, between a conversation, players have multiple choices to choose what your character will respond, though choices don't affect the game much. The Genius Vision icon helps players identify suspicious places so that players can move on. Collected items are stored in a chest. Items are various, but players can only use health restorers anytime; the other items can only be used in certain places.

The graphics are in isometric 2D. When players reach the goal, the game will be automatically saved. Depending on the final score of each level, there are 3 kinds of ranking: S, A and B.

sample_screenshots.caption: A group of cultists doing something they probably aren't allowed to do

title: Sherlock Holmes: The Official Movie Game

description:
Triagonal is a mobile phone puzzle game in which the player has to place falling gems in a certain way to make them disappear – not unlike Dr. Mario, but with some special clues.

The crystals appear randomly in five different colours (green, yellow, red, pink, blue), either single or paired. The player has to build diagonals of (at least) three same-coloured elements by moving and rotating the gems accordingly to make them disappear. There are also two different layers (front and back) to consider; crystals pile up only if they are in the same layer.

If the player manages to crack at least one combination of each colour, s/he completes the word BONUS on the right side. This feat will be rewarded either by three wildcard gems that have a chameleon-like quality in adopting any colour or by a cross-hair to shoot out some unwanted crystals.

Chain reactions help to clear the space, but the gems fall faster and faster and when the field is packed, the game is over.
title: Triagonal

description:
Join the cartoon character Jimmy Two-Shoes on his missions to help his best friend Beezy! Jimmy Two-Shoes is a short adventure game based on the cartoon series having the same name. Players can choose freely from four different levels: Party Pooper, Minion for a Day, Itchy Lucius and Ghost Smackin'.

There are objectives in each level (all levels contain no fewer than two objectives), and players must complete them to proceed. In order to do so, players have to move Jimmy around, talk to people and (less often) get necessary items and interact with objects. You can see your inventory and objectives anytime. Moving Jimmy to the bottom of the screen when in a location will lead him to the town's map, which players can use to change their location. Sometimes, playing through a mini game is required. If this happens, an instruction will appear, telling players what to do in the game. There is also a hidden bonus too: the Lava Worms. you can collect them to boot your final score.

The graphics are isometric 2D. The maximum number of save slots is 3. Players have a choice among English, French, German, Spain and Italian.
title: Jimmy Two-Shoes

description:
Edgar is a furry little creature with a distinct curiosity that tends to get him into trouble. This time he got himself trapped in an extensive cave system from which he can only escape with a lot of skill and savvy.

The cave system consists of 45 independent rooms - 5 tutorial caves and 40 main caves - each with a single exit that Edgar has to open by solving puzzles. Each exit will guide Edgar to the next room until he will eventually reach daylight again.

Edgar can walk and float – by rotating his tail – through the rooms. He digs through loose dirt effortlessly and pushes single objects – like boulders – out of his way provided the area behind them is not blocked. However, he is not strong enough to stop falling objects whereas it is no problem for him to dig a path underneath a still object.

The exit of each room opens when all balloons and symbol blocks in that room got eliminated. They disappear when they touch an identical element, so, basically, Edgar has to bring the objects together. This is not always an easy task as they often seem to be unreachable far away from each other or because there are odd numbers of objects of the same kind. In that case, Edgar must find a clever solution since bringing together only two of them would leave the third one behind. In some rooms, Edgar also has to pick coloured keys to open doors of the same colour to proceed.

Edgar meets creatures like bats, spiders, ghosts or skeletons along his way which go after him immediately if they detect him. Sometimes, he can knock them out by dropping a boulder onto their tops or luring them into the magma, for example. In most cases, however, Edgar is well advised to stay away from them contrary to the treasure chests and crystals he can collect along his way (to raise the high score).

Neither a time limit exists, nor are Edgar's lives restricted. The progress is saved automatically, so Edgar can take his time to solve the puzzles of each room and give it a new try, if he gets injured or the room got unsolvable. Edgar is also allowed to skip three rooms. So even if he can't figure out the solution for the current room, he still has the chance to proceed with the game. Rooms that were solved, however, can be played again to gain a better score.

sample_screenshots.caption: Which teleporter leads to the treasure?

title: Edgar: Cave of Secrets

description:
Rayman Raving Rabbids TV Party is a collection of twelve mini-games starring the Raving Rabbids (spin-off to Ubisoft's Rayman series). The mini-games are in some way based on movies and TV series; like Band of Rabbids (Band of Brothers) or Rabbid Jones (Indiana Jones). This is a one-button game, all mini-games are played using only the '5' key. The game starts with only one mini-game unlocked. By playing the mini-games, you collect golden carrots that you can use to unlock the other mini-games in any order you want.

This is the complete list of minigames:

  • Band Of Rabbids: In this mini-game you and other Rabbids are in free fall. Your job is to launch gum bubbles to the falling Rabbids in order to avoid them from hitting the floor.

  • Rabbid Of Persia: Side-scroller runner. You use the '5' key to avoid deadly obstacles.

  • Wild Wild Rabbid: You are in control of a locomotive that moves forward automatically. On top of the locomotive's chimney there is a Rabbid. Your job is to activate the chimney at the right moments sending the Rabbid through the air and avoiding the incoming missiles.

  • Rabbid On The Moon: In this one you have to jump from moon to moon avoiding mouse traps and falling into the deep space. The Rabbid is always walking around the moon, when you press '5' he jumps to the nearest moon in line.

  • Croc Rider: The Rabbid is on a life saver pulled by a crocodile. The game presents a top-down view with the crocodile moving to the top of the screen. The crocodile changes direction when the '5' key is pressed. The goal of the mini-game is to avoid that the crocodile (and the Rabbid) collides with the ropes that delimit the track.

  • Supersize Rabbid: The goal of this mini-game it to catch the food being thrown from above. The Rabbid is always running and changes direction (left or right) by pressing the '5' key.

  • Rabbid Jones: In this mini-game you move to the left jumping on top of balloons or swinging yourself on the ropes hanging from them.

  • Independence Rabbid: You are attached to a rocket going to the sky. You need to press the '5' key when the rocket is in the desired direction to activate the rocket's engine and advance through the sky avoiding different obstacles.

  • Eye Of The Rabbid: In this mini-game you fight against another Rabbid. A number of target circles will appear on different spots of the Rabbid; for each one of those circles, another larger circle will appear and begin to shrink. You have to press '5' when this circle is inside the target circle in order to punch the Rabbid at that spot.

  • Seven Seas Rabbids: Descend into the deep sea avoiding octopuses, sharks and other sea animals. The Rabbid moves in circles and changes direction when you press '5. By combining these two movements (clockwise and anti-clockwise circular movement), you can move in any direction you want.

  • Rabbid Trek: The Rabbid is traveling along some kind of wormhole full of obstacles. The Rabbid moves in spiral through the wormhole changing direction when the '5' key is pressed.

  • Rabbid Tower: Your job in this mini-game is to build the highest tower of Rabbids that you can. For that you have to drop the Rabbids as close to the center as possible to keep the tower balanced.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can take a picture of someone's face and use it as your opponent's face in 'Eye of the Rabbid'

title: Rayman: Raving Rabbids TV Party

description:
Hector the Specter Detector is back. Thanks to a mix up in the space-time continuum, Hector has entered an alternate and even more fiendish version of the mansion. Help Hector save the trapped souls.

Phantom Mansion Origins is a mobile version of the Phantom Mansion: Spectrum of Souls games. Move Hector about, gathering the souls, then make your way to the exit.. Use keys to open locked doors. Use crates to make bridges over pits. Avoid skeletons and zombies as their touch is deadly.
title: Phantom Mansion: Origins

description:
This version of The Sims 2 is a downscaled game fit for cell phones. This version stays somewhat true to its big brother on the PC, while obviously limiting the amount of items and activities to work with the less powerful hardware.

The game lets the player pick a "Sim" out of a list of premade ones, both male and female. The game starts with the Sim living in a small already-made house. Through using objects around the house as well as talking to other Sims who visit the player the Sim's skills will increase. They include: cooking, charisma, body, logic and creativity. Higher skills means that the Sim can do things better and get better jobs down the line.

The Sim also has certain "wants" which the player needs to meet, such as buying a coffee maker or telling a dirty joke to another Sim. The more the Sim interacts with other Sims, the better friends they become. This can in the end lead to a relationship or even marriage with any of the 6 different computer controlled Sims.

The money the Sim makes can be used to buy things for the house (such as a flat screen TV or a bathtub). These will not only make the house look nicer, but when used they raise the different needs bars much quicker. For example, buying a stove will make it easier for the Sim to eat than if he only owned a microwave oven. There are also extra rooms for the house which can be purchased, adding new activities and features for the Sim to partake in. Also, a constant drain of money is that every meal of food eaten costs a small amount of money.
title: The Sims 2

description:
In this game you play as a contestant in the TV game show The Krypton Factor. The game consists of 18 mini-games in six different categories related to the six rounds of the TV show. The different categories are:

  • Mental Agility
  • Response
  • Observation
  • Physical Ability
  • Intelligence
  • General Knowledge

Each category has 4 mini-games, with the exception of Physical Ability and General Knowledge which consist of only one mini-game with three different difficulty levels (Easy, Normal and Hard). The game has two game modes: Episode Mode an Quick Training. In Episode Mode you play through the 6 traditional Krypton Factor rounds to become "Superperson of the year". In Quick Training you can choose any mini-game in any category and play it.
title: Krypton Factor: The Original

description:
During a battle with Sonic (in Super Sonic form), Dr.Eggman uses his new weapon and manages to trap Sonic. He then drains the power of the Chao Emeralds from Super Sonic and use the power to create a blast strong enough to shatter the Earth into pieces. Seeing that Sonic is now useless to him, he jettisons him and quickly gets away. When Sonic wakes up, he finds a little creature who apparently has lost his memory. Sonic calls him "Chip" and promises to get his memory back. What Eggman doesn't know is that the ray also gives Sonic the ability to turn into a beast called "Werehog" at night. With this ability and Chip's guidance, Sonic must travel around the world to stop Dr.Eggman, find shrines that fixes the Emeralds, and defeat Dark Gaia - a beast unleashed from Eggman's new weapon...

Players take control of either Sonic or Werehog in each level, battling enemies and collecting rings or other items while trying to reach the goal. A level can take place at day or night (or both).
