During the day, players play as Sonic, and when night comes, Sonic turns into Werehog. Sonic and Werehog have different abilities and weaknesses: Sonic is faster but weaker, whereas Werehog is stronger but slower. The day levels and night levels have been suitably designed for both Sonic and Werehog, so you have to make the best use of their abilities. There is an energy gauge enabling Sonic and Werehog to use special attacks, which can be recharged by collecting items or fighting enemies. Rings are the only things that keep Sonic alive. Sonic will lose a certain number of rings if he touches an enemy. Doing so can kill Sonic immediately if he has no rings left.

The game's graphics are in 2D. Players' process is automatically saved when completing each level. Every three levels form a "zone".
title: Sonic: Unleashed

description:
One day in Sky Bean Land, a little ball named Bounce notices that the colors around him seem to be disappearing. Bounce decides to investigate, and later finds out that they are being absorbed by some large machines. Who built them and what for, it's up to Bounce to find out...

Bounce Tales is a sequel to Nokia’s original Bounce game. It is a 2D puzzle-platformer featuring Bounce as the main character. Players have to move Bounce forward the goal (while sometimes have to destroy machines). Bounce can jump to avoid various obstacles. Later in the game the ball gains the ability to transform into a solid rock-ball (to crush walls and other things) and a very light ball (to jump higher). The game also features some bonus levels.

The graphics are in 2D. Players' progress can be automatically saved. There is a hidden secret which can be unlocked if you complete all levels in the shortest time and get enough items.
title: Bounce Tales

description: El Internado is a graphic adventure based on the Spanish TV show of the same name. The player plays as Marcos, who is looking for his little sister Paula, who has disappeared. The gameplay is mostly driven by traditional graphic adventure mechanics and elements, like clicking on objects to interact with them, an inventory, the ability to use objects on other objects and multiple choice dialogs. But the game also includes puzzles of the style of those often used in survival horror games like Silent Hill or Resident Evil. The game features eight different locations, official names & likenesses of the TV show team members, story written with the collaboration of the series writers, eight different locations and nine different type of puzzles.
title: El Internado Laguna Negra: El Juego Móvil

description:
Keymon and his friend Rohan have decided to attend the Big Fish Hunting. It's up to you to help them catch as many fish as possible! Players take control of Keymon's fishing line, though players cannot move it much. The hook moves from side to side. In order to catch the moving fish, players have to choose the right time to release the hook. Different kinds of fish will give players different points. Beside fish, rubbish also present; catching them can decrease players' score. Sometimes, one or two crabs appear and is/are ready to grab the hook when it gets near and hold it until players pull it out. Players also meet a rectangular thing with a question mark on it which will have various affect on players (give players strength, increase/decrease points) There is a time limit and a "goal" score. Players have to reach at least the goal score within the time limit to proceed the next level. As player proceed, there will be obstacles, making it harder to reach fish.

When players lose a level, it is possible to restart it with the score unchanged. After each level (except the final level), there is a "did you know" fun fact which tell players things related to fish.

The graphics are in 2D. The game knows no save function. High score can be recorded in the Top Score section.
title: Keymon Goes Fishing

description: As one of three taxi drivers, players have to pick up and deliver passengers as quickly as possible, in several different towns. Traffic wants to be avoided, and shortcuts want to be found. A quick delivery earns drivers a tip, and more bonus time to continue their shift. Various conditions including fog, nighttime, and roads covered by snow raise the difficulty level. There are 5 additional cars waiting to be unlocked by taxi drivers who can earn enough money.

sample_screenshots.caption: Picking up a passenger on the first stage
An intersection on the second stage
Cutting off the A-Team van on an intersection

title: Super Taxi Driver: The Original

description:
In Mafia II Mobile the player takes the role of Marco Russetto, a member of the Salieri crime family. The games starts in Lost Heaven where the young gangster is sent on a mission to Empire Bay. His job is to kill Tommy Angelo, the protagonist of the original Mafia.

It is an action game played from a top-down perspective. Unlike the PC/console version it is not an open world game. Instead it is split into levels where only a small part of Empire Bay can be explored. The levels consist of locating an NPC to retrieve a mission that most of the time involves killing members of rival gangs. The player can then walk around the level or steal a car and drive. The levels are not completely linear. By exploring the player can find money, weapons and health packs. Each level also has side missions that can be done. Combat is straightforward. When using a gun the game auto-aims at the closest enemy and the player only presses a button to shoot.

sample_screenshots.caption: Money can be found lying around
Oh no! I got knocked out
The red circle indicate a side mission

title: Mafia II Mobile

description:
In Paid to Kill the player takes control of the assassin Ramon Spectre. After being knocked out, he wakes up in the Siberian snow without any idea of what has happened or where he is. Almost instantly he meets Falkov, his assistant, who tells him who he is and what he has to do. It turns out Spectre is on a mission to kill the bosses of a terrorist organisation known as Ground Member.

Paid to Kill is an action game played from a top-down perspective that involves both shooting and sneaking. Shooting is simplified and the player does not need to aim. He simply draws his gun when he needs it and Spectre will automatically shoot when enemies are within range. It's often necessary to use stealth or the guards might pull the alarm. By using shadows and corners the player can avoid enemy contact. Shooting an enemy without being noticed causes triple damage. It's also possible to hide in closets. Sometimes it's necessary to plant explosives to blow up fences. They can also be used to kill enemies. The player earns money for taking out the terrorist bosses. It can then be used between missions to purchase upgrades such as increased speed and weapon damage.

sample_screenshots.caption: But his assistant is around to help him
Text description after killing the boss

title: Paid to Kill

description:
3D Bomberman Atomic is a mobile version of Hudson Soft's long running series. Although the game uses three dimensional graphics the game is still viewed from a traditional top down perspective. The basic gameplay remains the same too. The player moves through a maze and has to destroy his enemies by placing bombs in strategic locations. The enemies will die if they are within range of the bomb. When all enemies are dead the player has completed the level. Different power ups exist. These can have both positive and negative effects on the player. For example there are power ups that allows the player to push or throw bombs while others increases or decreases the movement speed. There are also different level elements such as moving belts, teleports and jumping pads that are needed to navigate through the levels.

The game has a campaign mode that consists of a number of stages (each with a few levels) that has to be completed in order. Each stage represents a planet with it's own graphical style. Unlocked stages can be played on their own in the single play mode. There's also a match mode which is for multiplayer against up to three other bombermen. On Sony Ericsson handsets this can be played against human players via Bluetooth, while on other handsets it's only against AI controlled opponents.

sample_screenshots.caption: The enemy got caught in the explosion

title: 3D Bomberman Atomic

description: This is a mobile adaptation of the word construction game Scrabble. Up to four players compete in creating words out of individual letters that are placed on a board. Each letter is worth a certain amount of points based on how common it is and the idea is to get as many points as possible when all letters have been used. The game can be played solo against the AI (whose skill level can be modified) or against other human players by passing the phone around. There are a few different game modes. The classic mode plays just like the original board game (although with some options to modify the rules) while in the solitaire mode the player gets the whole board for himself and has to try to get as high score as possible. The quick game modes does away with the board and instead the player gets to create four words with as many letters as possible. There is also a tutorial mode for those that wants to learn the basics.

sample_screenshots.caption: The AI's speciality seems to be picking hard words that gives low scores

title: Scrabble

description: Mini Golf Castles allows up to four players to compete on medieval themed courses, each consisting of nine holes. At first, only one course can be selected, two others can be unlocked through tournament play. Four characters are available for visual representation. The aim is visualized by a punctured line indicating the direction of where the ball will go, the power of the shot is simply controlled by a button press and showed on a bar. There is an eight-stroke limit per hole. Some of the challenges are in tune with the medieval theme, like putting the ball at the right moment into a hole while an armour suit puts a sword down.

sample_screenshots.caption: Cannons sometimes play a part as well
Here's a gap that needs to be overcome
Need to hit the switch first before the hole is accessable

title: Mini Golf Castles

description: The content of the 3D version of Mini Golf Castles is the same as in the 2D version. Up to four characters compete on three medieval themed courses. The 3D graphics are used for a different perspective and more flexibility for the camera that can be influenced by the player.

sample_screenshots.caption: Game start at the first hole and course
Hole where a cannon plays a role
A different view used by me at the third hole

title: 3D Mini Golf: Castles

description: Sacred for mobile phones is an action game with RPG elements and a spin-off of the Sacred series. There is no choice of character, however some traits may be selected: whether the female protagonist will rely on melee weapons or use of magic powers. The gameplay is action-oriented: the player receives quests which usually see him travel to other regions of the world killing a required number of monsters or delivering an important item (fighting hordes of enemies all along). Enemies may drop weapon, armor and potions. When the player acquires a certain number of experience points, his character gets a level-up and the player may invest those points in the character's basic parameters - damage dealt by certain types of weapons, resistance to an element or weapon type or health points.
title: Sacred

description: Forgotten Warrior is an action game which came pre-installed on certain models of Samsung mobile phones. The premise of the game is simple: a boy loves a girl; when the boy is asleep an evil gang kidnaps the girl. The boy is awakened by his brother who tells him what has happened and instructs him along the way. The game is played on static screens with platforms, enemies, hazards, etc. In the beginning the boy has no weapons, so he must avoid all enemies or attack them stealthy with a punch. Later on he acquires a weapon and magical spells. Along the way the boy can collect coins which allow him to buy spells and potions.

sample_screenshots.caption: Got to avoid the moving flame
Intro: the boy's brother is there to help

title: Forgotten Warrior

description:
Arch Angel is an action flight game that was pre-installed on certain models of Samsung mobile phones.

In year 2028 the conflict between the Earth and the other planets has brought the world to the edge of the final war. The player mans the Earth's ultimate weapon - a "revolutionary land-sea-air-space unit" called Arch Angel that resembles a fire-spitting angel. The aircraft is armed with machine gun, missiles and plasma canon. The game is played in pseudo-3D environment a la After Burner: the enemies move into the screen and the player has to maneuver the craft and outgun enemy fighters. The game is divided into 8 missions. Upon completing a mission the player may upgrade the aircraft's armor and weapons.

sample_screenshots.caption: It's boss time - Archangel transforms into a robot

title: Arch Angel

description: Survivor is an action game based on a popular reality TV show. You are one of the final five castaways on a remote island, your goal is to be the last who leaves it. Each day you do your chores (Fishing) and participate in one of the contests (Log Run, Wild River, Spirit of Fire, Spear Throw). But beware: each night a Tribal Council is held and of the castaways is voted off the island. To avoid this you need to show the best result in daily activities and contests or make pacts with other castaways.

sample_screenshots.caption: Spirit of Fire action - repeat the sequence
Helen showed the best result here, so she gets immunity for today

title: Survivor: Expedition Robinson

description: This is a Qix variant. The player needs to uncover a girl's picture by cutting portions of it, but there are enemies on screen to stop the player and each level is also timed. Each level is divided into 6 sub-levels, the girl's picture and the enemy types changing with every level. There's also an enemy that can change a girl's picture into a behemoth. From time to time various items appear on screen and the player can earn bonuses by cutting sections with these items.

sample_screenshots.caption: Hm... Not exactly my idea of a "sexy" picture
Stay away from the plant when it bites.

title: Sexy Puzzmaniac

description:
You are a sky diver, and your goal is to reach the center of the landing zone and score maximum points. During free fall you can maneuver in all directions and fly through rings for points. At a certain altitude you need to open the parachute and start maneuvering towards the landing zone considering the wind. In each level you must achieve a certain amount of points to advance. The game is viewed from top-down perspective, and you are skydiving towards the polygon-drawn ground. If you did well you go to a bonus level in which you pilot a plane viewed from behind and your goal is to fly through rings for more points.

The skydiving section of the game resembles Pilotwings.
title: Sky Diver

description: Play as Homer from the ever-popular television cartoon series The Simpsons as he runs around Springfield trying to avoid a nuclear meltdown caused by Plopper (aka Spider Pig). You can interact with other characters such as Marge, Lisa, Bart, Maggie, Barney, Grampa, Apu, and many more. You will be notified by them to find certain items. Some, such as Krusty the Clown, Officers Lou and Eddie, Sideshow Bob, Chief Wiggum, and Moe Szyslak will try to stop Homer. So, they must be avoided. There are also burning tires and giant sinkholes to avoid as Homer makes his way around town. Keep an eye on his energy level and pick up donuts and Buzz Cola to restore it. Locations includes inside the nuclear power plant, the Simpsons house, and outside the Kwik-E-Mart.
title: The Simpsons: Minutes to Meltdown

description: QuadraPop is an action game similar to Tetris. Colored musical notes are falling from above, in pairs. The player can rotate the falling pair of notes and move it left and right until it lands. If at least four notes of the same color are touching, they disappear and the player receives points. Sometimes, a blocking note falls down; it can only be removed if a note next to it disappears. The game level increases as the player receives score; on higher levels, the notes fall down more quickly, but the player receives more points for matching them up. It is possible to start from any level.

sample_screenshots.caption: What is this "Tetris" you speak of?

title: QuadraPop

description: Sonic and friends go to Beijing, China to participate in the 2008 Summer Olympic Games, and this time Mario and friends are nowhere in sight. Five events are included, being 1500m Hurdles, 400m Hurdles, Triple Jump, Discus, and Javelin, and the playable characters being Sonic the Hedgehog, Miles "Tails" Prower, Knuckles the Echidna, and Amy Rose. The events go through several rounds (Qualifying, Heats, Semi Finals and Finals), increasing in difficulty each time. The game automatically saves progress, and features easy one-button controls.
title: Sonic at the Olympic Games

description:
Cyberpunk: The Arasaka's Plot is a mobile game based on Mike Pondsmith's pen and paper RPG Cyberpunk. The player takes control of a man called Sam Gibson who remembers little of his life before becoming a mega-corporate killer for hire. Now the year is 2022 and Arasaka wants him dead. Gibson has been charged with murder and it's up to to the player to find out why and who is behind the plot.

The game is a platformer similar to Flashback. The player can walk and run left and right, jump, crouch and climb ledges up and down. When entering combat the player uses a gun at long range or a melee attack at short range. Once enemies have been killed the player can take their armor and other items they might carry. Items that can be found include implants and new weapons. After taking damage, medic kits can be used to restore health.

The player can hack various computer terminals he comes across. By doing so it's possible to get access to weapon and stat upgrades and to unlock doors. The player might also come across links to the game's website where more of its back story is revealed. Hacking involves playing a mini game that is similar to QIX. The game has some minor RPG elements although the player's stats increase automatically as he progresses through the game. There are also implants that can be used to give the player an advantage through special abilities.
title: Cyberpunk: The Arasaka's Plot

description: In this game players can race as the world champion Jenson Button and be part of the Honda F1 team in his officially licensed mobile racing game. The game includes three championship modes with 12 races on circuits around the world, like Spain, Germany, Japan, all under any weather conditions. Each championship mode has a different level of difficulty.
title: Jenson Button Grand Prix Racer

description:
In Power Darts you will be playing as a newcomer challenging a wide range of characters at the PDC World Championship in order to challenge the iconic Phil "The Power" Taylor.

There is a wide selection of modes and games with unlockables: PDC World tournament, Las Vegas Desert Classic, 301, 501, 701, Round the Clock and Killer. PDC World Championship and Las Vegas Desert Classic are the story mode of the game. The player will be facing opponents and if he succeed in every challenge he will face Phil Taylor. In 301, 501, and 701 games the point is to get the score down to exactly zero. In Count up, the players compete to see who can achieve the highest score. In Round the Clock, players must try to hit the numbers one through twelve in sequential order. Killer is a game in which only the numbers ten and over, doubles, trebles and the bull count. The player must hit the number three times before being able to score on it. When the opponent has also hit the same number three times it is out of play and scores for nether player.
title: Phil Taylor's Power Darts

description:
Agent X is a mobile exclusive entry in the Mystery Case Files series of hidden object puzzle games. The player takes the role of a member of S.A.N.D. (Secret Alliance of Nebulous Directives), a secret organization that investigates bizarre occurrences around the world. The game was released in an episodic format with new episodes being released weekly. Each episode contains a number of scenes from a certain occurrence. In addition to the episodic story mode there were also daily puzzles each consisting of a random scene that was automatically chosen every day.

The gameplay works like in other hidden object games with the player's crime computer generating a list of objects that the player then has to locate within the current scene. When the player finds an object he moves a cursor to it and clicks on it and it's removed from the scene. Once all objects have been removed the crime computer will analyse the clues and explain what has happened. Scenes are often larger than the screen size and therefore it's necessary to scroll through the scene by moving the cursor to the edge. If stuck, the player can use a hint to get some help in locating an object.
title: Mystery Case Files: Agent X

description: Panzer General is a turn-based strategy game. The game is divided into three different campaigns (German, Russian or Allied). Each consists of many individual single missions set in 18 different countries in Europe and North Africa. Each single mission requires performing a specific task, such as the destruction of a particular target or reach some place. The gameplay is divided into rounds with a limited time. In each round the player can make only one shot and change the position of the tank using the available action points. Shooting is done by setting the correct position of the tank barrel. Succeeded mission unlocks additional features, including better tanks, extra equipment or special attacks (artillery, air attack, paratrooper).
title: Panzer General

description: Happy Tree Friends: Blood Money is a mobile game based on the Happy Tree Friends animated series created by Mondo Mini Shows. The gameplay consists of moving Lifty and Shifty to catapult the animals (Cuddles, Giggles and Petunia) with the trampoline into the air to hit hazards such as barbed wire, saws and knives. This makes them spill blood and the raccoons (Lifty and Shifty) collect the blood in their buckets. Only three animals can hit the ground or the game is over. New hazards are unlocked by getting high scores. The blood bank pays for each pint. There are four difficulty levels: Easy, Normal, Hard and Bloody.
title: Happy Tree Friends: Blood Money

description:
WordCrafter is a word creation game similar to Scrabble. Unlike Scrabble it's a single player game and the primary goal is not to score points but to connect the starting tile with the ending tile through a chain of words. Words are created from a random selection of seven letters that the player sees at the bottom of the screen. Once a word has been created the available letters are removed and a new selection is randomized. The player has a limited number of turns to complete each level and it costs a turn every time new letters are added, either by shuffling or by creating a word. In case the player is stuck he can use a hint that shows a possible word. Hints have a cooldown period of 30 seconds before they can be used again. The game boards have various special tiles which are activated when words are created on top of them. These include multiplier tiles that increase the score of the word. There are also exclamation and question marks that trigger a spin on a bonus wheel and tool tiles that can remove walls.

On the board are also three stars which the player can attempt to collect by including them in the chain. These are needed to unlock new worlds in the adventure mode. Each world consists of a number of levels that are unlocked by completing the previous ones. There are also Greek letter tiles that has to be collected to unlock the final world. Sometimes the player will come across challenges, for example to complete a level only with words starting on certain letters. Once these have been completed they can be played on their own outside the adventure mode. There is also a freeplay mode where there are no time and turn limits or goals. Instead the player can aim to get a high score.

sample_screenshots.caption: The longer the word the more points will it give

title: WordCrafter

description:
Meteos Astro Blocks is a version of Meteos developed especially for the mobile phone platform. This is the second game in the Meteos series, the DS title being the first. The game has been scaled down and features none of the original Meteos planets; this game uses Earth's solar system instead in a game mode called Star Quest. The gameplay is a falling block game similar to Tetris or Bejeweled, the player must form combos by colour matching to launch the blocks into space. The player is limited as can only one block can be moved at a time.

Unlike the original version of the game, it is possible to move blocks horizontally. This is done by switching pairs or by pushing them off the top of a column onto the next stack. Power-ups can be used to clear blocks on land and in the air. There are three challenges on each planet and you can choose from four different events, such as Shoot (launch a number of blocks off-screen), Timed (countdown and a required count), Puzzle (only a limited amount of moves), and Boss (fight an alien monster at the top of the screen). Next to the main story mode there is a separate puzzle and survival mode. An original mode, with the gameplay of the original Meteos where blocks cannot be moved horizontally, is unlocked after completing Star Quest.
title: Meteos Astro Blocks

description: Carmageddon is a mobile game based on the PC game with the same name. Like in the original series it is a violent racing game that's as much about doing damage to opponents' cars and running over pedestrians as it is about winning the race. The most notable difference is the use of a 2D top down perspective. There are four drivers and four cars to choose from and 36 events in three different environments (city, countryside and desert) that can be played either on their own or as part of a championship. In the championship the aim is to rise in rank by competing in various events. For each event won the player will raise his position by one. This is needed to get access to new events. Between events it's possible to upgrade the car. There are a few different kinds of events, including checkpoint racing, hold the flag and destruction arena.
title: Carmageddon

description:
X-5 is the most covert anti-terrorism force that The Government has to its disposal and when a flight with world dignitaries gets high-jacked they are the ones that gets the job. Trained by an organization known as the FifthAxis it consists of only the best soldier from around the world. The player is one member of this force and now he has been selected to go on a mission to destroy the terrorists and bring back the hostages.

Assault Force: X-5 is a an action game in the style of Commando and Ikari Warriors. It consists of four missions (each split into several levels) that the player has to run through, from the bottom to the top, and shoot down all the enemies that stand in his way. The player's primary attack is a gun with unlimited ammo but he also access to grenades and dynamite that can be thrown. Some enemies stand beside sandbags that protects them from bullets and which requires the player to use the explosives. These are in limited supply but more can be found around the levels. Other collectibles include health packs and armour for protection. Early on the player will mostly meet foot soldiers but later on he will also come across tanks, guard towers and gun truants.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game consists of four missions

title: Assault Force: X-5

description:
Micro Machines is a mobile game entry in the Micro Machines franchise (licensed through Atari who had it at the time). It's played from a top down perspective similar to the original Micro Machines game and the player chooses from ten different characters and up to twelve different circuits (depending on handset). Various pick-ups can be used in the races: speed boost, oil that makes the track slippery, and cannonballs that can be fired at the opponents.

There are four different game modes: Head to head*: The player competes against one AI driver and has to get one screen ahead to take a point from the opponent. To win the player needs to take all the points or have the most points after three laps. In the case of a tie the fastest driver will win.

  • Tournament: A series of races against three opponents. Winning the tournament leads to another tournament being unlocked.

  • Single race: A race of three laps against three opponents on a track of the player's choice.

  • Challenges: The player races against a ghost of his own best race.
title: Micro Machines

description:
Star Wars: Grievous Getaway takes place during the events of the third Star Wars episode, Revenge of the Sith. It's a vertically scrolling game where the player takes control of Obi-Wan Kenobi who atop his varactyl mount, Boga, has to chase and eliminate the cyborg General Grievous.

The general will attempt to escape on his wheel bike and the player has to move after him and strike at him with Obi-Wan's light saber until the general's health bar is emptied which causes him to run off to the next level. In his path, the player will find various obstacle to overcome, including gaps that Boga has to jump over and various enemies that has to be either avoided or killed with the light saber. It's possible to do a regular attack as well as left and right attack. There is also a force attack where Obi-Wan throws the light saber at the enemy. The light saber can also be used to reflect laser fire back at the enemies.

The game consists of five stages and once they are all completed the ability to play as Grievous is unlocked. Then the objective is to get away from Obi-Wan and avoid his light saber attacks.

sample_screenshots.caption: Throwing the light saber at Grievous

title: Star Wars: Grievous Getaway

description:
Thief: Deadly Shadows for mobile phones was divided into two episodes each containing eight missions. It follows the story line of the PC/console version but differs in that it is a side-scrolling 2D platforming game. The focus on stealth is still intact though and like in the original series Garrett's main objective of each mission is to steal specific items and a certain amount of loot. To succeed in sneaking past the guards, Garrett has to avoid bright light and hide in the shadows where he can not be seen. If spotted, civilians will alert nearby guards who will immediately draw their swords and attack. Like in previous Thief games there is a light gem in the HUD that shows how much light there is at the current location.

When getting close to a guard or civilian, Garrett can pick their pockets or attempt to knock them out with his blackjack. By doing this the player can retrieve important items and vital information, sometimes necessary to complete the mission. A knocked out body can be picked up and carried away which can be necessary since a spotted body will raise the alarm. In addition to the blackjack the player has access to some other items. There are three types of arrows; water for extinguishing torches, noise maker for distracting and broadheads for knocking targets. There are also two kinds of bombs: flash bombs that temporarily blind enemies and gas bombs that releases poisonous gas that knocks out enemies. Other items include health potions and a mechanical eye that can be used to scan further ahead into the level.

Between regular missions there are rooftop levels where Garrett has to escape from the scene of crime. These are action sequences that work similar to endless runner games where Garrett moves forward and the player has to jump at the right time to avoid falling. Once the rooftop level is completed the player will get to a shop where loot can be sold and new items can be bought.
title: Thief: Deadly Shadows - Episode 1

description:
Thief: Deadly Shadows for mobile phones was divided into two episodes each containing eight missions. It follows the story line of the PC/console version but differs in that it is a side scrolling 2D platforming game. The focus on stealth is still intact though and like in the original series Garrett's main objective of each mission is to steal specific items and a certain amount of loot. To succeed in sneaking past the guards, Garrett has to avoid bright light and hide in the shadows where he can not be seen. If spotted, civilians will alert nearby guards who will immediately draw their swords and attack. Like in previous Thief games there is a light gem in the HUD that shows how much light there is at the current location.

When getting close to a guard or civilian, Garrett can pick their pockets or attempt to knock them out with his blackjack. By doing this the player can retrieve important items and vital information, sometimes necessary to complete the mission. A knocked out body can be picked up and carried away which can be necessary since a spotted body will raise the alarm. In addition to the blackjack the player has access to some other items. There are three types of arrows; water for extinguishing torches, noise maker for distracting and broadheads for knocking targets. There are also two kinds of bombs: flash bombs that temporarily blind enemies and gas bombs that releases poisonous gas that knocks out enemies. Other items include health potions and a mechanical eye that can be used to scan further ahead into the level.

Between regular missions there are rooftop levels where Garrett has to escape from the scene of crime. These are action sequences that work similar to endless runner games where Garrett moves forward and the player has to jump at the right time to avoid falling. Once the rooftop level is completed the player will get to a shop where loot can be sold and new items can be bought.
title: Thief: Deadly Shadows - Episode 2

description: This LEGO-themed beat-'em-up is a severely downgraded version of LEGO Batman: The Mobile Game, adapted for less powerful mobile phones. It only includes approximately 1/3 of the content of the superior version. It consists of four stages in two locations where Batman fights Joker's thugs and ultimately confronts Joker. Gone entirely are driving stages, two other super-villains (Poison Ivy and Mr. Freeze), some gameplay gimmicks, and all unlockable content.
title: LEGO Batman: The Mobile Game

description: Christmas Midnight Pool is a modified version of the original Midnight Pool game. It consists the same gameplay and content (quick games, tournaments, versus and challenges) but as the title suggests it adds a Christmas theme to it. What's most noticeable are some changes in graphics, for example Christmas trees and parcels in the background, characters wearing knit hats and snow flakes falling over the title screen. The scenario and the dialogue has also been adapted. It takes place at a holiday party in a cosy mountain chalet and the participants say things like "I hope you've been good this year". Finally, there is no Lynyrd Skynyrd in this version.
title: Christmas Midnight Pool

description: Block Breaker Christmas is a Christmas themed cut down version of Block Breaker Deluxe. It contains the gameplay from the original but consists of only six levels plus an extra secret level. These levels are from the original game but have new Christmas themed graphics. The objective in each is to collect gifts and when all have been collected the secret level is unlocked. The final level is a boss level where the player has to defeat a snowman.
title: Block Breaker Christmas

description: Block Breaker Holidays is a short Christmas themed game that acts as a demo for Block Breaker Deluxe. It's very similar to Block Breaker Christmas from the previous year, but this version only consists of three levels and after that the player is told to move on to Block Breaker Deluxe. The game also has different graphics and a different premise with a snowman acting as the game's host.
title: Block Breaker Holidays

description: Christmas Crash is a Puzzle Bobble clone with a Christmas theme. The player takes control of Santa who with some assistance from his helpers has to deal with some rebel Christmas balls who are trying to boycott the Christmas celebrations. Santa obviously can't let them do this so now he has to battle them by shooting more balls at them so that clusters of three of more balls of the same colour are created. The gameplay is more or less identical to the original Puzzle Bobble. The player aims with a pointer (which here happens to be a gigantic candy cane) and shoots at the balls above him. By creating clusters of the same colour the balls are removed. Each of the game's ten level is completed by clearing all the balls. The game ends if balls reaches the bottom of the screen and is made harder by the ceiling that descends as time goes by.
title: Christmas Crash

description: RoboCop for mobile phones is a platform shooter not unlike the original arcade game or the various home versions from Ocean. The player takes control of the titular half man/half machine and has to rid the streets of Detroit from the various criminals that roam about while protecting it's innocent civilians. RoboCop can walk left and right, jump over smaller obstacles and use elevators to move between platforms. When starting out a simple pistol with unlimited ammo is used but other weapons like machine guns and shotguns can be collected. The game features three different stages: the streets of Detroit, an abandoned steel mills and the police headquarters. The objective in each is to rescue a number of hostages and to do so numerous bad guys has to be shot down although sometimes they give up and can be arrested. The game is over when RoboCop's health meter reaches zero but health can be recharged by picking up food that is given by rescued hostages.
title: RoboCop

description: In Shark Attack the player takes control of a diver who has to search for treasure in shark infested waters. The game is viewed from the side and the player can swim in all directions and use a harpoon to shoot down any shark that gets too close. The objective of each level is to reach a treasure chest and to collect as many coins as possible on the way. At the same time it's necessary to avoid two kinds of dangers: sharks and spiky sea urchins. Any contact with these leads to a life being lost. Points are earned for killing sharks (100 each) and collecting coins (10 each). An extra life is given for every 100 coins collected.
title: Shark Attack

description: Nightclub Empire is a management simulation where you need to build and manage an empire of nightclubs. The player starts small and then gradually work his way up into bigger, more glamorous clubs. Duties include recruiting staff such as bouncers to keep order, DJs and dancers to attract guests. Flyers and TV advertising also brings customers in, as does a theme party. Events can disrupt the operations and need to be handled by the player. Equipment blowing up, abusive customers and DJs quitting are all obstacles, but can be fixed by spending money.
title: Nightclub Empire

description: Metal Command is an action shooting game. It is set in the year 2427, at a time where renegade forces have left the Earth confederation and are fighting amongst themselves throughout the galaxy. Jack Smith, a commando with the Earth Marines, is sent on a solo mission to Xelos IV to clear the site of the high-tech NX Facility to eliminate all enemies and then return alive. He has to run and shoot his way through the facility, while minding his health meter. Items and weapons can be gained by searching through cargo boxes.
title: Metal Commando

description: The mobile version of BIONICLE Heroes is much simpler than versions for other consoles. The player plays as a character who can change shape. Initially, the character is in the shape of Hahli, but collecting masks of Jaller, Hewkii, and Matoro allows the player to transform into them. The enemies in this game are Rahi that resemble Ussal crabs. The player travels through various areas through means of teleportation, collecting various items and power-ups, and defeating enemies. Teleportation pads are activated by using points earned.
title: Bionicle Heroes

description: LEGO BIONICLE Challenge is a mobile racing game based on LEGO's BIONICLE franchise. There are three difficulty levels (easy, medium, or hard) and two modes: a tournament or a single race. The player controls one of three characters: Toa Metru Matau, Rahaga Kualus, or Toa Inika Nuparu. Each character has different stats, including weapon, fuel, and armor. The player races against the other two on one of 15 tracks. Various power ups are found in the form of Zamor Spheres. Using these on opponents has a different effect depending on color. Yellow drains an opponent's fuel, red damages opponents, and blue slows opponents down. Scenery can be crashed into, so racers must steer clear of obstacles. Running out of fuel causes a racer to crash. Opponents can also be attacked, destroying them or slowing them down. Getting first place awards 1200 points, second place 800 points, third place 400 points, and destroying an opponent gets 300 points.
title: LEGO Bionicle Challenge

description:
BIONICLE Defenders is a mobile tower defense game based on the 2007 LEGO BIONICLE story and characters. It takes place in the underwater Pit, where the player controls the Toa Mahri in an attempt to keep the Barraki (known in this game as "creeps") from reaching the Mask of Life. The player must set up base towers, each with abilities. The goal is to destroy all the creeps before they reach the tower, for if even one reaches it, the player loses. Special tiles, called zones, are placed around the tower, each having a different effect on the creeps. The Toa Mahri also fight the creeps, each having their own attacks and acting as more powerful versions of towers. On the other side, there are five different types of creeps, each with different traits.

There are two modes: Campaign Mode and Survival Mode. In campaign mode, there are 16 levels, each getting progressively harder. The player starts out as Matoro, but more playable characters can be unlocked. In Survival Mode, the creeps never stop coming, and the game lasts until the player fails.
title: Bionicle Defenders

description:
Mortadelo y Filemón: Armafollón is a side-scrolling action platformer based on the Spanish comic series Mortadelo y Filemón, known as Mort & Phil in English. The game features all the characters from the comic, and the player can control either Mortadelo or Filemón depending on the level. Each character has different abilities. For instance, by using different disguises, Mortadelo can transform into different characters, like a rocker who smashes enemies with his guitar, a caveman with a club as weapon, a granny, a snake, a tank and more. Filemón in the other hand, can use different weapons, as a plunger gun, a heat gun, etc.

The levels are varied with indoor and outdoor locations. In some levels the characters have to use different vehicles, like a jet ski or a car. There is one level inside a sinking ship, where the water is rising and the player has to hurry up to stay above the water level to avoid drowning, while fighting enemies and avoiding obstacles at the same time. The water effect was very advanced considering the platform limitations, with simulated refraction and wave effects which deformed the part of the level under water.

The player advances from level to level defeating different bosses and advances through the story, which resembles the funny and bizarre situations from the comics.
title: Mortadelo y Filemón: Armafollón

description:
Sumea Ski Jump is a ski jumping game viewed from an isometric perspective. All action in the game is controlled with a single button which can be any of the phone's number keys. When starting out the player has ten seconds to begin and should attempt to the hit the button when the wind indicator shows green. To take off the player then has to hit it again when the jumper is as close to the edge as possible. Once in the air the button should be pressed to stop the jumper in an optimal leaning position (as close to horizontal as possible). When it is time to land the player can either hold the button for a telemark landing (which gives more style points) or a quick press for a normal landing (which gives more distance). The score given depends on the jump distance and the number of stars given in the jump (depending on how well each action has been done).

The game consists of six hills from real life ski jumping locations: Lahti, Oberstdorf, Garmisch-Partenkirchen, Innsbruck, Bischofshofen and Planica. Each hill is unlocked by winning the previous one in a competition against three AI jumpers. There is also a multiplayer mode where four players share the same device.

sample_screenshots.caption: The take off at the right time
You get a star rating for every action

title: Sumea Ski Jump

description:
California Games X is a mobile game based on Epyx' series of extreme sports games. The game consists of seven events that can be played on their own or as part of a tournament mode. The tournament mode involves competing against AI opponents and can be played in three different difficulties. There is also a practice mode for training. The available events are:

  • Surfing
  • Free Climbing
  • BMX
  • Breakdancing
  • Skysurfing
  • Skateboarding
  • In-Line Skating (has to be unlocked)

All game events are built around quick time events where a key or combination of keys on the numpad has to be pressed when the corresponding arrows appear or are highlighted on the screen. The gameplay thereby is similar to a rhythm game except with no music.
title: California Games X

description:
Frogger Evolution is a mobile game made for the 25th anniversary of Konami's arcade game Frogger. The game consists of two modes. The first four stages are classic mode while stages five to twelve are the evolution mode. The classic mode is essentially the same as the original game with the player having to guide five frogs over a road and a river in an attempt to reach their home at the top of the playing field. Some differences exist in terms of of level designs and obstacles that the frog has to jump past. For example in the second level the road section has both cars and crawling snakes while in another one the player will come across dinosaurs and spike pits.

The evolution mode is entirely different and is more similar to a puzzle game. Here the aim is to collect all the coins on each level and to reach the exit. Additional abilities are available to Frogger such as double jumping and extending his tongue.

sample_screenshots.caption: Getting run over at the highway

title: Frogger Evolution

description:
The JAVA title Asphalt: Nitro is vastly simplified 2D version of the 3D Android game Asphalt: Nitro. In countries such as China, Japan, Russia and USA players race other cars to reach the finish line first. Next to quick races in the free play mode, there is a career mode divided into seven seasons with multiple events for each one, unlocked gradually. Up to five stars can be earned per event, required to keep unlocking new tracks and seasons.

Just like the main game the focus is on gathering nitro boost to gain extra speed and stay ahead of the other racers. Nitro is earned through a drifting mechanic, taking down other cars, risky driving and perfect runs, and jumps with stunts in the air such as barrel rolls or using obstacles to drive on two wheels. There are also blue and yellow bottles on the track that can be picked up for additional nitro. Nitro fills a horizontal meter near the top of the screen. It can be activated up to three times to access additional power levels, but draining faster. Doing stunts, beating speed limits and taking down cars fills up to six letters of a wanted level. When full, a police car starts to chase the car and it is possible to be busted. Police cars also put vehicles on the road that cause the car to crash upon collision. Tracks have regular traffic as well.

The cash earned in races can be used to buy or upgrade cars. Cars can be upgraded for acceleration, top speed, handling and nitro, multiple times. It is also possible to choose between different car colours. Compared to the Android version it does not have the many different game modes or multiplayer, the locations are fewer and there is also a smaller collection of cars. The included licensed cars are the Bugatti Veyron 16.4 Grand Sport, Chevrolet Corvette C7, Dodge Challenger SRT8, Ferrari LaFerrari, Ford Shelby GT500, Lamborghini Veneno, McLaren P1, Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution X, Nissan 370Z and RUF CTR 3.

sample_screenshots.caption: Events for the first season in the career mode
The countdown before starting a race.

title: Asphalt: Nitro

description:
Lumines: In The House Ibiza '10 is an entry in the Lumines series of rhythm puzzle games that's exclusively made for mobile devices. It features tracks licensed from British house music record company Defected. Like its predecessors it is a falling block puzzle game where two-coloured 2x2 squares are dropped onto the playing field and the player has to arrange them by moving and rotating them so that clusters of four or more same-coloured squares are created. They will then be removed as a time line crosses the screen.

This version has four game modes. In the challenge mode the player unlocks skins and music by clearing each stage. Skins that are unlocked will then be available in the skin edit and time attack modes. In the skin edit mode it's possible to play through skins in any order by creating playlists. The time attack modes involve clearing as many squares as possible within a certain time and there are four different time limits to choose from: 60, 180, 300 or 600 seconds. The final mode is the dig down mode where the player has to clear at least two columns and allow the time line to reach the far right to progress.

Track list:

  • Aston Martinez - Seduction (Climax Dub)
  • Karizma – Ride
  • Fish Go Deep - The Cure & The Cause
  • Albin Myers - BOOM!!!
  • DJ Tekin - Wait Forever (Doruk’s D Floor Mix)
  • Gene Farris - Sanctified Love (Original Mix)
  • ATFC - Savannah
  • Gel Abril - Spells Of Yoruba (Original Mix)
  • Sandy Rivera - Changes (rnb mix)
  • Havana Funk - Bakiri Ban (Club Mix)
title: Lumines: In The House Ibiza '10

description:
Lara Croft: Tomb Raider - Legend: Tokyo is a mobile game version of Lara Craft: Tomb Raider - Legend. As the title implies the game takes place in Tokyo which was the third location of the original game. Lara's quest is to find Excalibur, King Arthur's famous sword which has been shattered into three pieces. The first shard is believed to be in the possession of a Japanese relic collector named Takamoto so Lara goes to Tokyo in an attempt to get the shard. The problem however is that Takamoto is a boss of the Yakuza who likely won't give it away freely.

The game is a side-scrolling platformer with polygonal 3D graphics. Most of the gameplay involves running left and right, jumping between platforms and shooting the various Yakuza members that stand in Lara's way. Obstacles such as electric cables and laser defense systems have to be avoided either by jumping over or rolling under. Sometimes Lara has to swing around poles or use her grappling hook to reach far off platforms. The grappling hook can also be used to swing into and knock out enemies. The gunfights are quite simple and only Lara's regular handgun can be used. Bullets can be dodged by crouching but the enemies can do the same.
title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider - Legend: Tokyo

description: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider - Anniversary for mobile phones differs from the PC/console version in that it is not directly based on the original 1997 Tomb Raider game. Instead it is made out of content from an earlier trilogy of mobile Tomb Raider games: The Osiris Codex, Quest for Cinnabar and Elixir of Life. Essentially the game is a selection of levels from those games that have been rearranged within an overarching storyline based on the 1997 game. Some graphical changes has been made but level design and game mechanics are the same.

sample_screenshots.caption: ? means you can interact with the environment

title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider - Anniversary

description:
Tomb Raider: Underworld is one of two mobile games that are based on the PC/console game with the same name. Both games feature the same plot. It starts in Baldr's tomb where Lara's task is to find Thor's helve. The player has to explore the tomb and find a key to the crypt. By following the trail of Thor's artifacts Lara hopes to be able to get to Avalon where she thinks her mother might be.

This version of the game is a side-scrolling 2D platformer. Lara runs left and right, jumps between platforms and hangs onto ledges that she too can jump between. When enemies appear she can draw her guns and attack them. In addition there are other hazards and obstacles that has to be avoided. This include falling rocks, pales sticking up from the ground and rotating knifes attached to walls. Various objects can be collected and these can then be accessed from the inventory.
title: Tomb Raider: Underworld

description: Age of Empires II Deluxe Mobile is a separately sold enhanced version of Age of Empires II Mobile. It includes two new races (Persian and Japanese) and a 'quick play' mode. The game does contain three campaigns each including about seven missions.
title: Age of Empires II Deluxe Mobile

description: This is a mobile release in the long running Bomberman series and contains two variants of the original concept: Bomberman Classic and Bomberman Supreme. The Classic version is a conversion of the 1985 NES game while the Supreme version has all new graphics and additional gameplay elements such as boss levels. Supreme can be played in either novice or pro mode. In the novice mode items are automatically used when collected while in the pro mode the player has to choose items from an inventory. Multiplayer is being offered through a two player mode that can be played over Bluetooth. There is a also a versus mode where the player competes against three AI opponent.
title: Bomberman

description:
Happy Tree Friends: Flippy's Flying Frenzy is a mobile and a side-scrolling game based on the Happy Tree Friends animated series created by Mondo Mini Shows.

The gameplay consists to choose to play as the evil Flippy so becomes crazy due to the balloons pops and flippy ties his victims to his helicopter and you can choose these victims such as Cuddles, Giggles and Toothy, the helicopter moves automatically and you must press 5 key to elevate the helicopter, to win points you need make the animal victims hit obstacles such as stones, knives, wood pits and more, some obstacles are unlocked when you pass the level and you win 2 extra lives by level.
title: Happy Tree Friends: Flippy's Flying Frenzy

description:
Cristiano Ronaldo Underworld Football is a football game with an unusual premise. The sport is being threatened as The Underworld and it's demons, spirits and other ghostly creatures is attempting to take the game away from the humans. Now it's time for Cristiano Ronaldo to bring back the game. He has been chosen as the leader of a team of humans who has to enter the Underworld Tournament and defeat four teams of supernatural beings: skeletons, green skinned creatures, ice trolls and succubae demons.

The game consists of single quick matches and a cup. The cup involves playing each underworld team in order and as matches are won the teams are unlocked in the quick match mode. The matches are viewed from an elevated scrolling side perspective and there are five players on each side. The main difference from other football games is that super powers can be used. Each opponent has its own super power and the player acquires them by winning the matches. During matches the powers can be used once the player's power bar is fully charged.
title: Cristiano Ronaldo Underworld Football

description:
King of the Cabbage World is a mobile game made for multiplayer matches between two players. Each player controls a mole who attempts to kill the other mole by throwing exploding vegetables. The game is played from a side view perspective and the lower part of the screen consists of a network of tunnels that the mole can use to hide. The upper part of the screen is above ground and shows the opposing mole in the distance. There are three standard weapons: carrots, onions and cauliflowers, each exploding in different ways. The vegetables grow on the surface and can be dug up by the mole.

In addition to the multiplayer game which is played online there is also a practice mode for one player. By winning matches in the online mode credits are earned which can be used to buy more weapons. A match is won when the opponent is caught in an explosion.

sample_screenshots.caption: An onion explodes at the opponent's end

title: King of the Cabbage World

description:
Pro Golf 2007 feat. Vijay Singh is the second game in Gameloft's Pro Golf series (after Vijay Singh Pro Golf 2005). This version has largely the same gameplay and uses a powerbar to take shots. A button press starts the meter moving with the second press deciding the power and the third the accuracy of the shot. New to this game is the option to add spin which can be done while the ball is in the air. Another new feature is to get a tip from the caddie on how to putt.

The game contains a quick play mode, a career mode and custom games. The career mode involve competing in tournaments to earn cash. The money earned can then be spent on training lessons to improve skills or on new equipment such as clubs and balls. Custom games can be played against an AI opponent or against another human in hotseat multiplayer. It is possible to play a full course or just specific holes. There are three courses but only one is available from the start while the rest have to be unlocked. Also different game modes can be unlocked in addition to match play.
title: Pro Golf 2007 feat. Vijay Singh

description:
Vijay Singh Pro Golf 2005 is the first game in the Pro Golf series. The game uses a third person perspective that changes to a top down view when the ball is in the air. Similar to many other golf games it uses a power bar to take shots. A button press starts the meter moving with the second press deciding the power and the third the accuracy of the shot. On the green the same bar is used for putting.

The game includes two game modes as well as a quick play option. There is a tournament, the Gameloft Trophy, where the player has to beat 29 other golfers to win and there is a versus mode which includes stroke play and match play. Before starting a game it's possible to choose between a number of golfers with different abilities as well as the difficulty level. The easiest level uses a simplified shot mechanic where only the power has to be set.
title: Vijay Singh Pro Golf 2005

description: Pro Golf 2007 3D feat. Vijay Singh is a remake of the original Pro Golf 2007 feat. Vijay Singh that instead of the sprite based graphics of the original uses a fully three dimensional engine. The gameplay works mostly the same though with a power bar being used to take shots. A button press starts the meter moving with the second press deciding the power and the third the accuracy of the shot. Once the ball is in the air, which is here shown from multiple perspectives, it is possible to affect its movement by applying spin. Like in the 2D game, there is a quick play mode, a career mode and custom games (here called free play).

sample_screenshots.caption: He hits the ball at least...
Applying spin while in the air

title: Pro Golf 2007 3D feat. Vijay Singh

description:
Pro Golf: World Tour 2010 is the third main game in Gameloft's Pro Golf series. This entry plays mostly the same as previous editions. It's viewed from behind when taking shots but changes to a top down view when showing the flight path of the ball. A power bar is used to swing with one button press deciding the power of the shot and a second the accuracy. Once the ball is in the air it is possible to add spin to it.

There are three different courses in the game: England, Fiji and USA. The game contains a career mode as well as a free hole mode where any course can be played and an instant play mode where three random holes from different courses are played. It's possible to choose from five real life golfers (Garcia, Singh, Villegas, Furyk and Rose) and each has different ratings. In the career mode, England is available from the start while Fiji and USA are unlockables. For each course there are a number of challenges which the player earns money for completing. The money earned can then be used to upgrade the abilities of the golfer.
title: Pro Golf: World Tour 2010

description: The Open Championship is the officially licensed game of the annual golf competition (commonly known as the British Open). In terms of gameplay and features, the game is identical to Pro Golf: World Tour 2010. The main difference is the golfing locations available which are all new: Italy, Dubai and The Open (Turnberry, Scotland). In the career mode only Italy is available from the start with the other having to be unlocked in order. Another difference is that the licensed golfers from the previous game have been replaced with fictitious ones.
title: The Open Championship

description:
Battle for the White House is a mobile game that parodizes the American presidential election of 2008. The player can take control of one of six candidates, three for each party, and run to become president. The candidates are all caricatures of real American politicians: Barack Obama, Rudy Giuliani, Hillary Clinton, John Edwards, Mitt Romney and Fred Thompson. It's possible to do a complete tour with both primary and presidential elections or to just do the presidential tour. The game is played on a map of the United States divided into six regions. The player starts in north east and has to reach a vote target in each one.

To win votes the player plays a number of mini games. For each location four games are played and the performance decides the number of votes. Among the mini games are a Breakout variant where the candidate has to knock out a number of activists that are blocking the path to a limousine, a parade consisting of quick time events, a rhythm music game with the candidate dancing and a Pac-Man variant where the candidate has to collect ballots from the white house's garden while avoiding guards

sample_screenshots.caption: A group of activists blocks the path to the limo
Eating power pills to become a donkey

title: Battle for the White House

description: Lotus Challenge: City Racing is a mobile racing game based on the console game Lotus Challenge. The game is played from a third person behind view and there are three different Lotus cars to race with: Elise (mk I), Elan and Elise 111S (mk III). There are ten tracks to race on in three different locations: New York, Paris and Tokyo. When starting on only the Elise and two tracks (one in New York and one in Paris) are available. By winning races (which are always played against three AI drivers) new tracks and cars are unlocked.
title: Lotus Challenge: City Racing

description: Penalty Challenge is a mobile football game that is exclusively about penalty shootouts. It works like in the real game with each player shooting five shots and if it's a tie after that they get to shoot one more until a winner is decided. The game can be played against AI opponents or another human player. In the single player mode the player automatically progresses to a new AI opponent after a win until reaching the fifth and final one. Shot taking is menu based with the player having to press three buttons: first to decide height, then aim and finally curl. The goalkeeper is controlled by simply pressing the right directional key as a shot is taken. In a two player game, the first player takes a shot and then hands over the phone to the opponent who attempts a save.
title: Penalty Challenge

description:
Sensible Soccer brings the computer classic to mobile phones. The gameplay continues the series' tradition: fast-paced soccer matches from the top-down perspective. Besides a dedicated button for passing, shots are produced by kicking the ball in the air and then pressing the correct buttons for directions (similar to moving a joystick in a direction). Additional moves available are slide tackles and diving headers. When not in ball possession, the nearest athlete is selected automatically.

The game modes also follow the example of the originals: there are friendlies, cup and challenges. The latter two can be customized to a point, including which of the 50 national teams (no original names) participate. Additionally there is a challenge mode which sets the player in pre-set match conditions.

Cell phones with higher technical specifications receive a few additional features: besides an intro video and replays, they have some limited tactical options: nine formations and substitutions during a match.
title: Sensible Soccer

description: This game is similar, but has many differences to its computer counterpart. Unlike the PC version, this game is its own game and not an expansion pack. The game starts with a campaign game, which is 10 levels long. You must manage a successful aquapark while meeting certain requirements to go on to the next level. Unlike the original game, the animals are mostly aquatic, such as dolphins and killer whales. You can also take pictures of the aquatic animals doing tricks and save them. Once you finish the campaign mode, you get Freeplay Mode, where you can build as you wish. You can also look at awards and achievements you've unlocked in the game's Gallery.

sample_screenshots.caption: A guest is happy because there are trash cans to throw away his hot dog wrapper.
Taking photos of a killer whale jumping through a hoop.

title: Zoo Tycoon 2: Marine Mania Mobile

description:
Puzzle Bobble for mobile phones is a simple version of the classic puzzle game. It does not feature the puzzle or versus modes that are a mainstay of the series, but only an endless mode.

Gameplay follows the standard model: the player controls a cannon at the bottom of the play field that shoots randomly colored bubbles. When three or more bubbles of the same color touch, they are removed from the field. After several shots (in a deviation from the norm, this version of the game is not in real time), new bubbles are added from the top, pushing the already existing bubbles downward. The game ends once the bubbles reach the bottom. Removing bubbles increases the game level. The game starts with bubbles of three colors on the field; later levels add more colors, increasing the difficulty.
title: Puzzle Bobble

description:
Worms Crazy Golf is a mobile game spin off in the Worms series. It's like the main series played from a side view perspective but is based on the sport of golf with the difference that a grenade is used instead of a ball. The aim of each hole is to reach the flag in shortest amount of shots with the aim of blowing up the enemy worm that is sitting in the hole. The controls simply involve moving a cross hair to set the aim and then pressing the fire button to start a swing meter that sets the power of the shot. In addition to the regular grenade, there is also a timer grenade which explodes after five seconds. If it lands in the hole the player gets a one shot bonus and if it doesn't a one shot penalty.

The game contains an amateur mode and a pro mode with the difference that the latter has wind that affects the flight of the grenade. There are three courses with different themes and each course consists of nine holes. One course is available from the start and the other two are unlocked by completing the previous ones with a par or better score. The game can be played by up to four players on the same device.

sample_screenshots.caption: Getting ready for the first hole

title: Worms Crazy Golf

alternate_titles.title: Duke Nukem Mobile II: Bikini Project

description:
Duke Nukem Mobile: Bikini Project is a side-scrolling shoot-em-up with multi-plane movement. It is the sequel to Duke Nukem Mobile, and features new locations, weapons and power-ups, such as Duke's jetpack. The game continues directly from where Duke Nukem Mobile left off, Duke is still trapped on the falling Zeppelin and he must find his way out.

Bikini Project plays similar to its prequel; Duke can roam the levels moving freely either left or right, killing enemies as they are spawning in. Enemies drop items such as health pickups and weapons such as the Shotgun, the RPG or the Flamethrower.

After clearing out enough enemies in a level, one of them drops a Keycard, which lets Duke proceed to the next level through an exit. Levels are interleaved with animated cutscenes with subtitles describing the storyline.
title: Duke Nukem Mobile: Bikini Project

description: Xenosaga: Pied Piper is a side game in the Xenosaga series that takes place 100 years prior to the start of the first game. The game focuses on the backstories of various characters in the series, notably Ziggy and Voyager. Told in three chapters, the plot revolves around Ziggy, at the time known as Jan Sauer, as his investigation unit works to stop a serial killer. Battles use a similar system as the one found in Xenosaga Episode I.
title: Xenosaga: Pied Piper

description:
Knight Tales: Land Of Bitterness is an Action RPG developed for mobile phones. In this game, players take control of Gust, a valorous knight, who returned home from the war that began after the downfall of the Gods. Gust finds out that his love interest has destroyed his hometown and all the people in it and, after saving a fairy from a nasty toad, decides to confront Clara to find out the truth.

Gust attacks enemies using his sword and can upgrade his attack power and defense in a store area not far from the destroyed town. Players may also buy elixirs which will automatically restore Gust's health once it drops to zero. The game has numerous bosses for Gust to fight and Gust's fairy Vivi will allow him to use magic attacks, as well as push boulders in his way.

There are 3 types of magic attacks in the game: Fire, Ice and Vampire. Each attack can destroy boulders of the opposite colors, as well as harm or restore the health of the enemies it is used on. Finding fairies of the corresponding color will increase the power of the magic attacks.

sample_screenshots.caption: Not if I can help it!
It's surprising to find a shop in the ruined city.

title: Knight Tales: Land Of Bitterness

description:
Gorillaz Entertainment System is a mobile game based on the virtual band Gorillaz. It is made up of four mini games, each one featuring one of the members of the band:

  • Muds is a Breakout variant where the player moves Murdoc across the screen and has to bounce a ball using his jock strap to destroy bricks. Once all bricks have been destroyed the game moves on to the next level.
  • Noodle has to block different objects that fly towards him from the side of the screen. The objects appear at different heights and Noodle has to use hands and feet to do low, middle and high blocks.
  • Russel has to eat cookies as fast as possible. The cookies appear in the four corners of the screen and by pressing the corresponding key Russel will grab the cookie and eat it.
  • 2D has to punch a bag so that it flies as far as possible. Power is gathered for the punch by pressing a key when a indicator moves over a square. Once the bag is in the air the same method is used to make the bag bounce further.
title: Gorillaz Entertainment System

description:
Time Crisis: Elite is a mobile entry in the Time Crisis series. It is a shoot 'em up game on rails but the gameplay is much different from the light gun games in the main series. The game uses side scrolling isometric graphics where the screen is divided into a 3x3 grid. Each grid area corresponds to a number on the keypad and by pressing one of the numbers the enemies occupying that area of the screen will get fired at. For example pressing 1 fires at the top left corner. After clearing all enemies from the screen the game scrolls to the next area of the map. By shooting several enemies in short amount of time, combo bonuses are given. As ammo runs out the player has to take cover and reload. Some enemies use crisis flash shots which will always hit unless the player ducks into cover in time. Taking a hit or running out of time leads to one life being lost and the game ends when all have been lost.

The game contains two different game modes. The arcade mode is the story mode where the player takes control of Nate Rush, a rookie special agent who along with his new partner has to complete a very important mission and dispose all his enemies. There is also a survival mode where the player has to hold out against endless hordes of enemies.
title: Time Crisis: Elite

description:
Time Crisis: Mobile is an entry in the Time Crisis rail shooter series. This title for mobile devices is an alternate version and spin-off of the main Time Crisis 3 game. The player controls the elite cop Richard Miller, a special agent from the intelligence agency VSSE (Vital Situation, Swift Elimination). His objective is to liberate a compound of enemy targets within a time limit. True to the original games the movement and camera angles are all handled by the computer in a cinematic style with quick movement, the player only needs to shoot. This is done using different control schemes. In the first an on-screen cursor needs to maneuvered between targets. When it is close enough, it locks on automatically. Another option has the screen divided in nine squares where the device keys are used to quickly press them to shoot in the corresponding square. Touch to aim directly is also supported on some devices.

The player quickly needs to alternate between a cover position and coming out to shoot. Using cover is the only way to reload the gun. That position always makes the character invincible, but it is necessary to dispose of enemies quickly as when the timer runs out, the character starts taking damage. Shooting is disabled while reloading. Enemy shots are either marked yellow or red. Yellow ones are misses and can be ignored, while red ones do damage if they are not avoided through seeking cover. Many enemies take multiple hits and life bars are shown.

Next to the main Story mode five Crisis Missions can be unlocked by reaching certain targets in the Story mode. In the options the difficulty level and the number of lives can be adjusted.

sample_screenshots.caption: Red means the bullet will damage you.
The button near the bottom is used to switch between positions.
You need to wait during certain sections before you can shoot.
The tank is the boss of the first level.

title: Time Crisis: Mobile

description: Super Yum Yum is a puzzle game where the player controls a chameleon called Leon. The aim of the game is to eat fruit but Leon can only eat fruit that is of the same colour as his skin. Leon is moved around the screen from a top down perspective and uses his tongue to catch the fruit. As one is eaten, Leon's skin changes to the leaf colour of that fruit. By using the tongue, Leon can drag himself across gaps as he eats a fruit. To complete a level Leon has to reach an exit which is possible also when not all fruits are eaten. However to unlock new worlds a certain number of fruits in total have to be eaten. The game contains four worlds each with nine levels. The levels can be played in any order.

sample_screenshots.caption: Using tongue to move over gap
Levels can be completed even if all fruits aren't eaten

title: Super Yum Yum

description:
Super Yum Yum 2 is the second game featuring the fruit eating chameleon Leon. This time Leon has to rescue his babies which have been scattered around the world by a giant fish called Tum Tum. The gameplay works the same with Leon having to eat the fruit of each level by using his long tongue. For each fruit eaten Leon's colour changes to the one of the fruit's leaves. It's only possible to eat fruits that are of the same colour as Leon's skin. When eating fruit it is also possible to use the tongue to drag Leon across gaps.

What's new in this game is that Leon also has to collect his babies. Rescued babies are needed to eat giant fruits. There is also a mini game where the objective is to kick the babies into a giant fruit and then eat the fruit from inside. The more babies that are collected the easier the mini game will get.

sample_screenshots.caption: Start of baby rescue mini game
And then it has to be eaten from within
Here's Tum Tum and the giant fruit

title: Super Yum Yum 2

description:
Bomb Hunter is a Minesweeper variant and like in other games of its kind the objective is to clear a map of bombs as quick as possible. This is done when all empty tiles are revealed with just those containing bombs remaining. The game is played by moving a cursor around and pressing the dig button to reveal if a tile is safe. If there are any neighbouring bombs, the number of them will be shown. Flags can be placed as an aid and the player also has access to a limited amount of probes which can be used to reveal areas of safe tiles.

The game can be played in three difficulty modes with different map sizes and number of mines. There is also a custom mode where the player can set the width and height of the map as well as the number of mines and the supply of probes.
title: Bomb Hunter

description: Rex the Runt: Lost Marbles is a puzzle game based on Aardman Animations' clay animated TV show Rex the Runt. Rex, Wendy and Big Bad Bob enters Vince's body with a shrunken submarine and have to collect all the marbles to cure his random Pavarotti Disease. In each level there are a number of marbles that need to be collected before escaping through an exit. The gameplay involves walking across floor tiles which are only safe when the player carries a marble of a colour that matches the colour of the floor tile. It is only possible to carry two marbles at a time which means that the marbles have to be collected in the correct order.

sample_screenshots.caption: Picking up marbles changes the floor tiles

title: Rex the Runt: Lost Marbles

description:
Jimmy White Snooker Legend is a mobile snooker game played from a top down perspective. The game contains a campaign, a free play mode and challenges. The game is made up of five locations and in each two opponents have to be defeated to unlock the next. Before matches bets are placed and the money won can be spent on new cues that improve the shot accuracy.
