The Force also comes into play with Force points. These surround the game board and are activated by throwing a token at them. Once three adjacent ones are activated, a Force wall forms. When another token is thrown against this wall, the player character's Force power is activated. The power is different for each character and either removes all tokens of a certain type in the area covered by the wall or changes their color or type. In addition, each character has a unique special skill that changes the rules in their favor.

Besides a tutorial, the game consists of Campaign and Arcade modes. Campaign consists of a series of missions for each character (both challenges and battles) selected on a planet map. The campaign culminates in a battle against the player character's destined enemy. At the start, players can choose between Ahsoka Tano and Asajj Ventress. Further characters are unlocked by completing a campaign.

Arcade modes allows single challenges, series of battles either in Arena or Survival mode (in the latter, health isn't restored after a battle) or a single battle against a chosen charater in Versus mode
title: Star Wars: Jedi Mind Tricks
Call of Duty: World at War
Call of Duty: Modern Warfare - Force Recon

description:
The Lord of the Rings Trilogy is a side-scrolling action game based on the film series.

Players control Aragorn through six levels, based on locations seen in major action scenes from the films: the Mines of Moria, Helm's Deep, and Minas Tirith. The goal in each level is to reach the exit. To get there, Aragorn must defeat orcs, navigate ladders and jump gaps, evade falling rocks and find levers to open doors. He can also smash barrels that may reveal red or green potions. Red potions restore his health while green ones add charges to his "elf cloak" power which he can use to turn temporarily invisible. Mid-level checkpoints allow continuing after the loss of a life.
title: The Lord of the Rings Trilogy
The Lord of the Rings Pinball

description:
Black Ops Mobile is the fourth Call of Duty game from Glu Mobile. Like its predecessors, it is a top-down 2D scrolling tie-in to a major series entry. It is however completely unrelated to Black Ops story-wise, sharing only its 1960s setting.

The game is set in 1967 in Vietnam. The player primarily controls Sgt. Bennett, a member of the classified MACV-SOG unit, deployed on a mission to disrupt North Vietnamese supply lines. The game consists of 15 missions, some of which allow the player to control different characters. Assignments include patrols, attacks on enemy bases, or defending a position from an attack wave. The player's rifle automatically aims at enemies and requires only the fire button to be pressed. The player can also throw grenades, which are also automatically aimed after selecting them. Grenades are limited and must be restocked by collecting ammo boxes. Sand bags and other barriers can be used to take cover by moving in close to them. Like in the main entries in the series, health regenerates automatically after a while.
title: Call of Duty: Black Ops Mobile

description: Ferrari Experience is a racing game where the player drive a Formula 1 car from the Ferrari team. It has two levels of difficulty: easy and difficult. A three-lap race is run against time and seven opponents. You have to go through the checkpoints before the time runs out and at the same time pass the opponents.
title: Ferrari Experience

description:
Robo is a puzzle game where the player takes control of a robot, Robo, whose goal is to escape from a secret military base.

Each level is filled with laser cannons that emit laser beams that Robo must avoid to reach the exit. There are 3 types of items on the maps that Robo can use to clear his way: mirrors to redirect the beams, stones to block the beams, and bombs to destroy the canons. The game has 25 levels in total.
title: Robo

description:
Robo 2: Saving Eny is a puzzle game in the Robo series and the sequel to the original Robo. The player takes control of a robot, Robo, whose goal is to save his friend Eny from the underground government bunker.

The gameplay remains largely the same: the main character must clear levels from laser beams by redirecting them with mirrors, blocking them with stones, and destroying the laser emitters with bombs. The most notable additions are the improved graphics and the custom map editor.
title: Robo 2: Saving Eny

description:
Army Men: Mobile Ops is an action game in the Army Men series. The player takes on the role of a commander of a small regiment of toy soldiers of the "Green Army" in the war against "The Tans".

There are seven different classes of soldiers, with three units available for each mission. The player controls one soldier directly while other soldiers in the squad are not on the battlefield, but it is possible to switch between 3 selected soldiers anytime to solve different tasks. The seven soldiers are the rifleman, bazookaman, grenadier, mortarman, radioman, sniper, and the minesweeper.
title: Army Men: Mobile Ops

description:
Bublex Mania is a puzzle game based on the Bust-A-Move / Puzzle Bobble concept. The game takes place in an underwater setting.

There are two modes in the game which are Arcade and Tournament. In the Arcade mode, the game is infinite and new bubbles are always spawned at the top of the screen. In the Tournament mode, the players have to clear the screen from bubbles.

sample_screenshots.caption: A fish drops new bubbles on the payfield

title: Bublex Mania

description: Ball Rush is a Breakout variant game. It has 25 levels with 9 different block types. Some levels have teleports that can send your ball to another part of the playfield.
title: Ball Rush

description:
Mummy and The Beauty is an action-puzzle game. The player takes on the role of Jane, who is lost in an Egyptian pyramid.

The game's main goal is to escape each level by opening the doors and using the correct keys in the correct order.
title: Mummy and The Beauty

description:
Kamikaze Quest: The God's Wind is a role-playing game set in Feudal Japan. The main character starts as a peasant and, as the game progresses, rises through the social class ranks and becomes a Samurai.

The game has over 10 different locations, 7 types of weapon and 4 character classes.
title: Kamikaze Quest: The God's Wind

description:
Zuba is a puzzle game in which the player must place two patterned balls next to each other to clear them. Four columns of patterned balls are descending from the top of the screen. The player controls a ball launcher that moves horizontally along the bottom of the screen and launches balls up the screen. The game is lost when the balls reach the holes at the bottom of the screen.

Several power-up balls alter the gameplay. For example, there are balls to rewind the time or remove all the balls from the playfield.

sample_screenshots.caption: A "fire gun" power-up falls from the top of the screen

title: Zuba
